review_body: After several negative iterations with Priceline and the hotel on the refund of my booking that had to be canceled due to international travel ban, the Hotel management agreed to a full refund. Thank you!

Rooms aren’t spacious, but the service and quality is second to none. Restaurant is fantastic, and the staff was wonderful during a lot of uncertain times. The virus changed our plans, but the staff took wonderful care of us.

Can't say enough about our stay and the staff. They were so professional, courteous, warm and friendly. The room was beautiful and very clean and had everything needed. The location was great. The restaurant downstairs, Farm to Burger, had great food, great staff, a nice atmosphere and was convenient and well priced. The rooftop bar, Irving on the Hudson, was beautiful with a great view and the drinks, food and staff were amazing.

Up charged to check in prior to 4:00 check in although room is ready . I’m a frequent business traveler and have never experienced this in my previous stay with the Aliz Left checked luggage unattended in middle of lobby . When asking the same Desk clerk is that where checked luggage is stored he replied unapologetically, “No, we have a secured area we put it in .:/

It is in a great central location, but the street was actually relatively quiet. Attractive looking décor. Spotlessly clean throughout the whole hotel. Peaceful in the room, 18th floor no view. Comfortable beds. Nice complimentary coffee/tea machine. Yes, the room was small, but adequate and well equipped. The shower was good. Great views from top of hotel and probably from many rooms.Some staff were indifferent, some were very friendly, no different to all walks of life. The restaurant was a little lacking, it was very quiet, therefore lacking atmosphere and the staff were maybe not very well trained, constantly looking to see if we had finished eating, waiting to clear! The décor was interesting, it was a little expensive for what was available, but the food was tasty. Take a left out of the hotel and near the end of the street was a coffee shop selling goods much cheaper than Costa etc. No complaints at all, we would stay at this hotel again.

If you want to stay near times square this is your hotel. Nice hotel, with nice rooms at the best location. Rooms are small but well equipped. Very comfortable but soft beds. Well equipped bathroom with good water power.The daily cleaning of the room is not the best.

I booked a deluxe king room. The room is nice but quite smallbut it's OK as we are in Manhattan. Well located hotel. Noce bathroom but with shower only. 36th floor, beautiful view. 3 fairly fast elevators.Several problems:1. There was an air leak around the bedroom door which produces a hissing sound that can be heard very well. The second night, this hissing woke me up and kept me awake for part of the night. 2. Surprise, they charge $30 per day for coffee in the room, 2 bottles of 330ml of water per day, access to the Business Center (included elsewhere when available), to the Cycling studio (included where available), 3 tokens 20% discount at the restaurant and 10% on certain items on sale. Most people do not use these services. It ends up to $15 a bottle of water a day. Almost theft...3. Saturday evening, party on the 40th floor. From my room I hear the percussion of the music and the people screaming. Luckyly, the music stoppes short after 11:00 PM4. That Saturday evening, for the party, an elevator was reserved. Long delays for other customers who only have 2 elevators left.5. I Don't know what fabric is used for the top sheet of the bed but it was FULL of static electricity! Each time I was touching it I was having an electricity chock. I had to remove it from the bed.6. With my reservation, I received a coupon for a special gift (not knowing what it was). I showed it at the registration desk and they said they will took care of that. Don't know what it was.No way I'll go back to this hotel.

The staff were all very accommodating Edwin and Zak would always make sure things were ok or if anything they could do to help with our stay. We arrived and they were right there helping with luggage. The front desk always answered all questions or printed out recommended restaurants.As expected rooms were small but very clean and organized for putting luggage in. Close to Times Square and Madison Square Garden. The 40 the floor lounge was great to meet up and have cocktails with our friends and the view was amazing.

This hotel would be great if you only have one or two people in a room. We had 4 and it was horrible. The hotel is nice but not well laid out or family friendly. The bar in the lobby is tiny as is the exercise room.

Took my mom to NYC for a girls trip. She loves to be in the thick of things so I searched for the perfect location. This was IT! It's super close to all the theaters and Times Square. It is right across the street from the Port Authority/bus terminal but we did not feel unsafe. Hotel was clean and service as great. The FarmtoBurger restaurant was fabulous. Best waffle I've EVER had. And the rooftop bar was simply exquisite. We will stay here again.

Stayed for 2 nights here in the hotel, check in not until 4pm , although our room was ready we cud have checked in earlier, but of course would have to pay more money to do this, not good service charging extra when the room is ready? After an international flight!! So we waited until 4om out of principle, the girl on check in was not friendly, that's when we found out about the "destination fee" 34 dollars per night plus 150 deposit! This was not something I had budgeted for on my trip! She didn't explain what it was for? Explain what floor we are on, that there was a gym, nothing.The room was nice and clean but as other reviews say it was small, this is is OK for 2 people but not with 4 big suitcases, can't be stored under the bed.The bed was big but mattress dipped down in the middle so was slanted, needs to be replaced. I felt the room constantly cold even with the heating system on, there was a very cold draft coming in the window, could only leave heat on for a short time as it was dry air and in a small room it just stung my eyes after 20 mins.Housekeeping were great our room was serviced everyday!The roof top bar has beautiful views but is expensive at 17-18 dollars a drink, plus tax and tip. Not part of the hotel so you need to reserve with staff in the lobby beside the lift. Good location about 8 min walk into centre but quite area so didn't have much noise at night, didnt see any dangerous characters around hotel which was mentioned in other reviews. Felt safe. Fiji water in room complimentary, Not big bottle though that cost 8 dollars Didn't eat in the hotel so can't comment on that.

We stayed here for 4 nights whilst visiting NYC. The location is fab. We used the airtrain/tube to get into the city and walked out to find the hotel just at the side of the tube station. The central location is great for exploring the city and is just off Times Square. This does mean it is busy and that there are homeless people close by as other reviews have commented but this is true of many places in this location and we did not feel unsafe at any point. The rooms are small but are very clean and have everything you need. The bed is large and was the most comfortable I have ever slept in!! The hotel staff were very helpful and polite. The rooftop bar has brilliant views of the Empire State and the city generally. The destination tax is high but I guess not down to the hotel itself. We were given tokens for 20% off food and drinks but they could not be used at the rooftop bar which I think they should be. However, I could not really fault the hotel overall. The rooms could be bigger but the size is understandable when considering the location. Would recommend. If you are not staying here then definitely give the bar a visit.

This hotel is part if the "Preferred Hotels and Resorts" portfolio. We normally stay at another PHR hotel but it was booked. The location was surprisingly convenient to most mid-town spots. The proximity to the Port Authority Bus Terminal may turn some people away, but it wasn't an issue.Interestingly - there are only 8 rooms per floor, so you get a sense that this is a smaller (boutique) hotel. But this is a tall hotel and you'll wait several passes for space on an elevator during peak times. Rooms - Typical NYC size (small), but very cleverly laid out. Great use of mirrors to make the room appear larger. Good storage, power outlets/USB, and lighting.The "roof top" bar is nice. Good drinks, great views.The "fitness center" is only good if you want to do virtual spin class, so make sure you pack gear so you can take advantage of one of the resort fee services.Staff was generally very helpful, but the Front desk seemed a little moody. Sometimes I felt like asking a question was an inconvenience for them. The lobby can get very crowed during checkout/check in so plan accordingly. They will hold your bags if needed.

The hotel was convenient to all meetings around Manhattan. The room is small but modern and super clean. Found front desk staff to be very friendly and helpful. Rooftop bar was nice, wait staff in restaurant very attentive. Good value.

I’ll start with the positive. Good location. Good coffee pods/coffee maker in the room. They had a room for early check-in well before 4pm. Room was quiet.Now for the disappointments. The biggest is the mattress in my room was well overdue for replacing. I was at this hotel for 6 nights and I did not sleep well. You know those indentations on beds, where the mattress needs to be turned or flipped or replaced. On the second day, I mentioned this to the front desk. They said they’d report it. But nothing was done to improve the situation and I mentioned it again when I checked out. The response was, “we have in our notes we reported it.” The bedding in the room was ok, not luxurious. The comforter was thin. No blankets. So, you may have to run the room warmer than you might otherwise choose to do so, When I checked into my room, the thermostat and heater was not working. It would only blow cold. I had to call for engineering staff to come fix it. They actually disconnected the thermostat and asked me to manually operate the radiator during my stay. On the first night they did not clean the room. Be careful that the wall switch for “do not disturb” is left on by a prior guest. This is what happened to me. When I asked for refreshed coffee from the front desk they gave me a couple of pods, I didn’t know until the next morning, they’d given me decaf. When I returned to the front desk, I was told they didn’t have regular coffee replacement pods, only decaf at the front desk. Huh? I waited and waited and they couldn’t find their runner to bring some to the desk. I told them to forget doing it, but soon while I was getting ready for work, they knocked on my door to deliver some coffee pods. Amenities in the bathroom are ok, a bit too scented. No shower caps provided. They don’t provide complimentary water, but there was water available with a $8 per bottle cost attached. Go to Duane Reade and buy a gallon for $2.00. The bathroom is fine. However the shower is the type where half the wall is glass, so you need to reach in to turn on the water. Make sure the shower head is pointed to the wall (every morning) because you will get snow with cold water...and if you’re in you Pajamas you’ll be annoyed they got all wet. This is what happened when I went to take my first shower there. If you travel a lot, you are familiar with these small spaces and the solid wall barriers that don’t easily allow you to access knobs etc. I travel a lot. And I love trying out new hotels. I had read good things about Aliz and was looking forward to trying it. This was one of my most disappointing hotel stays in NY I have experienced. (And when I checked in, I told them I was an avid trip advisor reviewer.) The biggest deal was the bad mattress. That is unacceptable.

We were able to check in early on a Saturday afternoon. Thank you! The check-in process was smooth. The room was small but well laid out. The overall experience was very positive. We visited Dear Irving - the cocktail bar on the 40th floor. Wow! Lovely bar with views of the city. But the highlight of my stay was the service I received from Marcus a the front desk. He was so patient with providing directions and it was clear that he enjoyed his job. Thank you Marcus for your positive energy and big smile. You made our stay extra special!

Had a nice time, but was charged for a bathrobe I never touched, the $8 bottle of water, and another mysterious charge after check out. I called and asked what the charge was for and could not get a clear answer. I would suggest a walk through with management upon check out.

The hotel is close to everything. The beds are amazingly comfortable and the staff is super friendly, helpful and courteous!! The rooms are a bit small but, the space is well thought out. Two people are able to fit comfortably. I would definitely recommend this place!!

Their amazing cuisine and access to unique city views from their rootfop bar and lounge can make every engagement absolutely unique and unforgettable! Their personnel is friendly and professional. Absolutely recommend this hotel!

Overall rating - 3 stars. Location - convenient but a little bit sketchy. Room - neat and clean but small. Front Desk Staff - they're ok. (from my experience) they're not friendly, kinda sad. Lobby - during our stay there's a lot of drunk people at elevators because of the bar at 40th floor. I hope they also consider the safety of the in-house guest.Housekeeping - they're amazing! 5 stars for them.

I stayed at this hotel several times and always loved the experience. The rooms are slightly small but very modern with amazing views on upper floors. The rooftop bar is just amazing. The location is extremely central but there are some dodgy characters around the hotel at night time. The lobby is tiny and usually too crowded. The best thing about this hotel are its stunning views.

This hotel was amazing, and is everything you can ask for. Easily Accessible to main Subway lines, only steps away from Times Square, and an overall amazing experience, with the room cleanliness, staff assistance, and quality stay.

I had problem on arrival due to traffic had no place to put the car the reception took my car and for me to get my phone that was inside the car the manager did not even want to know charged me 80 dollars

Hotel room is big, clean and very nice looking! I suggest requesting the room with the balcony also!The robe they give you is so nice too I even bought it, I suggest it!!!!Staff is amazing and quick to serve you! I can’t wait to come back!!

Perfect trip, perfect hotel! We would definitely come back again. Close to everything in Times Square. Nice bar right upstairs. Breakfast, lunch, and dinner optional right in the restaurant in the hotel. You can walk to everything in Times Square. Wonderful time all around.

We stayed here for 4 nights at the start of December. It was our first time to New York so wanted to be central. The location was perfect, Times Square is hectic but this spot was great for us. The hotel was lovely and clean, the room was fairly basic but all you need for a city break. We had a king room but it was still quiet small. The hotel bar was lovely. Justin the Barman was fab and they have an extensive range of drinks available. The views from here was amazing and well worth seeing!

Great location, hotel staff friendly and knowledgeable. Close to Times Square and the Theater district so you can shop all day and then go to see a Broadway show. Nice clean hotel would definitely stay again.

Aliz Hotel is stylish and comfortable. located a short walk from Times Square and Broadway theaters. Rooms are tiny (expected in midtown Manhatten), but well appointed (coffeemaker, clothes steamer, blow dryer, bathrobe) and spotless. Bed was very comfortable and bathroom large enough. Our room had a large balcony, which would be nice in warmer weather. Staff were efficient and obliging, whether at the front desk, valet parking, or bell captain. There is a restaurant featuring mostly burgers (including veg), which we did not try, as there are hundreds of restaurants within an easy walk. Some small disadvantages: almost no hanging or drawer space for clothes in room, very busy lobby, and sometimes a long wait for the elevator due to a popular bar on the 40th floor.

From the moment that we arrived to the seconds before leaving our rooms, the stay at this hotel has to rank among the worst in the experience of traveling with my family. We had 2 rooms (we explicitly asked several times, even calling the hotel twice in advance, to ensure they were adjoining) and spent 5 nights here ...and about 5 thousand dollars for an incredibly stressful stay. Elevators don't work and have 10 minute waiting times; Workout room smells like mold; the waitstaff and hotel workers aren't empowered or aware of the services or the area; Food (even with the bogus poker chips they give you - they give you a discount) is mediocre at best. Avoid this place...so many better options and experiences around this area...or better yet stay in a different and better part of town!

Having read some of the previous reviews about this hotel I was somewhat sceptical about staying here. But I was pleasantly surprised. The entire stay was just, easy. The location is well within the madness of Times Square. There are some unsavoury looking characters loitering outside, especially early in the morning. But if that does not bother you I would not worry. The staff were polite and efficient. The hotel was very clean (which is a big thing for me, it was spotless). Everything was modern and the room service tidied our room every day and replaced the towels. The rooms are a tight squeeze but it is a new hotel so naturally theyve crammed in as much onto the floor plan as possible. Payment at the hotel was simple enough and the $150 credit card hold was returned within 5 days. I would not stay here again, it was simply the location that swayed me away. I was satisfied with my stay though. Thank you.

review_body: Hotel & staff were great, accommodating. Room was standard relative to similar hotels & clean, comfortable. No issues with noise. Crowded during check out but staff handled it well. Neighborhood is turning over for the better but there is an adult video store & liquor store nearby so turn a blind eye if kids are in tow.

The hotel in general is fine but rooms are very narrow. That was my first time to NY and I'm not sure if all other hotels are having the same issue or not. Also I didn't like the loudness of music in lobby. Gave me the feeling I'm entering a discotheque.

NYC 12/22-12/23 for an overnight Bday celebration with my husband and 2teen girls. I chose the Aliz Hotel through Hotel.com .its close to Madison Square Garden about 10mins walk. A lot of restaurants in 5-10min walk. The hotel lobby is small nice with modern furnishings. it was too small for the traffic of guest coming in and out,with only 2 attendants. The 3 elevators are small and you have to wait a long while to get on. If you are going on an off busy weekday or weekend it may be more accommodating. The rooms and bathroom are small for a family of 4 but very nice clean modern.I think for 2 people it’s perfect. The beds were double beds, too small for 2 adults. Not very comfortable. In general it was a nice stay, but for a return of a family of 4 it’s a no for me.

The staff went out of their way to be friendly and helpful. The breakfast offered with the room was amazing. Not your typical hotel food in any way. The rooms were a tad smaller than would have liked but very clean , rooftop bar with view was lovely. I just can’t say enough good things about the staff. There is a subway just steps from hotel which was a huge advantage to buzzing around the city

Room was tiny but had very nice details, including a terrace w chairs! The weather was a bit chilly to make use of it, but maybe next time! They accommodated an early check in too, so no complaints from me

A real gem of a hotel near The Port Authority and Times Square.Modern and clean with super friendly staff .Bathroom and bed were great .had a r oom on the 24th floor with a great view of uptown.Soent a couple of hours in Hudson watching the sun go diwn- superb view and great staff.Definitely a place to consider for value,cleanliness, helpful staff and great location .

review_body: Fabulous stay at Aliz Hotel. We stayed in the Deluxe King guest room, and we had a lovely view of the Empire State building and parts of the city and river. The room had everything we needed, really comfortable bed, great shower and bathroom, coffee machine, plenty of space and not to mention spotless. It was exactly what we wanted. Staff were so friendly and extremely helpful, especially during check in and out. A kind member of staff checked us out even while there was a queue, ordered us a private airport taxi and stored our luggage until we needed to collect it ( I wish I could remember his name). The rooftop bar has exceptional views of the city and a great selection of beverages and the interior throughout the entire hotel is very chic and stylish. The location is fab!!! So easy to get around the city and located near two main stations. We had a great experience here and we LOVED New York!! We cannot wait to visit again. Highly recommended

Didn’t clean the room every morning although it was in agreement Didn’t allowed us to go up to the view pointCharged us with a fee at check out that wasn’t mentioned in agreement We don’t recommend as a family choice

We loved this hotel! It’s so close to Times Square and a ton of great places to eat. The restaurant downstairs is good, but the tip is included even with only 4 people and the service wasn’t worth that high of a tip. The rooms are very nice and the view is amazing. We found we had plenty of room for all four of us. Not only was the hotel amazing, but the staff was FANTASTIC! Every question we had got answered, every recommendation we got was spot on, and they went the extra mile. We were going to pay over $70 to Uber to LGA, but the Bell Ambassador, Kalsang, told us they had a service that was much cheaper to take us to the airport. Not only did he help us a find a ride, but he worked every day we were here and always checked in with us. He was so kind and it did not go unnoticed. We’re already planning our trip back to NY and will definitely be staying here again!!

This was my third visit to New York, first two was with the Royal Navy and don't remember much about them for some reason. The hotel is 2 blocks from times square so only a quick walk to see the sights but its location next to the coach station is not the best.They do provide a coffee pod machine in the room but plastic cups and not much coffee. Room was clean as it should be but tiny by European standards.Would i stay here again probably not but I don't see myself visiting NY again.

I stayed 6 nights at this hotel for business reasons and I fully regret it.The hotel rooms and the location of this hotel is rather ok. It’s very close to Times Sq, but the location opposite to Port Authority Bus Terminal is not necessarily the nicest area, especially at night. No complimentary water is provided on the room, and coffee capsules and bath amenities were not provided sufficiently (some days, was just forgotten to refill). Checkout times are bit ridiculous: you can only CheckIn at 4pm but have to leave already at 11am. Market standard in NY is 3pm CheckIn and 12am checkout. Don’t know why they take their right to cut your stay by 2 hours.But overall, I am shocked by the lack of customer service and unfriendliness of front desk staff in this hotel. I can absolutely not understand previous reviews which praised the friendliness...One night, a hotel staff was painting the walls on my floor right in front of my room. I gently asked at 9:45pm (evening!!) to stop it, but the staff just responded he cannot stop without his management approval. So, I called front desk to inform them about and they said they will take care. As you can imagine, nothing happened. I briefly feel asleep but the ongoing noise woke me up again at 1am in the middle of the night. I complained with the staff about the situation and asked to immediately stop it. Another call at front desk, another time they promised to take care. I was really close to calling the police, and at around 1:45am, the work finally ended. Next morning, I approached front desk and asked for some kind of compensation (ie deduction of this single night from the final bill). Nothing, not even a „sorry for that“. I sent a formal complaint email to the hotel management which was not even responded to. Either front desk staff did not forward to management to avoid raising awareness of this, or even worse, management received and just did not react.This is completely unacceptable and I already told my company to stop supposing this hotel for future business travels. This hotel is really giving nothing about its customers. Finally, even after all above, a real late checkout was not granted. They generously offered 12:30 whereas other hotels would easily give you 2/3pm. As they absolutely don’t take care, at the day of checkout, housekeeping knocked at the door at 9am and then again at 12am to clean the room. This again shows how careless they are.What also annoys is that the three customer lifts are regularly used by housekeeping staff with their trolleys which often makes your lift journey an endless one. Don’t know why they don’t have a separate housekeeping and staff elevator, this would ease the lift situation.

I stayed two nights in this hotel.Positive points:- very good location close to Times Square- newly renovated- spacious rooms- very nice roof top barNegative points:- not great value for money ($325 + taxes for a standard room)- super slow elevators (7-8min waiting time in average)- spacious bathroom but practically no storage space around the sink (not even for the toothbrush!)- very unpleasant staff at the roof top bar. I was alone, and although many tables (at least 5) were empty, the staff asked me just to stand for a drink and not be seated ?! I insisted but he was apparently stressed because he repeated the same message like a robot!So I think there are many other options in the same area with a better value for money ratio.

Only positive review i can say about this hotel is the location is great. I booked a deluxe king and was expecting a lovely room, the room was so tiny my bathroom back is bigger, i was with my wife and we couldn't even walk pass each other without having to step aside so one could pass. Lets talk about housekeeping that was a joke, they even missed us on oneday so we had to clean up, other occasions they didn't leave cups for the tea and coffee we had to ask and we only ever had shower mat after the 2nd day it was dirty but we never saw another one. Wouldn't reccomend this hotel to anybody.

The Aliz hotel is very nice, but the walk to Times Square is through a rough area for several blocks. Our room charges were much higher than what we booked through Priceline. Must be better options in the area.

Staff extremely helpful & friendly, always available if you needed anything, which made it a very pleasurable stay. Rooms were very clean & serviced daily, we did have to request more toiletries though, which were delivered within 10 minutes.

review_body: Warm, welcoming, friendly and helpful staff. Amazing food in the ground floor restaurant. Our bedroom was quite a spacious room for a city hotel, not big but larger than I expected. Will definitely stay again if visiting New York.

We enjoyed our time at the Aliz Hotel, great location and overall a great hotel! Concerned staff, always ready to help when needed. Walking distance to Time Square, Rockefeller Center, Javits Convention Center and Central Park.

This was our 20th visit to NYC and each time we have stayed in a different hotel. This is by far the smallest room we have ever encountered anywhere we have been in the world, let alone New York. The closet is a small cupboard which also houses the coffee making machine and does not have enough room to hang anything more than 6-7 items WITHOUT jackets or coats etc. I had to hang most of my clothes on anything that would take a hanger in the bedroom or bathroom.When I complained, we were moved to a disability room which we were told was larger. The only difference was, you could walk around the bed without tripping over your suitcase. The bathroom was larger but there was absolutely nowhere to put your toiletries. No shelves, nothing. Not even a glass to place our toothbrushes so that and everything else had to be placed on the floor which was disgusting. I have never experienced anything like this in a hotel in my life!Although the receptionist was really lovely when I complained, she said that one of the hotels main selling points is it’s location to Times Square. This I don’t understand because like someone else has mentioned in a previous review, it’s a good 12 minutes walk to Times Square plus the street it’s on is horrible. We were really looking forward to this hotel but we checked out three days early even though it was all paid for. We felt so claustrophobic.

The Hotel is well located, next to Time Square and Port Authority Bus Station. Despite of the chaotic location, once you get in, the Hotel is noiseless!!!!The rooms are little and comfortable, but there is a too little wardrobe!!!!

My stay was only one night however, The hotel staff were more than accommodating.The rooms were beautifully put together and the bed was amazing! I would not hesitate to stay at this hotel again when I return to NYC

Great hotel with an amazing rooftop bar/lounge! Perfect for Time Square tourism and convenient to subway. Walking distance to tons of great restaurants and attractions. Staff was very welcoming and friendly. They gave great suggestions!

I hear all the rooms are small in New York but this is probably the smallest room we have stayed in. Tiny cupboard space so not enough places to put your clothes. We asked for a balcony room expecting to get views but it was on floor 4 looking at a back of a building. The bed was comfortable and pillows were good too :)Downstairs lobby was nice but they need to extend that same style and feel into the cafe/lunch area as it’s a bit clinical and cold. Breakfast choice was not appealing either.Upstairs bar was the highlight of this hotel! Great views. Beautifully presented and comfortable chairs - would recommend this part for sure!!Need to improve on the espresso martini’s - too much syrup ;)

Arrived to just one member of staff on the counter, meaning we waited 25 minutes to be served. The small ‘king’ bedroom had a lovely view of a car park and just about enough room to walk around the bed- as long as you hadn’t got a suitcase with you! The plus points the room was clean and as long as you turn right out of the front door of the hotel it’s a nice location. Rooftop bar was lovely, but expensive. I thought the hotel was overpriced and isn’t actually on Times Square - it’s a 12 minute walk!

Will definitely stay here again. Loved the staff. Enjoyed great food at the Farm to Burger restaurant. Dear Irving on the Hudson is a must see scenic bar of NYC with delicious appetizers and cocktails. Great location.

My mom and I ate at the restaurant at this hotel Thanksgiving night... we were looking for a nearby restaurant from our hotel that was open on the holiday . My mom had some issues with her burger... it was wrong twice and she had to send it back to the kitchen twice. But I want to say that the restaurant manager was super helpful, accommodating, apologetic, and responsive to the situation. He came and checked in with us, took my mom's burger off the tab and offered us free wine to boot. On another note, I had a salmon Caesar salad and it was delicious and the fries were good too. Thank you for being so helpful, I do recommend!

The hotel was perfect for our stay in NY. Location wise it’s just above the subway for easy connection from the airports and it’s only a block away from Times Square. Head left out the door and your in a less touristy part of NY for a different experience! The hotel itself is beautiful inside and the rooms are well appointed and comfy. The 40th floor restaurant and bar is spectacular with an awesome view. Overall we had a great time - getting engaged while in New York too - so it was a stay we will never forget!

Easy from airport to hotel... location could not be beat and accommodations were outstanding! Made our trip easy and most enjoyable! Subway was close and Time Square along with shows were walking distance...

Great experience. The location was central for a great dinner and a brisk morning walk to Hudson Yards. The modern room was just what we needed -clean, comfortable bed, plenty of towels and morning coffee. Loved the chic lounge on the 40th floor and the amazing breakfast at Farm to Burger. We asked for late check out and were effortlessly accommodated.

Highly recommended. Was able to check in on arrival at 1.30pm which gave us extra time to go and explore. We ate in Farm to Burger the first night, service and food was excellent. Everyday on return to our room we had fresh towels and linen. Bed was comfy after a long day sightseeing. Hotel bar had fantastic views over manhatten.

Rooms too small. Too expensive.Street full of homeless.when we arrived to make the check in the persona was unpleasant. I did not recomend this hotel at all. The breakfast with out fresh fruit. I did not like it.

Nice hotel for a business trip with an excellent rooftop view. Rooms are rather small, yet modern and well equipped although I missed an iron in the room. Choice of breakfast could be improved, but all in all this is a very nice place. The air-conditioning was very loud.

Excellent location and staff. They all deserve a raise or a nice Christmas Bonus! Rooms were clean and the staff was accommodating. The hotel is nicely located in the middle of Times Square. the hotel is vey close to the Subway and food places all around.

The Aliz is stylish and well-maintained, and the staff was outstanding every step of the way. The rooms were rather small - my roommate and I were in a standard double-queen and couldn't imaging having 2 more people with us - but nicely done. Enjoyed breakfast in the restaurant both mornings and snacks at the rooftop bar the last evening of our stay.

It was my first time to NYC and it was wonderful. I booked the hotel in booking.com by reading great reviews by other people and they were right.Everything was wonderful begining with the service and wonderful food in the restaurant!I will definitely come back to NYC and to this hotel and reccomend it to everyone I know that, that are planning to come to NYC!

I rate it 4.5 /5 Great place to stay while in NYC. Easily accessible to everything, friendly staff who are very eager to assist. restaurant, bar, quick snack bar and night spot all in one location. Worth checking out!

The room was a good size for a NY hotel room, it was clean with a great coffee machine. It was in a good location and staff were very helpful. The only slight down side was the liquor store two doors up, however even though people were hanging about there nobody bothered us either going in or out of the hotel.

Exceptionally clean modern hotel. Room was as expected. Air con dries you out though as windows don't open.Booked on the basis of a gym (it's peleton bikes only) and rooftop bar. Be aware you need to book the bar on arrival as it hosts private parties and is not solely for residents. You also have to return to lobby for access via the staff booking the bar who are seperate from hotel. Bar is spectacular but pricey.

What an amazing place. We stayed in a deluxe king with balcony room, beautiful view from a large balcony. Dear Irving in Hudson on the 41st floor was absolutely amazing with a beautiful view of the city. Definitely will be back. 10/10! I recommend staying here!

Stayed here for the Champions Classic college basketball games at Madison Square Garden. Perfectly situated between Times Square and MSG so we had plenty to do. Extremely accommodating, our room was ready at 12:30 even though check in was 4pm. Rooms were a bit small but in NY I expected that. Despite the smaller room size it had everything you needed from comfy beds, a nice flat screen tv, view of the Empire State Building, and an immaculate shower and bathroom. The only regret was we only had 1 night to stay but we throughly enjoyed our stay and would stay again in a heartbeat.

I found this hotel on Hotel Tonight App last minute. I am very happy that I came across this after what was a difficult afternoon in a very poor and dirty hotel elsewhere. The reception and welcoming staff were very friendly and helpful. Farm to burger serve very tasty burgers. The rooftop bar is very nice with great views however here expect some of the cocktail bartenders to be rude and or self-indulgent (some not all)

A very jam-packed visit to NYC... thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the hotel. Originally had a room on the 8th floor although our view overlooked a car park so we requested to move higher which they did for us the next day to the 18th floor. We ate at the restaurant once and visited the rooftop bar twice (once at night and once in the day) which was absolutely amazing!! Perfect views of the skyline and delicious cocktails. The reception of the hotel is lovely, with a beautiful scent as you walk in. I would really recommend this hotel due to its location mainly but the service is exceptional...

Loved the room. The view from the roof top bar is amazing. The house keeper was so friendly and kept our room immaculately clean. The breakfasts were lovely and all the staff were friendly. Thank you for making our stay in New York a pleasant one.

I stayed at your hotel last year and returned again. this stay was not even similar to my last stay. We received a room that was dirty with objects of the last visitors. The bathroom door was stuck and we always had to struggle with opening it. also, the shower handle was stuck and was very annoying.The hotel was so proud of his rooftop bar, but it was very disappointing. I came to town for business and wanted to book tables at the bar for 30 people. The hotel told me to contact some guy named Roman that was very rude and not helpful. He did not want to meet and wanted to contact only via emails. He was not helpful at all and gave me short answers like he is doing me a favor. After about 20 emails he told me that I must commit to spending $ 4500 for booking tables at the bar!!and then he stopped answering! weird guy.I guess there won't be the third time.

Check-in is 4pm, yet they didn't have a room available until 5:45pm. Several other guests had this experience, as well, and the staff was indifferent at best. Also, while the room was very clean, it was TINY. I measured it. 10 x 11 feet. This was a KING room.

Checked in and waited at least 7 minutes for a lift to get to our room and then a bell boy pushed his way past and got on the lift first with an empty cart. When in the lift you have to use your room key to put in your floor number (new to me) so rude woman wouldn't move to let me do this to start with turns out she was front of house staff. Then the room think of a first class stamp and you have the size of the room. if we had any suit cases we would NOT have been able to move. 1 robe in a room booked for 2 had to call down (small thing ) but all adding up .We wanted to use the roof top bar so from our 22nd floor room we had to go to the lobby and ask to go to the 41st floor and then being told there was no tables for 2 for an hour (buy the rude woman from the lift)to which I said you have got to be joking to then be told you I should have booked it when checked in (not told)we went to sit at the bar got told there was a table so went up to find it have empty with lots of tables . Room was clean and a good breakfast with nice staff that's was the only good things from our stay.

review_body: Good location. Comfy beds. Efficient room despite small in size. Rooms in high floors have good view, ours was on 34th floor. Roof bar is advertised a lot, I am sure the view is very good as my room has a good view even with a narrow angle window. However, I could not make the bar. The only reservation method is online for the roof (as I am directed by the reception) and the online application does not work properly for international phone numbers:( I looked for more human touch for issues faced.

Last week my son and 2 friends stayed 3 nights at this hotel in a room I reserved for them advertised as accessible which proved sadly lacking in equipment. The hotel staff were lacking in simple human empathy and integrity to any client let alone one with a disability! My son uses a wheelchair so this was a major factor in choosing this hotel. The first issue - the lack of a shower chair (as noted in ADA requirements) was frustrating and made worse by the fact that the front desk clerk never called back after the request was made. When my son called again he was told that there wasn’t any available. After 1.5 hrs. a shower stool was brought allowing my son to finally have a shower but in a dangerous way-this was just the beginning of a nightmarish weekend! The night manager was totally non-apologetic yet offered to move the guys to a new and better equipped room the next morning and 3 times they packed up their stuff only to be told again and again throughout the weekend that no better room was available.. What a disappointment for any client expecting the minimum in customer services...

I have encountered problem on my reservation and I communicated through email. They responded my email promptly and provide consideration to my request. Thanks to Yakima to accomodate my request. Great customer service!! Thank you so much!!

Bandar Seri Begawan, Brunei Darussalam

review_body: We checked in early in the morning , pretty tired and waited for the check in until 2 pm . Staff told us we can could check in immediately for a lower floor although 31st floor has been blocked for us . Since we will be staying with the hotel for 8 nights , we said we are willing to wait , for a chance to have a better view of NY . So we went for a walk nearby and came back at 5 pm only to find out that we still have to check in to a lower floor because the higher floor room is no longer available. Staff attitude is basically you get it or leave it . Very funny . Room is small , not cheap , with some surcharge we only knew later , and no hot water kettle . Anyway , we will not be going back to this hotel any more .

The hotel is lack of customer service. They didn’t provide accessibility room even when the declared that the room is accessible. It took them 2 hours to bring chair for taking a shower and after that they a very bad attitude concerning their mistake. The next day forgot to move us room and also the day after the didn't bother to do so. They even removed the chair helping me to take a shower. Bad elevators and small rooms. It was very bad experience especially from the staff.Won’t go there again that’s for sure

I was really impressed with Aliz. The bed was incredibly comfortable, everything was spotless, and there were USB charging ports everywhere. There were plenty of towels, a TV with actual channels, and a courteous and professional staff. The soundproofing was fairly good; I only heard normal hotel noise rather than NYC street noise. For New York standards, my room was big. (If you haven’t stayed in NYC before, please know that rooms are generally tiny.) Also, be aware that almost all NYC hotels charge a “destination fee” on top of their base room rate; this is a normal practice and the Aliz is no exception.

Hotel is a true 4 star, I would like to see some cheaper prices in Manhattan but that's not gonna happen, this place was on of the cheapest for the night we chose, everyone of the staff were great and very helpful when we needed them, the roof top bar was great with wonderful views, the beds were like sleeping on clouds.

It was okay! Not worthy the money! Rooms are too small! And the bathroom and room have no space so it’s awkward! The room was so cramped that with your bags in the room you can’t walk in the room freely

Location is excellent. Room beautifully appointed - comfortable bed. View from our room on the 23rd floor was beautiful not to mention the breathtaking views of Downton Manhattan from the rooftop bar. Staff were extremely helpful and nothing was too much trouble.

We had a great experience during out stay. Rooms were super clean, and the views from the bar on top floor were spectacular. The hotel is convince the located very close to time square, subway stations.

The Aliz is located on 40th and 8th so very central. Having previously stayed at the Distrikt we were aware of the undesirables who are around the area so didn’t put us off but was a little intimidating. Room very clean, bed super comfy and shower great. Couple of issues with housekeeping on first 2 days but fine after then. Didn’t use the bar on the 40th/41st floor but looked amazing. Slight pain that you can’t get there yourself without the staff having to swipe the lift. All in all great trip to the Aliz and reasonably priced.

Our room was very clean. Bathroom was spacious. Linens were comfortable. The staff was so friendly and accommodating. Our room was very quiet. Everything you'd expect and more. We enjoyed this hotel very much.

The rooms are cozy and the overall service is great. The staff will provide support for all your needs.The location s very strategic to get around manhattan (and even other areas).I would suggest d to ask for a high floor.The gym is only bikes but great ones.

My company booked this hotel for me as it fell within the allotted lodging budget. When I arrived at check-in I was told there was an additional $30 "Destination Fee" about $35.00 with taxes! My company would not cover this as it puts me outside the allocated budget. I ask the concierge what exactly a "Destination Fee" was and she gave me a card. The card notes "(2) Complimentary in-room bottles of Fiji Water", Business Center, Gym and some crappy discount on their restaurant. I told here I wouldn't need these services and asked if it was optional. It was not. So I was obligated to pay or forfeit my prepaid stay. That simple. Why this fee lives outside of the actual price of the room is beyond me. 2 bottles of Fiji water is certainly not $35.00 and their crappy "Business Center" and lackluster gym are not reasons to visit this hotel. You can print less at staples and NYSC has 7-day trials. Management has certainly put their staff in a crappy situation. I cannot imagine having to mansplain their bananas hidden fee every time a guest arrives. This is the opposite of customer service.

The hotel room, although nicely furnished, was way too small considering the price. I imagine that this is due to its close location to Times Square. The room was so small that we had to continually move our suitcases when we needed to walk around the bed.What was most disappointing is that we were celebrating our 25th wedding anniversary and had asked on the booking for a room with a view. In fact we were allocated a room on the sixth floor with a view of concrete, we were too tired from travelling to ask for a change.Hotel staff were polite and friendly enough, but the two guys organising luggage and transfers were exceptional. However I thought that the restaurant staff were sometimes indifferent, maybe a NYC trait. Bar on the 40th floor is superb.In summary I would not book the hotel Aliz again, there are far better value hotels within a short walk of Times Square.

Amenities like shower gel, shampoo, moisturiser not replaced since day 1 although I was staying for 4N. Put in request for high floors with open view but got placed on 12 with window facing to very close building. Found out water in room is NOT complimentary and chargeble at $8/bottle! Total rip off!

Poor service from front desk, room service took forever (restaurant downstairs), beds are in desperate need of replacing. Rooms are fresh looking, steamer only, one wash cloth. Good location. Consider the AC a block away.

Stayed at this hotel for Columbus weekend, staff is extremely friendly and accommodating, rooms are small but very modern, CLEAN ! Great location if you want to be close enough to Times Square yet not too close to the noise. Definitely recommend this hotel and would stay there again!

Great hotel. Conveniently located. Comfortable, well-appointed rooms, clean rooms, bathroom was especially clean, and lovely, helpful staff. Will stay again! The restaurant was great. We had breakfast included and it was just very good.

The rooms were smaller than the square footage listed. I would’ve been better off at the Moxy or Pod. Rooms looked nice but the beds are worse than a motel due to their lumpiness and softness (you sink in and it sleeps HOT). Bathrooms were nice.

Just stayed here for 5 nights. Hotel is modern clean and in a great central location for exploring on my first trip to NYC. The rooms are very clean and the beds a both large and extremely comfortable. Staff were helpful and friendly. The roof top bar is a must to use. Amazing views from each side if the bar both uptown and downtown.

Great location and staff extremely friendly, professional and patient with everyone. Something very odd for NYC. Excellent restaurant and the best roof top bar with great view. Don’t miss it even if you decide not to stay there.

We spent 6 nights in Aliz Hotel. The room was small, but cozy. Hotel has beautiful and modern design, bathroom was super clean, also the room. Bed like airport, very soft, it was very good sleep there. We were impressed by the TV, great size for such a small room, we liked to watch movies from bed. We really appreciated USB charging on bedside table because we couldn’t connect our European plugs to socket (although we had interconnection, but for plug type B not A). I think, the room was ideal, we liked going back there after a long day in NYC. There is a bar on the 40th floor with great view on NY skyline, also on Empire State Building (we were able to see Statue of Liberty in distance too :) ) We were a few times for dinner in the hotel restaurant, where the menu is very simple but the better. We recommend burgers, the meat was one of the best we have ever eaten.Not to mention only the positives...we were slightly disappointed with the cold attitude of the receptionists...they were professionals but we didn’t feel very welcomed. There is another thing for which we may not return to this hotel….homeless people on the street next to the hotel. Homeless people, junkies, they pee and even worse thing they do right on the street. This situation is around the entire bus station and Times Square…we were so disgusted, that it ruined our stay in NYC. Of course, hotel is not responsible for this, but it is pity that such a luxury hotel has a neighborhood like that.

Very good hotel and rooms, nice staffPosition is central, but the street is dirty, sounds not safe, even if we were never annoyed and never felt threatened. it is not responsibility of the hotel, but what a pity.

Went to New York for Comic Con. The hotel was close to everything we wanted to do. The rooms were a little small for 4 people but affordable and the breakfast that was included was great. The drinks were a little expensive at hotel lobby bar and the rooftop bar.

I enjoyed the decor, staff and great location. People on the elevator ( staff and guests) were always friendly and accommodating. I'm so glad I decided to stay at this unique boutique hotel over one of the larger chains. I'll be back...I didn't get a chance to enjoy thr rooftop lounge due to a private event. I even got a pineapple lapel pin because I told the concierge I lived pineapples:-)

Low quality standardNo worth the money and the 4 stars rate (at least for a European citizen) Restrictive options at breakfast (it is not a buffet; you can choose only one option) Terrible vibe nearby/outdoors

Great price! Beautiful views! Prime location! Chic rooms with beautiful bathrooms! Overall hotel staff was wonderful. Valet parking was nice and convenient. Rooftop lounge is trendy and wonderful. They allow you to store your bags with them until midnight the night you leave even if you’ve already checked out! It’s so user friendly. Two small bottles of water included in your nightly price, just be careful because the big bottle is not included! Could do with more clothing/item space in room but wasn’t a big deal for us. I love how clean everything was. Not even a smudge on the mirrors. Our roomWas available early which was incredibly convenient! In terms of ending price, it just sucked because there were so many taxes and fees that it almostDoubled the price.

Hotel is really nice a bit of luxury. Rooms a little small but very comfortable, daily housekeeping was excellent.Staff were helpful and friendly. Rooftop bar amazing but small and always busy but a must to see the view. Lobby bar is really just a counter top with a couple of stools, don,t know why you cant sit in the restaurant as its hugh and was never busy. We found the restaurant menu very limited but there,s plenty of choice nearby. There,s no toilets in lobby or restaurant you have to get staff to open a door down to lower level but its worth the walk as they are spotless.

The overall experience with this hotel was great, staff was nice and helpful, hotel is clean, nice and comfortable, but the best feature of this hotel is their location, eveything was within walking distance for us, tours, transportation, activities, landmark just about everything very close by, the only thing I disagree with this hotel is the ridiculous DESTINATION FEE they charge @ $35.00 per day, it is already a pretty expensive hotel and to have to pay more for what very sarcastically they call "free amenities" is unreasonable. I did my reservation via Priceline and there was nothing in my reservation that warned me about this fee, so it gives you a feeling when you are checking in that your stay in NYC is not starting very well, but other than this issue, the hotel is great and our stay in NYC was the best.

The location is great for Times Square and access to the subway. The rooms are small but modern and clean with comfy beds and good quality linen and pillows. The closet in not big enough for 3 adults, we kept most of clothes in the suitcase for the duration. The rooftop bar is lovely however there is a sense of snootiness from some staff (not all). The bar is pricey but comparable with other places and they do offer and 2 for 1 between 3pm and 7pm. Just watch as they add the tip automatically to the bill. There are homeless people outside but that is pretty much the same everywhere in New York. I would stay again. I didn’t eat there but the menu looked good.

This hotel was a great find. About a 5 minute walk from Times Square, and maybe 10 minute walk from penn station. Beautiful, comfortable room with a cool view of the city from the 26th floor. Impeccably clean and quiet. Two free bottles of water which is always a plus! My flight landed early on a Friday morning and I was able to check in even before 10am, which was a pleasant surprise. There is a bar in the lobby, as well as a rooftop restaurant and bar which unfortunately I never had time to try. The only slight downside is the street the hotel faces feels a bit dirty/seedy being across from port authority, especially at night. However traveling as a single female I had no issues. Would consider staying again on my next trip to NYC!

Be warned stay somewhere else. Check-in experience was bad, arrived early to see if I could check-in but was told to come back at 4pm. Came back at 4pm, and was told to wait as the room was still not ready. This was a sign of things to come. 4:20pm was told the room was finally ready. Went to the room to find the room reeking of cheap cologne, smelled like teenagers using too much Axe body spray after gym class. Also, the room was obviously not used in a while as the tv was unplugged and the remote not working. Noise from the rooftop and adjoining room made the window and walls shake. I could clearly hear the television's dialog through the walls. Went down to reception to see if we could change rooms, was told they couldn't, during my conversation with reception, the security bumped their shoulder into me and walked without saying a word. I commented to reception about the rudeness, was given a lame excuse by security about tripping on their own feet. Another incident with the security happened the next morning during check out as they stepped on my feet and knocked into me again, again not excusing themselves. No manners at all. Here is the final straw, found out that they double charged for the room, once during check-in and again at check-out. These are shady people, just like the homeless, drug dealers, and drunks hanging out in front of the hotel. Do yourself a favor and read the worst reviews first, they are spot on. Not worth the aggravation. Would not recommend this hotel to even my worst enemy.

Our stay in New York was made better by our stay at this wonderful boutique hotel. The rooms are small, but so well appointed that it doesn't matter. Mirrors make the room larger and bright. No carpet so room feels clean. Bathroom large and bright. Giant TV. Great view. Comfy bed. Coffee in the room. Lights adjustable. Fabulous roof top bar. Highly recommend this hotel for your stay in Times Square. No issues with cleanliness as I read in other reviews. Looking froward to our next stay.

The room was great, small. but great. The closeness to time square was great along with every kind of food or shopping experience.The staff at the hotel were not friendly and we were treated like low class citizens from check-in, to the roof top bar. Did not spend any more money on eating or having fun at the hotel, spent it all on outside venues. The cleaning staff and the valet staff were amazing.

I don’t recommend that hotel. The staff altitude is very bad. they Charge me many times of my credit card after I check out I found coffee machine is not working and many time I ask them to fix but no response!!!!!

This hotel was so beautiful and comfortable to sleep in ! Me and my partner loved every minute of it ! The only thing was the request never came to my room until the next day and the security deposit being more than what reservations told me but over all It was amazing ! Thank you !

Great location. Bed was super comfortable and big. Rooms design very modern and nice. Even the view was good. We spontaneously stayed for 1 night and it was excellent. Hotel was very close to timesquare.

Stayed 5 nights at this hotel which we booked several months ago. Despite an email indicating we had paid in full we were greeted with a ‘Destination Fee’ of nearly $35 a day. This I was assured, was for bottled water in the rooms (small bottles only, the larger ones are charged at $8 each), coffee & tea!?! I was intrigued - having been in the US for the past two weeks & received complimentary tea, coffee & bottled water everywhere, was annoyed to say the least. In fact in over 40 years of staying in hotels was not accustomed to being charged - these are included in the price. I questioned this issue with reception staff and was informed this fee also entitled us to 20% off in the restaurant for breakfast or evening meal - really!?! So we are charged nearly $35 a day, only to receive a proportion back if we eat in the hotel. Not really very convincing - just fleecing your customers!We found the staff courteous, polite and helpful throughout albeit I note other reviews are not so complimentary. The immediate vicinity of the hotel was very dirty, smelly and had several homeless, drugged & drunk individuals lying around. This is a social problem for the city - not suggesting this is the hotels fault. I note other guests have commented on this issue.Overall we had a comfortable stay but the additional fee was extremely annoying.

· Where to begin. I was EXTREMELY disappointed in our stay. This was supposed to be my husband and my mini honey moon and we spent 800 dollars for two nights. We requested a deluxe king suite room And when we walked into a room where we couldn’t Even move around our suit cases, we were so disappointed. No bath tub. Only had one bath robe. The bed was amazing but after a good nights sleep we went out exploring the whole day and came home to change for our dinner and show but the room had not been serviced. I called front desk to ask if we could get our room serviced but they said they were running behind so unfortunately our room would not be serviced that day. Unacceptable. Then I asked For new toiletries and towels so we could shower. We waited 30 minutes and no one came up. We used dirty towels and had no shampoo or conditioner. When we returned later that night we had three towels thrown on our messy bed and a plastic bag thrown on the dirty sink with shampoo and body wash. No conditioner. We also did not receive any fresh wash cloths. They also didn’t remove any of the dirty towels. I was so beyond disappointed with this experience. We spent 800 dollars on this room and had much higher expectations for at least servicing of the room. Never again.

Great hotel and location, loved having the valet parking available. Clean rooms, very hospitable and helpful staff everywhere. Felt really taken care of by everyone! The rooftop bar is fun. Brunch at the restaurant was good.

Beautiful hotel; amazingly clean. Booked a King deluxe ended up in a Queen due to overbooking a UN function. Paid the same price for the Queen; no idea until we got up to the room and no Receipt was provided upon checkout. Breakfast was superb as was the staff. If only we had gotten the King Deluxe it would have been the best birthday ever.

The hotel is in a great location 7 minutes walk from Times Square and 1 minutes walk to the nearest subway station. The views from the 40th floor bar are great and while the drinks in the bar are somewhat expensive, everything in New York is expensive. The wardrobe was very small with only enough room for 4 hangers. As we were there for over a week we had to leave a lot of clothing in our suitcases.

Clean, comfortable & excellent location . Rooms are well designed & equipped. Only problem is there are only 3 elevators & one of them can be reserved. So, you can wait 5 minutes for one to come......

Clean and functional room that didn’t feel too cramped . comfortable beds and good location if you have work in the area. Tourist spots close by if your in town for that . Numerous food options within walking distance

Such a great hotel. The views are amazing. The rooms perfectly clean and comfortable. Excellent convenient location. It was honestly better than I had hoped for. I would love to stay here again in the future.

Stayed at this hotel for 4 nights. It looked just the sort of place we needed when viewed online. The hotel entrance is down a dark side road the smelt of urine and had drunks and drug addicts laying on the pavements. It was quite scary at night. When we arrived the rooms are very small. The beds are quite comfortable but that’s about as good as I gets. We got stuck in the lift as it jammed, when we finally got the door open we mentioned it to a member of staff who wasn’t even bothered about it in the slightest. The floor in the room was dirty which made our feet black whilst walking around the bed. (What very little pace there was. Their service is really poor, our room hadn’t been cleaned for 2 days and when we called reception they said they’d put us on the list. Terrible!! We had no coffee of tea, only one milk and we had to go and fetch some towels ourselves. This place has a nice rooftop bar but the staff are rude and unpleasant, they tried to rip us off for the bar bill and when we questioned it they had a go and laughed at us. One of the staff made my with very upset. Disgusting people. Avoid this hotel and stay somewhere that will show some care for you. We will not stay here again.

It was great! I'm happy that we chose this hotel and most likely we'll consider it for our future trips. The only downside is twofold: it was a little pricey and also the area around the hotel wasn't clean and in fact was a little dirty.

Had a wonderful stay here with my sister and our sons. We had two rooms, each with two doubles. The rooms were small but prefect for our needs. Rooms were kept spotlessly clean by housekeeping and an issue with the bathroom was fixed within 30 minutes of me reporting it. The staff are friendly and welcoming. The views from the rooftop bar are spectacular. The location was perfect for Times Square and the port authority building. We loved our trip to NY and would definitely stay at the Aliz again.

Very close to TImes Square. Great rooftop bar, and nice staff. No complaints, except the housekeeping wasn't up to the mark. When i was about to sleep i noticed that the right lower end of my mattress was completely wet. Luckily, it was only me sleeping, so could adjust.

Needed a hotel close to Times Sq, and was attracted by the Peloton bikes in the fitness room. While the bikes were convenient and offered a great workout, the room they were held in was small and cramped, many of them didn't work, and the bikes were the only form of onsite fitness. That issue aside, I found the hotel generally sub-par. Stayed in a "double." The beds were so small that at 5'6", I barely fit on it lengthwise and had to sleep diagonally. The room was among the smallest I've ever stayed in, even by NYC standards. Visited the onsite bar. While the vibe was generally chill and the views very nice (even on a cloudy, rainy night), the service was horrendous despite it not being busy at all. Would not stay here again.

The room was clean, comfortable and cozy and we really enjoyed our private patio and the roof top bar! The hotel isn't located in the heart of Time's Square like I thought but I would still stay there again because it was very close and because of the outdoor private patio.

Even though the room itself was much smaller than expected from the photos, the decor was tasteful, the beds were comfortable and there were no bumps along the way in our stay. However, beware that this particular block had lots of junkies hanging around outside. They didn't bother anyone, but it has an effect on the vibe. But again, security in the hotel seems to be very vigilant about dealing with the circumstances.

Stayed at this hotel in July for 5 nights. We have a few minor complaints, i.e. very little hanging space, no shelves in the bathroom to put any toiletries etc and the coffee machine was more than useless! However, the purpose of this review is to make people aware that unlawful payments may be taken from your bank without your consent. Both at check-in and check-out, we were told that they do not have paperwork to show but a print of my credit card was taken as is normal practice. On check-out, as we did not use any products in the hotel bar or room, there was nothing extra to pay- which was agreed by the check-out staff. Two days after we arrived home, our bank account was $1200 lighter - why? We have no idea as no explanation was given. Three e.mails later and no reply or acknowledgement, this matter was dealt with via my bank. My advice would be to make sure at check-out that you obtain some evidence of any monies due or not due..........PLEASE DO NOT TRUST THIS HOTEL!

This was one of our poorest hotel experience ever. We came for 7 nights, during them we celebrated our wedding in NYC.For some reason, we found ourselves constantly asking for basic things which should have been done without us asking.Elementary issues like refill of soups and toilet paper, we had to ask repeatedly, each evening when we came back to the room, we saw that the house keeping did not do it fully.One night, when we came back late and tired and wanted to take a shower, we had to wait for 40 minutes for soups and asked 3 times until we got it.Air conditioner makes noise which is impossible to sleep with when set to high ir auto fan, only low allows you to sleep. Here also, we complained and were told that that's the way it is.Also, friends sent us wine and chocolates to the hotel as a surprise for the wedding, it was delivered to hotel, and kept there for two days without informing us, we ask if it was received 3 times until they found it, it ruined the surprise and was also weird to our friends that we did not call and thank them (on one hand they received a message that the package was delivered and the other hand we did not know because the hotel did not infirm us or put it in our room).Lastly, at the day of the wedding, we asked for a late checkout for the day after, only 2 hours delay, so we can have the wedding forms signed by the state department, they agreed for one hour only and asked for 105 dollars for an additional hour (1pm instead of noon). That was an insult, simply as that. Especially because check in is only at 4pm.We informed the hotel this was a wedding stay before and during our stay, not only they didn't act like it matters, they didn't bother to even congratulate us.

Stayed in Aliz last week its in a great spot and has lovely clean rooms. ( 2 rooms 12th floor) Bed so comfy Staff helpful. We were room only. Roof top bar views were amazing. Half of it had private functions on when we were there & drinks are expensive.

I stayed for one night with my two sons last weekend and they charged me twice for the hotel, so I paid close to 1000$ for one night of stay and when I reached to their business office they made it look like they only charged once eventhoıgh I sent them the proof of my credit card bill. I am still working on it, hopefully will get it back. Now when I read the comments I see that it has happened to pther customers. Never ever stay at the hotel. They are thieves!!!

Nice hotel. Very small rooms but nice and clean and everything you need. Housekeeping came around very late each day when we were back in the room and therefore we didn't get our room serviced any of the 3 nights we stayed.

So upon staying at this property again I upgraded my room - or least that's what I thought I was doing. I stayed in the "deluxe king room" With a balcony and a view and all I ended up doing was paying more money for the same size room. I really thought this room was going to be bigger but silly me. I just got robbed basically. And there was no view because my room was on the 4th floor. Apparently balcony rooms don't go higher than 4 because of "security reasons". That's exactly what I was told. I wish I was told that before I arrived at the hotel. I wish I was informed while I was booking my stay. The rooms are really small. So take that into consideration. The room seem like it's fit for two only. my room came with breakfast as well but it didn't even include a side. So I had to pay extra for some eggs and bacon. Like really Aliz?? I can't get a side included with my meal for breakfast?! Are you really that cheap? My plus doesn't like this hotel at all.i can say that staying here again actually made my fondness of this hotel go down a little. The value just isn't worth the money. The room size certainly don't match the value.

This hotel has beautiful facilities and a great location. It's within walking distance of many tourist attractions and literally next door to the Port Authority so transportation is a breeze. The rooms are compact (as per usual in New York), but the design is lovely. We stayed during a very popular and busy weekend, but the entire staff was extremely well-equipped to handle anything that came up in an efficient and friendly manner. Plus the rooftop bar offered one of the best views of the New York City skyline in the evening. The hotel is only a year old so it's only a matter of time before people discover this hidden gem.

Excellent location, near Times Square, Macy's, Madison Square Garden, Penn Station, Empire State Building, 5th Avenue, Broadway. Great and friendly Staff. Excellent view room. Absolutely high sleep quality. Aliz Hotel New York Number One!

The rooftop bar has an amazing view of the Empire State and the midtown. The drink is also pretty good. However, the room itself is very small. It’s basically just the king bed and the desk. Every time I use the elevator there are maintainance staffs in the elevator with their service cars. This can be an issue especially because the elevator area is very small. Nevertheless, the service overall is good, and the location is convenient. Would recommend if you are looking for a below $200/ night place to stay!

The hotel and location were perfect. Rooms very clean and comfortable. The rooms are well insulated and we did not hear any road noise or noise from halls or other rooms. Beds were comfortable. I would definitely stay again.

The hotel is quite good, new and clean.Family rooms are too small for 4 persons and the mattress too small and for our habits too soft.we were lucky to have a room with a view on the street and we could see the Empire State Building (very difficult to have a street view in NYC!)

Just back from a brilliant week in New York. The hotel was in a perfect location 5 mins walk to Times Square and right beside Port Authority. Hotel itself was stunning, spotless all the time. Staff are extremely helpful at all times. Will definitely be staying here again in the future.

Amazing hotel with high rise accommodation,nice rooms well equipped with Tv,hair dryer,clothes steamer,very handy, shower room,coffee maker and air conditioning,the only thing I can say has nothing to do with the hotel,as we could not fault it,was the sqallor around it, dustbin bags everywhere, lots torn open by homeless people,people laying around on pavements,very daunting,so please be aware of this

Very nice hotel, clean, friendly staff. Rooms are small but thats normal for NYC. The only thing its a little walk from Times Square but its not bad plus its not loud as if you are right in the center. We were on the 16th floor and didn’t hear a thing.

Very nice and modern hotel close to subway and busstation. Walkingdistance to Timesquare, Macys, Bryantpark, Madison square Garden and other locations such as theaters. The only negative, the pillows was to high.

My husband and I enjoyed our stay at Aliz Hotel. The location was excellent as it's just a few blocks away from Times Square. The rooms are small but very clean and modern. The noise level at night was minimal. There is a rooftop bar on the 40th floor and a restaurant on the ground floor; but we weren't able to check those out. The staff is very helpful and friendly. I initially thought my booking was cancelled due to a card update through Booking.com; but the staff was able to help me resolve that. They were also able to store our luggage after checking out and reserve a taxi to take us to the airport afterwards. I only hoped that it had a gym with weights; but I enjoyed using their Peloton. I will definitely recommend this to future travelers who are on a budget.

You cannot have a more perfect location in NYC. The rooms are small, however, what do you need in NYC? The hotel has a modern chic ambiance and gives a nice and warm welcome as you arrive. The rooms are functional, modern and have everything that I needed for a NYC stay. We had a GROUP at the hotel and had ZERO complaints except the fact that a package that was addressed to one of the guests was refused either by the bell captains or the front desk when delivery was attempted the day before we arrived.

From the desk clerk to the bartender and servers at the 40th floor bar, super happy with the service. Friendly and efficient. The room was a bit smaller than we were accustomed to, but that's New York. Room was very clean, well organized and the hotel offered free bottles of water, you don't find free bottled water very often.The location was excellent, very close to the Port Authority Bus Terminal which gave us easy access to the subway. Our room was on the 39th floor and had a great view of the city. Will definitely stay there again if the need arises.

We had high expectations for the Aliz Hotel Times Square only to be disappointed on the very first night. We were exhausted from traveling all day and were looking forward to a long, restful weekend, but that was far from what we got. There was constant noise, screaming and smoking coming from the hallway outside our tiny room, we called the lobby several times to inform them, but nothing was done to address this issue. The noise and smoke went on from 11 pm to 4 am, and we had the worst night with no sleep. The next day they moved us to another tiny room, and then we realized that housekeeping doesn't do housekeeping. They do not replenish toilet paper or soap, and even when you request housekeeping, all they do is make the bed. We asked for housekeeping one morning and came back to the room and realized they didn't clean the room, and when I called the lobby, they said housekeeping "had left for the day." We were here on business and to celebrate our anniversary and were hoping for a great experience, but sadly ended being one of the worst hotels ever. We would not recommend this hotel to anyone. Also, watch out for the sneaky resort fee they do not inform you about until after you book your room. There is no option to opt-out of the resort fee even if you don't want any of their mediocre offerings under the "resort fee".
