New York City, New York

review_body: Fantastic place to stay right at the middle of happenings in NY. The staffs are so friendly and the restaurant downstairs has good burgers too. From my room, A good view of Hudson river; quite picturesque at night. Topfloor bar overlooks Times office.

We stayed for just one night and had an amazing time. The hotel is beautiful and clean. The bed is like sleeping on a cloud. We used the valet service for our car without an issue. Rooftop bar had stunning views of the city. Quick walk to Times Square. Would definitely stay again!

Clean hotel, reasonably priced in great location, close to Times Square and theater district. Rooms are small but that's NY. Ask for a room on a higher floor, it's no extra charge and the views are great.

Room was tiny no remote no fan in bathroom when showering everything got wet small is not even the word tony is better bed was Horrible woke my wife up at 1.00 am and said I cant do this anymore let's go waited 45 more min. To get my car and drive 2 and a half hours home never would I stay there again

We picked the Aliz because of the location, which was only 3 blocks from Madison Square Garden, and the price, which was great! The hotel is beautiful and the room was spacious and very modern. The Bathroom was huge....the restaurant and 40th floor lounge was great! Thank you!

Location was central, room was nice and quiet, rooftop bar was just wonderful. Rooms were spotless.Staff was so helpful. park near bye was wonderful to have. Lots of great food near bye. We walked from grand station terminal.

We booked our 7 night stay a few weeks after the hotel opened in 2018 so the price was great and there were no additional "resort" charges to be paid on arrival at the time of our booking. Our room was on 12th floor at the front of the hotel. The room was modern, clean, comfortable beds, a good New York skyline view and we were happy with the space to store our 3 suitcases. Space to unpack/hang our clothes was very limited, especially for 3 people but that would be our only complaint about our room.As mentioned by other reviews, there are undesirable people about the street outside the hotel but we noticed they were not there from Friday evening until Sunday evening so maybe it is because the department of correction is next door and perhaps doesn't operate during the weekend. As the hotel was only about 50 steps from 8th Ave, we did not feel threatened and there were always plenty other tourist/pedestrians around when we were arriving/departing the hotel.Location was great, subway at the corner of the street and port authority across the street (with escalators/lifts for travelling with suitcases) for our direct "E line" train to connect to air train back to JFK. We walked to many of the tourist spots from the hotel but also used the subway lots as we had our $32 unlimited subway ticket and it was so close to the hotel. We were told on check in about the rooftop bar but also advise our son could only visit between 2-4pm due to his age, which we did and took lots of great pictures of New York. We did not use the restaurant as there are so many food choices nearby. The only minor issues we encountered were:1. Reception staff NEVER smiled, they were polite but not especially welcoming on checked in/out or anytime we asked for info/assistance. 2. The lifts were INCREDIBLY busy around 11am on both days we were heading out at that time, waiting ages for them to stop at our floor and then they were already full. Based on this experience, on check out day, we headed for the lifts around 10.30, had no waiting time, plenty space in the lift and there were bellboys already waiting in the lobby to tag and store any luggage from guests checking out. (Thank you gents, your luggage storage and collection processes were excellent).3. We noticed the hotel has now introduced a resort tax of approx $34 per day, fortunately this did not affect us, but other guests who perhaps booked before this was introduced may not be aware they may have this additional cost to pay.A great choice of hotel, although we may choose to stay slightly further from Times Square/8th Ave on any future trips due to the non-stop traffic noise and the volume of pedestrians in this central area.

My daughter and I stayed at the Aliz for 6 nights and although there were many good things about the hotel there were also a number of things that we were not pleased with. Other than maybe two employees one of them being Zach many of the employees were standoffish and seemed irritated when you asked questions or asked for assistance. At check in we were required to pay the security deposit as well as the $30 per day "resort fee". I am sorry but paying that much per day for a 20% food credit that you were not allowed to use at breakfast and a couple of small bottles of water each day was not in my opinion worth the fee. I also not once saw anyone in the cycle room (which we also pay for). The lobby although very nice is very tiny and often extremely crowded. We would have liked to sit at the lobby bar and have a drink during happy hour however with the large number of guests that were checking in during those times it was not a place where you could even sit and enjoy a glass of wine.Our room was located on the 38th floor with amazing views however if you were on a lower floor your view would have consisted of a brick wall. The room although small was lovely, clean and comfortable. The bathroom was small but bright and well laid out. The coffee maker in the closet was a bit awkward to use and a few of the days the regular coffee was not replaced. In regards to location it was well situated for walking to almost anything, however I do agree with some of the other reviews that it was somewhat unnerving to walk past the filth and individuals living and sleeping directly outside ( I had my daughter with me). I believe that this hotel has a great deal of potential but needs to work on teaching its young staff better customer service skills. I have been to New York five times and in such a competitive market customer service is the one thing that can make or break a hotel.

Great hotel. Very clean which is my first priority! Beautiful roof top bar! So much fun. Great view of the city. Rooms are very small, but that is to be expected in NYC. Very nice staff. Can't wait to go back to NYC and stay here again!

Manhattan can feel abrasive but a stay at the Aliz can provide a lovely Oasis. Beautiful, friendly, sparkling clean and great beds. The restaurant, also delicious and the rooftop bar is delightful. Great location.

Do not stay here!!! Avoid at all costs!!!!From what we heard from the locals, it’s located on one of the worst streets in New York. There’s junkies, homeless and drug deals right out the front. We never felt safe leaving or arriving back at the hotel so we always crossed the road.We paid for the room in full when we arrived but they still took $150 US dollars as a security deposit. They then keep on taking money out of our account even though we had paid for the room in full. When confronted about it they were so rude, kept on passing it on to another staff member and then the manager finally came out she said she would investigate. The next day she finally got back to us and said the extra money that keeps getting taking out is more security deposits as they were scared we were going to run off ? This was an insult ! Considering everything had been paid for. The staff there are completely rude ! The worst customer service I have ever experienced! They don’t greet you, they just say “what do you want” . Then the roll their eyes at you, huff and puff . The motel in itself is tiny. The lobby is set out really bad. There’s a bar in the lobby which takes up a lot of room. They only have 3 really slow lifts for the whole building which is 40 levels. There is always a line up to go up and down the elevator. There is a bar on the top of the building , amazing views but we went up their and was told we can’t be here , I found this rude and weird considering we are staying in the building. The room we had was so so small. There is no room to put your suitcases. It was so dirty. The aircon is on the floor beside the bed and is extremely loud and on the other side of the bed you literally roll into the bath room. We had a balcony which was ok. The door to go outside to the balcony didn’t lock . We told the front desk as they reckon they fixed it but it was still broken. Moral of the story is that this is the worst motel we have ever stayed at. we were suppose to stay 7 or 8 nights and ended up leaving after 3 and going to another motel. Do not stay here ! Avoid at all costs!!!

The hotel is perfectly located, staff are helpful and the rooms comfortable if somewhat dark. I recommend this hotel and would definitely stay there again when next in New York. It is close to shops, theatre, the hi line and the bus station.

Everything was perfect. The staff, restaurant, waiters, valets.. The rooms are tidy and everytime you leave the room you get back to a made up bed, re-stocked fridge, fresh towels and A/C turned on. The view was beautiful and all in all a 10 out of 10. Almost forgot to mention that the location can't be better. We walked almost everywhere for 7 days with just 4 times using the subway.

I took a gamble and booked a 5-night stay at this hotel when it first opened. I figured that any kinks should be ironed out by the time our stay came around. I got what turned out to be a fantastic deal as we had a great stay at the end of June/beginning of July. We arrived quite late in the evening and were warmly welcomed by [Max?] on reception. He allocated us a 'double' room on the 37th floor. The size of the room was perfect for two and, I believe, quite spacious for New York standards. It contained two double beds and had a great view of Hudson Yards and the Empire State Building. I loved waking up to that view - we caught an amazing sunrise one morning. The bathroom was also a good size with a very powerful rainfall shower and complementary luxury Beekman toiletries.We didn't eat at the hotel, but we did go up to the rooftop bar, Dear Irving on Hudson, for drinks one evening. The views from up there are amazing and the bar has such a nice vibe. I would say it was quite reasonably priced all things considered. All in all, we had a faultless stay at the Aliz and would 100% stay there again. Don't be put off by the reviews which mention homeless/drunk people outside the hotel - yes, they are there (and in many other parts of the city), but not one of them approached us or bothered us during our stay. P.S. TripAdvisor will only let me give a rating of 'Terrible' or 'Poor' for Service, Cleanliness and Sleep Quality - not sure what is going on!

Visited the Aliz shortly after ts opening and found the check-in process very easy. The staff were all friendly and the room was extremely clean. The style is very compact but practical and not cramped. Only hiccup was on the day of check-in when we discovered our room door wouldn't lock properly but the staff were very helpful and it was fixed within half an hour of us reporting the incident.The views from the rooftop bar were amazing and definitely worth a visit even if you aren't staying at the hotel. Checkout was also made incredibly easy by the hotel, they even stored our bags for us and ordered a taxi to the airport and when we arrived back that evening the taxi was already waiting with our bags loaded by the reception staff. Would definitely recommend this hotel for people looking to visit New York.

just blocks from Times Square. access to subway right around the corner. many good places to eat near by. i would stay at this location again if ever to return to NY. staff was friendly. the lobby decor reminded me of a retro 1970's studio 54 look.

review_body: We stayed at the hotel for a quick trip to NYC. It was situated near Times Square, we walked to Central Park, the theater and shops. Easy access to everything we needed. The restaurant was amazing!! Great food and fairly priced! The rooms were small, but honestly it didn't bother us since we spent a majority of the time out (and it is NYC). They were clean, comfortable King size bed and A/C for that summer heat, can't beat that! The bathroom was a good size, enough for both of us to get ready.

I've been guest in this hotel and unfortunately I forget my clothes in the room cabinet. I sent email to the hotel asking them for helping me get my items be back. Nobody answer to me, I'm very disappointed :((

I stayed at this hotel when I came from Philadelphia to New York for a few days. The location of the hotel is great! On 8th Avenue, across from the Time Square! Near metro station, convenience store / pharmacy, pub. Nearby you can find parking. The check-inn was with problem because the employee could not make a charge of $ 150 on a credit card. I received the wrong room.. But as a compliment, I got a free breakfast.The size of the room is small. The benefits - There was a modern coffee machine in the room and a large bathroom. Breakfast buffet was not bad. But the main advantage of this hotel is the location. It's impossible to get lost. From the hotel it is easy to go to the Central Park, to the Plaza Hotel, explore the upper and lower Manhattan. And also find and see the apartment of Carrie Bradshaw, lol) You can also confidently go to the embankment to the Hudson River.. The rooms are not for the family, but for the traveler. In Philadelphia, I had a huge room with a kitchen - this is more suitable for a family. The room is quite modern, with a comfortable bed and a well-equipped bathroom.

This hotel is a great base to see all Manhattan. The beds are really really really comfortable. The room is well equipped and perfectly adequate. This is a good price for what you get and it’s excellent location.

review_body: First trip to NYC and I'm so glad we chose to stay at Aliz. We got there way before check-in, but were able to leave our luggage in a secure room so we didn't have to carry it around while touring the city (amazing) Once we got back, we checked in and the staff was super kind and friendly, making us feel very welcomed. We got a king suite, and it was clean and had a great view. The bed was SUPER comfy and the bathroom was nice with a great shower and lighting! I especially LOVED the mirror wall in our room and the bathroom door also had mirrors on both sides. We ate at the restaurant once for dinner and breakfast, food was good. The rooftop bar had a great view of the city as well. Staff throughout the hotel were kind and we would definitely stay here again! Price was also VERY good!

Overall an ‘okay’ stay. Check in was led by 2 indifferent hostesses, inefficient, and topped off by a 1 hour wait for my room. The front desk was under staffed and easily overwhelmed. I had to go up to them and remind them I had been waiting an hour..... No comps for the inconvenience. Location is good for the theatre district and Times Square. Beds are comfy. Room was small (I had 2 beds in my room). Clean room. View was non existent with a window into another building. Breakfast was included in the rate I had, and good. Service was fast. Doorman was friendly and helpful. A stark contrast with the front desk staff. Overall an okay place to stay. Not enough to say I’d be back but I would put the Aliz out of the running when I researched places to stay.

Nice hotel with good location near Times Square. Staff helpful and friendly.We didn’t eat there due to being in Manhattan and so many options on your doorstep.There were 4 of us in a family party and the room was way too small for 4 adults with insufficient storage and space.Rooms clean and tidy and bathroom lovely/spotless. Beds comfy and air-con works well.I would go back but not 4 of us in a twin room.

The staff were friendly and efficient. The location is great, minutes from Times square, next to the port authority bus station, with a subway station on the corner or a short taxi ride to most of manhattan. The room was small but well designed and spotless. It was surprisingly quiet. Great views from the window.On the other side, the daily waters which were included in the price were sporadic and I needed to request them on numerous days.There are regular drug dealers and their clients on the hotel's street. They never bothered us, but it was unnerving to walk past them. The hotel is a little overpriced but NY in general is expensive. I felt breakfast could have been included for the price.

We were a party of 3 couples who went to New York for a wedding. The hotel is in a central location with many restaurants and bars nearby. The bedrooms were a bit small but it wasn’t a problem. Very nice bathroom. The bed and pillows were very comfortable.The staff were friendly and helpful. The only very small complaint was that there weren’t enough people on Reception which meant there was always a queue for checking in and out. It would not stop us from returning.

Trying to find a really great hotel and a good price is so hard. But the nightly price, plus breakfast, plus a nice room that is really clean and well maintained put the brand names at double the price to shame. Not happy with the Port Authority homeless on the street, but that is the city of New York and not the hotel. The government of NY needs to clean up their city and trash.

Room is new and clean. The stay was great.One small issue is there was only one receptionist down in the hobby (during both checkin and checkout time). You need to wait at least 30 mins. So you need to plan accordingly in order not to miss any appointment or transportation.

NEW YORK cozy-very tiny rooms and I realize this is a common theme for NY but grateful for a king bed. Not alot of room to walk around but you have the necessities. Updated rooms, clean bathroom, large shower (old bathtub removed) with updated fixtures etc. Our room (4th floor) absoutly NO view except for the poor people next door working and the HVAC units - but all we did was sleep so not a big deal for our needs. The rooftop bar is a must! Great views, staff helpful and courteous Lobby-very small with a bar and grabngo items. We did not eat in their restaurant so can't comment.

1st off let me say the hotel was nice, the outside, it is a little rough with the homeless and stench, but we walked down the other side of the street and crossed in the middle to make it more bearable. Which leads me to the most annoying part, I realize that the blackout was not the hotels fault, but I think that the conditions which we were in for the entire time of the blackout would warrant some type of compensation, there was not enough room for all of the people to have a seat, the staff was basically rude about it and that was honestly the only time I felt like slapping one of them. One staff member spent 20 minutes flirting with someone off in a corner and yes I timed it, nothing else to do in a blackout. They were great other than that. There was no apology or sympathy displayed and no one even offered water to the customers until an hour after the blackout started and someone had to ask, you know for the free water we get in our rooms. Seems like that would have been the 1st thing to do, make your customers a bit more comfortable. especially not knowing how long it was going to be. The hotel is beautiful and comfortable,and the location is great, but in a city that has so many options, you should go the extra mile to make people want to stay!

The location of the hotel on West 40th Street was good, but we were disappointed with all the garbage bags along the street and the homeless people on the sidewalks within 1/2 block of the hotel. We are retired and take road trips each year, and doubt that we will ever take one to NYC again.

My wife and I, and an adult son very much appreciated our 6 days at the Aliz. It helped make our first trip to NYC so memorable . From arrival to departure the staff were friendly and helpful. They arranged a room transfer with no quibble so we could enjoy views over the west side of Times Square. Reception helped us sort out our deferred helicopter flights, arranged taxis and provide helpful travel advise. 10 out of 10 to the staff.We had two rooms which were surprisingly quiet on this side of the hotel. They were adequately sized with adequate storage space for a boutique hotel, in this location during summer months. The beds were very comfortable. The rooms were cleaned well each day and topped up with complimentary water bottles. On one occasion they forgot the water. We advised the desk, received extra water and received a personalised note of apology from the cleaners. The bathroom was adequately sized with a really excellent shower cubicle.The hotel is perfectly located. It's just 8-12 minutes walk from Times Square, the main subway links and pick up points for the hop-on buses. We did not eat at the hotel as there were so many alternatives close by along 8th and 9th Street. The dining area was however well supported. There is a small lounge / bar area in reception but a larger 360 degree roof-top bar.Overall I would recommend the Aliz for the staff's attitude and helpfulness and its excellent location, which for us in busy NYC, with our deaf-blind adult son, could hardly be bettered.

Hotel is a perfect spot in Manhattan. It’s off to the side and if you want to be in the middle of time-square major areas, just walk to corner. Staff friendly, professional environment, clean and comfortable. This hotel has some of the best views especially if you go to the 40th floor, the Dear Hudson.

Too new with some minor issues. Staff seemed new or inexperienced but were trying. Beware of added service charges that are not posted! The hotel is located centrally in New York but still on the fringe of not such a great area with lots of homeless people sleeping in and around the hotel's sidewalk.

It is really amazing hotel. The location is prefect. We only New York for one day but because of our hotel locations were able to see the great places of New York City. The only minor issues we encountered were one of the elevator wasn’t working properly. And if you want to go to rooftop at 40th floors, which has magnificent view of the town you to come all the way down to reception at the lobby to be scan in for access, no one told us that. They didn’t tell us the time of check out or breakfast either. All in all it is fantastic place. I will definitely book that again if I ever decide to come back to New York City again.

From start to finish everything was perfect ... I almost cancelled due to some of the negative comments but so pleased I didn’t . This hotel is fantastic in every way ... very elegant and service was amazing

Location is perfect, a minute walk from the port authority and 5 minutes walk to the time square. The rooftop bar is everything even though the prices of the drinks were a little high. Friendly stuffs and very clean

We stayed a whole week and had an AMAZING time! Hoghly recommend Aliz Hotel Times Square....very friendly, clean, smells amazing every time you walk in the doors! The feel and atmosphere is wonderful!And they have concierge transportation to airport or flag down a taxi to the train station!

This hotel has very clean room, but the room is smaller than you thought. And location is really close to time square and subway station. It takes 20minutes to go any famous place. I was very satisfied.

Nice hotel with a great rooftop bar. The location is also convenient distance from Chelsea Market, Time Square and Theater District. I would also add that the staff are friendly and very helpful especially the ladies at the lobby coffee bar.

Rooms are well designed. Compact and very comfortable. Definitely going back. The bar at night on the roof top is worth a million. We liked the side where you can see the Empire State building. Just go , you won't regret it.

The hotel in general is good but make sure if you pick a room with breakfast included that every guess will have their breakfast. I stayed in a room for 4 and only 2 breakfast were included. The manager barely gets out from her office to talk to the guess about issues.

We were very satisfied with the hotel itself and with our room. Everything was very clean, our bed wonderful and confortable. We also liked that we were quite a few minutes walk away from Times Square and Broadway. Even the Metro Station and also zur Penn Station were right around the corner. Perfect!

The rooms are very small, even for NYC. No where to put your bags. The reception is tiny and everyone is trying to be cooler than they are. They charge a ridiculous "destination fee" of 30 USD a night. Apparently this is for bottled water and gym access etc plus maybe location - I don't know. We never got our bottles of water and new soap on two occasions. Call reception to request the first time and waited over an hour before ringing because I wanted to go to sleep. Second time I asked for tea at reception and they took 1.5hrs in which time we were going out again. 3rd time I went to reception to ask for the water that wasn't provided again and then said it would be quicker to bring it to the room. I waited there and the lady was very unfriendly (but I got it far quicker that time). Wouldn't stay there again - with all the fees the price adds up - other better options out there.

Perfect place for a base whilst sightseeing in NYC. The hotel is sparkling new with heaps of modern features, the staff where more than helpful especially the girls on reception who were obliging with every request. Our room was perfect - beds were very comfortable, bathroom layout and finishes spot on. We utilised the restaurant every day - great food and service, staff looked after us - made us feel very special. Thank you Adrian! The rooftop bar is amazing - views to die for and luxe everything. six out of five from us!

A really Fantastic hotel with a great location which is close to Times Square, the subway and the bus terminal. It Has one of the best sunset and rooftop views over the city! Great vibes bar and yummy snacks. Very friendly and helpful staff.

While the hotel is itself modern and the room was clean and comfortable, the entry and exit of the Aliz was not pleasant. It is supposed to provide a discount at the hotel restaurant. The problem is that it's qualified only for lunch and dinner, NOT breakfast. Great service, nice location, amazing rooftop (for the view, the drink offer and even snacks), clean, unbelievable so confortable bed, efficent elevator (don't wait very long), very decorated room, and even a great "grab to go" offer !

Great locationExcellent room Very cleanProfessional staffHomeless characters just next door were a bit upsetting at first but soon realized they were harmless . A bit dirty in their area but in front of hotel exceptionally clean, fresh scent in the lobby was lovely.

I was in NYC for a conference at the Javits Center. I liked how the hotel is centrally located, walking distance to the conference, and was fairly quiet! All the people who worked there provided excellent service as well!

Hotel tries to pretend it is a higher end establishment. In reality it is just another run of the mill hotel. Most of first floor consumed by restaurant that is usually empty. If you walk out of bathroom too quickly you'll fall into the bed. Roughly 1ft of clearance between bed and sliding bathroom door which by the way has to be a slider because there isn't enough space for a normal door to open or close. Check in and out were extremely slow. Girl at front desk couldnt even manage to ask how our stay was at check out. 1st day housekeeping forgot to re-supply coffee in room. Starting to think it's a cost cutting measure. By the way, the coffee maker is in the little tiny closet lol. Second day housekeeping didn't refill the empty tissue holder. This wasn't a big deal but it really is housekeeping 101. Half of what should be a window in room was blocked off with a mirror. Probably to make room look bigger. Could not see the view unless you stood directly in front of the half window. Location is directly across from port authority bus terminal. Not the best area. Many bums and panhandlers. Look for something a block or two away in either direction. You can definitely find more value for your money than what this hotel offers. We are not a very picky couple but this place just doesn't measure up to other hotels in this price range.

K size and Ok hotel but boring and non descript in style and substance - the roof bar was nice though although expensive but great views and good wine - cant really thin of anything else which speaks volumes

What a conveniently located hotel with a hip vibe and great service. I'd stay again. The breakfast area is fantastic as well. My room had a nice view of the city. Next time I'll try the rooftop bar (not sure if there is one).

Hey its NYC so yeah rooms are small no worries.Staying here currently we checked in last night and our room had bugs in the bathroom so did the 2nd room...the 3rd room all on the same floor we are satisfied with.Staff . .when we said there is bugs in our room they didn't look just shuffled us to the next 2 rooms and said nothing.This place is ne and looks nice but outside the hotel I saw someone urinating between cars and 3 people sleeping on the street.Rooftop bar is just a bar up high, and the bartenders have zero personality I finished my drink and was ignored. So we left.Will not ever come back we have one night left thank goodness otherwise we'd be booking else where.

This place is a great location, really close to Times Square and Hells Kitchen. Subways close by and Transit Authority across the street. Rooms where clean and quiet. Staff was helpful and friendly. Would most certainly stay again..

Overall, a great experience. This was my first time staying in the "Hell's Kitchen" area and I actually think I prefer it. Great restaurants (Bea and Boqueria) and Time Square and other sites within easy walking distance, and easy access to the Museum of Natural History, The Bronx Zoo, Chinatown...via the subway. The hallways in the hotel are small and it seemed likes the noise of people talking could be heard more loudly than in hotels that are larger. But, I wouldn't let that stop me from coming back. Additionally, the rooms are just big enough to be comfortable and everything is clean and new. Great food in the Farm to Burger restaurant was an added plus; especially on a morning where we didn't want to walk in the rain to go out for breakfast; as well as for an awesome burger and mac n cheese that hit the spot after a long day out and about. Everyone at The Aliz Hotel was very welcoming and helpful during our stay! Rooms are small but so are all rooms in NYC. The plus is the rooms at the Aliz are newly renovated and stylish with floor to celing mirrors that make the room look bigger.Great roof top bar with a view of the river and the Empire State building.

Our room was tiny and no drawers, so had to live out of our suitcases. BUTThe room was clean and bright. The staff were helpful and friendly. The view from the rooftop bar is AMAZING!Fantastic location. Many subway stations within a couple of minutes walk and Times Square less than ten minutes walk.

We started staying in the midtown Hell’s Kitchen area for the past three weeks and have stayed here every time. The front desk agents were quick and courteous. The hotel was comfortable and the roof top bar had amazing views. Room was small compared to other stays in New YorkRoom service was requested to change bedding but this didn't happen. Appears that bedding was straightened, not changed.View from room wasn't as described during bookingEmployees at front desk was goodLounge was very nice

This was my first time in New York AND I was travelling alone. Such a nice first impression of the city and the hotel. Wonderful hotel, clean and safe. I was in NYC for less than 24 hrs for business meeting midweek. Took the train up from DC for a 1:30pm mtg, which concluded just after 5p. I picked the Aliz because I found a good rate last minute online, and it was walking distance from my meeting, Times Square and the train station. It was a typically small room, but was clean, modern and had good use of space. It was right next to the Port Authority (view from my window overlooked it). I decided to try my luck with last min show tickets and scored great seats to Dear Evan Hansen. After the show, I stopped in Hudson’s at the Port Authority and bought some OJ and some cranberry juice. For those keeping track that’s now 3 beverages I brought to my room. I checked out before 10am the next morning and walked to Penn Station to catch my train back home. Imagine my surprise a week later when completing my expense report and finding a mysterious additional charge of $8.71 on my card. When I inquired with the hotel I was told it was for taking a bottled water from the room refrigerator per information provided by housekeeping. I explained that housekeeping must’ve confused me with another guest room as I had NOT taken anything from the fridge because I had my own water and juice that I brought with me and was in the room for less than an hour before I went to the show, and brought juice with me on the way back!Despite 3 emails over the course of the month I never received a refund of the $8.71. While the amount is small, it’s the principle of the matter. And it’s a deceptive business practice to erroneously charge guests for something they didn’t consume/use. Imagine how much money they’re making by doing this to unsuspecting guests who they wager will not notice or not bother to dispute it. I had been excited to have found a cool new hotel as I travel to NYC frequently, but I will stay elsewhere (as I did this past weekend when I visited for 3 days) and I’ll avoid the Aliz because I don’t trust them and their management was unresponsive. If you decide to stay there BE WARNED of this deceitful practice. Take a picture of the contents of your refrigerator the minute you get in the room, and when you leave so you don’t get suckered like me.

review_body: I recently stayed at the Aliz Hotel with my daughter for 5 days. We live close to NYC, but since it was Spring Break and we had some appointments in the city, we decided to stay over. First thing, unless you are a tourist or love the idea of Times Square, the area is dirty and seemingly homeless people hang out on the street to the right of the hotel - all hours of the day. The front desk was woefully understaffed. There would often be one person at the desk with a snaking line of people checking in. The front desk staff is not especially helpful. I called down one day to speak with the concierge and was told " it's really busy, you'll have to call later". The biggest pet peeve was the elevator. There is no freight elevator! So, the staff, bellman, etc. would often occupy one of the 3 elevators. We were on the 35th floor, so this quickly got old. Other pet peeves - housekeeping would skip our room occasionally. When we called for fresh towels, they wouldn't take the used ones - leaving us with a pile of used towels by the last day. The fire alarm went off in the middle of the night - thankfully, a false alarm - but, the lack of clear communication, a few different "fire directors" coming over the speaker, etc. left my daughter afraid that we either were not safe or were being pranked. Good things: bathroom was nice, large flatscreen TV & a steamer. However, given the poor customer service & the area (dirtier than anticipated), I don't think I would ever stay here again.

Location was great and agree with other reviews, although the rooms were very clean, they were small. Disappointed that on one day, despite it being 4pm we could not get in our rooms to shower and change before seeing a show as rooms were still being made up. Also very disappointed with the Hotels response/reaction to the firm alarm at 4.45 am last Thursday. We evacuated our rooms with limited information given and found ourselves out on the street for quite some time before one of the party went inside to see what was happening. The lack of information & organisation coming from the hotel staff at such a worrying time, given the early hour, was not acceptable. We spent the best part of our last day in NYC in a trance given the lack of sleep we had! Need to brush up on this in case of a real emergency in future as would have no confidence they could clear a building without injury or worse!

We liked the hotel,the location is very good.The room was clean and very well equipped, the reception staff was very kind and helpful.We experienced a false alarm due to fault in your system and we think we should be credited for that night

very nice hotel, usb connections, very new, silence, confortable beds, perfect location, good hair dryer. Very near from Times Square, Madison Square Garden and Broadway. There are plenty of nice places to have breakfast around

The room was modern and clean and we'll appointed. I ordered room service and it was delicious, prompt and the staff was great. Had a wonderful breakfast in the hotel restaurant. I am coming back.

Like much of New York City, the street environment is dynamic so it should not be unexpected to see a broad spectrum of folks just outside the hotel on the street, that's NYC so expect it. The room I had was small, apx. 150 sq feet, but it was new and clean. Additionally, it was very quiet, which was expected on the 22nd floor. By virtue of the general location of the hotel (about 100 yards from West 40th and 8th Avenue), I expect that all rooms are fairly quiet. The roof top bar was gorgeous and the outside decks rivaled (exceeded) any pricey NYC observation deck.

It’s right next to the Port Authority with plenty restaurants and diners in the vicinity. We got a room with the balcony unfortunately it was raining so the balcony was wasted . The air conditioner was very noisy and it’s right next to the bed . The room was very nice and modern but there’s very little closet space to hang your clothes. Overall ok with the location being the biggest plus .

Well appointed modern living spaces; excellently located near all Times Square actions; convenient access to metro and other public ground transportation systems; and friendly services. We will definitely go back to Aliz TS again!

They was traing to make more transacion with my credit car after I live the hotel thats not normal and the make me pay more for the reservation over than $ 1,400.00 dólares for the data I stay and the person who celan the room dont celan Every day and dont clean real whell

Great boutique hotel in a fantastic location. Subway stop on the corner, easy walking to most everything in Midtown. Rooms were clean, comfortable (if a little tight), and ours offered a fantastic view. Cocktail bar on top two floors had great ambiance and even more amazing virews. Would definitely recommend.

We had a short trip, but it was a great time for Springbreak. Location was next to everything making it very convenient for Broadway shows and tours. Room was nice, just small but it was NYC after all..

Getting my bill corrected was a nightmare. One card for room and tax and one for incidentals ($150) and was charged twice for room and tax as well as incidentals. Getting on the phone with someone after trip was like trying to reach employees at a low budget hotel. No fax machine, no direct number to depts. phone rang for 45 mins before someone would answer to transfer a call. Told, we are busy. You would think since this hotel opened 6 months ago they'd have their act together by now. Very disappointed. Still waiting from GM to contact me. It's been 2 weeks. There are too many hotels in NY to gamble.

Save yourself a huge headache and don't stay at this hotel. I booked my stay through the hotels website using their IPrefer rewards program. The room I booked offered free breakfast with my stay. When I checked in the girl at the front desk confirmed I had free breakfast with my room and showed me where the breakfast area was located.  The first day we ate breakfast at the hotel, we were presented with a bill, I went to the front desk and asked the manager why we were presented with a bill if the breakfast was "free"? The manager said to sign off on the bill and they would remove the charges from our hotel bill. The hotel did remove the charge, but subsequently recharged us for that breakfast and the days following. It is a buffet style breakfast and they charge $80 a person!!! Absolutely ridiculous. We would have never ate there if it was not included with our room. We literally had coffee and some eggs. I contacted the manager and the hotel billing multiple times that said they would take care of it and they just keep sending me around in circles asking who I spoke to at the hotel. I didn't take names!!! DO NOT STAY HERE!! They are dishonest and will sneak charges on your bill!!!

The hotel was clean, updated and staff was very friendly. I would not stay here again however because the size of the room was just WAY too small for 2 people. I would have loved to have access to a complementary coffee bar in the mornings also. With the lobby and common area being so small and the room being tiny there would have been NO way to just hang out here.

The Aliz hotel is perfect located nearby the center of Manhattan. All the tourist attractions are within walking distance or can be reached by metro, the metro station is around the corner. The service in the hotel is perfect, the rooms are nice and quiet. The beds are comfy but a little narrow.

Our room was not ready upon arrival; it took 30 more minutes for us to make it to the room. At around 9pm the 1st night, another family actually unlocked our door and entered our room! It turned out that they had been given our room code somehow.Late the next day, when we got back to the room after a long day of sightseeing, our room key cards didn't work. After getting them reissued, I asked to speak with the manager. I was told they would call the room but they never called.Overall it was a disappointing stay. The rooms were fine, the view was nice, but the service was poor. No attempt was made to make up for the inconvenience.

When I arrived my double room was not available and I was forced to stay in a single room. My friends and I are had to share 1 bed. We were promised an upgraded double room the following day and still received a standard room. We were not offered a discount or comp for the 1st night.The rooftop bar was closed during our stay and restaurant had limited options (not Gluten Free or Vegan friendly). The staff was friendly.

Excellent trip but brought down greatly by the hotel and hotel staff. Clothes where robbed and picture that I purchased was thrown in the bin. Situation dealt with disgracefully. Paid a lot of money to go to New York and was heart broken by the events

The rudest and most arrogant front desk manager I have ever met in my travel life ! Will never be back to this hotel ever again !the lobby is dark and crowded . The pics looks great . Not a four stars hotel . Only three stars !

Rooms are very expensive in addition to $75 per day parking fee. Room city view is very limited and cleanliness needs improvement. The overall stay was average and guest need to be informed of what to expect. Valet parking-you park in front of the hotel and go see attendant. Guest Room floors were dirty. Staff were very nice, welcoming and kind.

Super location Near Times Square, subway, madison square garden. Helpfull and compétent staff, exceptional view of roof top at 40 floor. Rooms quiet and clean We were 6 with 2 rooms, they put us Side by SideThanks a lot for this unforgettable stay

We had a disappointing experience with both checking in and out of this hotel. After a very long day travelling when we arrived we were told there were no rooms and they were fully booked. There was no apology. The guy just told us to go and sit down and he would try and sort. He was gone for about 10 mins. He returned to the check in desk and continued to serve ... I then gained eye contact with me and shouted for us to come over. I was disappointed that when he came back he didn’t immediately come over to us and confirm he had found rooms for us. Also it would have been a good gesture if he had offered us a complimentary drink whilst we waited. To top this bad experience we then found our checking out process below our expectations. Extremely disappointed with the Director on checking out. He was rude, inefficient and had an attitude with with a hint of sarcasm. We were querying the charges with the young girl. We were at fault as we had not read the small print so she was trying to explain it. My friend was confused as we had already been charged a $150 holding deposit and needed to pay an additional fee. The Director interrupted and belittled my friend. Also, As there was a long queue forming I asked the director if he could serve me as the people behind us were being kept waiting. His reply was that he was meant to be in a meeting and that as director he doesn’t serve! I then asked if he had anyone to assist the queue and he then began to serve!His attitude was extremely disappointing. I’m not sure what his role is as director but clearly it’s not meant to be customer facing.  Good points of the hotel ... the young lady restaurant manager was extremely efficient, professional, helpful and informative during our stayThe waiters, waitresses and the bell boys were all very friendly and polite. We were pleased with the cleanliness of the rooms. The rooms were compact but perfect for what we needed considering we only slept in them. In summary, as a Manager in Retail Finance, working front of house with many years of member experience, I would definitely recommend a refocus on your front of house staff. In particular I am interested in gaining an understanding of the Director role. This may help me understand the reason why this young man gave such appalling service.

Front Desk don't give a #### attitude really makes my skin crawl. They have a rooftops bar. However I, (a paying guests) wasn't allowed to go up. Apparently, the restaurant and rooftop bar do not are owned by a 3rd party, I was not told this at anytime,so pls know this going in. I chose this place because of its location, amenities, price point, and reviews. I would have rather payed, a little more (btw this place ain't cheap), and stayed at a more ESTABLISHED hotel. I hate to have restrictions. Next, I kindly asked for a room with a view, I'm currently looking in an ugly building into someone's window. I brought my wife here for her 1st trip to NYC and introduce her some of the spectacular views and cuisine on Manhattan. But this hotel has greatly disappointed me.Next, they want you to check in at 4pm but you must depart no later than 11am. Front desk staff, (night shift) did not lend a sympathetic ear to any of these concerns. Horrible attitude but when they got your money they could care less. Beware and be knowledgeable.

great hotel, good service, very nice sky bar on top, but not low pricing.. close to metro and time square.very nice rooms and very good breakfast availableyou must have a drink at the sky bar, the view is awesome

Every year that I return to New York for the annual pharma conference, I am on the hunt for a great hotel that meets our company's allowable budget, rather than stay at one of the chains along with everyone else. Some years I am happy, some, not so much. This year, my choosing the Aliz was the best! Location, the lovely room and terrace, the incredible staff....across the board, they hit it out of the park for me. This is the first time I want to return to next year, without question. They are that solid. And the restaurant, Farm to Table was wonderful.

This hotel had a great location; it was near times square and was a walking distance from the vessel. The rooms were very small. The overall service of the staff was good but I expected cleaner rooms.

I've stayed with my partner in the Aliz Hotel last week (end of March 2018) and we've had an excellent stay for 4 nights! Rooms, bathroom and bed were very modern and clean. For the people who like to watch TV on their room, ours was equipped with a screen of around 47 inch with lots of channels. Location is very good! Just two blocks away (5 min walk) from Times Square. Staff was very friendly and helpful. We've met Michael (one of the managers) and although the rooftop bar was closed in the morning, he was very willing to show us the rooftop (41th floor) of the hotel to enjoy the beautiful view of New York! I can highly recommend this hotel to anybody who want to visit New York.

We stayed on the 35th floor and had amazing views across the city. The lift was so smooth and took seconds to reach our floor. The rooms were spotless and the beds were really comfortable. Once in our room it was quiet and relaxing after an exhausting day of sightseeing. The visit to the rooftop bar was amazing for the views. Edwin was great when it was time to check out, he was very organised in stowing our bags and getting us a taxi arranged to take us to the airport. A lovely stay in a NYC

Trip to celebrate my birthday. Manager surprised me with piece of cake and candle . Rooms were a little small. Drawers in room would be helpful. Enjoyed restaurant. Food very good. Staff very accommodating

Great clean hotel with really nice rooftop bar. However the neighborhood felt pretty unsafe (too close to the bus terminal) Unfortunately this is a dealbreaker for me and therefore I would not go back.

Cons: I thought check in was at 3, was quickly told with an attitude that it was 4pm.. they took my # and were going to text me when it was ready... we went back after 4 and the room was ready and they never reached out to us.. disappointed in the wait for an elevator. I don't think they can handle busy weekends. Took 45 minutes to get our bags delivered to our room, and had to change our dinner reservations because of this. I don't recommend getting a balcony room... not much to see, or sit, and its bigger than your hotel room.. Lobby smells like cigarettes from people smoking directly outside of the hotel. Pros: Room was decorated nicely, bathroom was nice, not too much outside noise interfered with our sleep. Nice doorbell outside of every room instead of the loud thud knock. Decent place to stay thats not in the middle of noisy times square, but close enough to walk. Good valet parking, and very nice men working there.

Lovely hotel! The room was small but had a very nice feel with high quality bed and linens. The bathroom was small but spacious enough by NYC standards. The hallways are wide and we did not hear any noise. We all slept very well. There was large TV in the room and it was very well designed to have a desk space and chair too. The staff was helpful too and there is a little convenience store in the lobby. Not a lot going on this block but If you need to stay near Time square, this is a good choice.

I have nothing but wonderful things to say about this hotel. Check in was fast. They even called us when our room was ready and also let us leave our luggage there when we checked out just so we weren’t tagging it with us all over the city. NICE TOUCH.

A newly built and modern hotel with a fantastic location in the middle of Manhattan. Small but clean rooms. Nice beds. Helpful and friendly staff. A uniqe Sky Bar. The lobby is small and the air condition rather noisy.

Fab modern hotel, hiccup at reception when arrived and receptionist was very rude. Paid to upgrade room and was not given what I had paid for moved to another room to be given the exact same back to reception again and rude receptionist told me nothing she could do, told her not accepting that and to refund my upgrade fee to standard room. Manager came to desk to see me and had a look at rooms available and fixed the issue within 2 minutes and gave us the correct room type but with an added bonus of an amazing view of the river! Breathtaking, the rest of our stay went with no issues, view from roof top bar are out of this world. Loved my stay but the undesirables fighting and hanging around the liquor store next door does make you feel uneasy walking back at night.

First the good things:-We booked the hotel via VoyagePrive, they had a very good deal comparing to other hotels in new york. We paid around £1,000 for 7 days.-The rooftop bar had an amazing view.-The hotel is located in a very central area in a short distance walk to Broadway.-The room was tiny, however, the size was appropriate for two people as you are not going to NY to stay in the hotel room.-Everything was very clean and tidy___________________________________________________The bad things:-Most unhelpful and disorganized front-desk I have ever seen in my life, there were a few exceptions. But unfortunately I didn't ask the name of the staff. Most of them have an attitude when you challenge them about something. Guess this is normal as we had a similar treatment on most of the places we have been in Ny.-The lifts are insufficient, once I stayed for 18 minutes waiting for a lift to be available. Big queues in the lobby..-Some of the bar staff(that I believe is not the hotel staff) includes the tip even before you even think about tipping then.-Bottle of water priced at US8?!?!?!?!I wouldn't recommend this hotel, even if you are on a tight budget. This was the first terrible experience I had in a hotel. I understand that Aliz is relatively new but they have a huge way to become a hotel.

Hotel is super nice and amazing with awesome staff. Had a small issue at check in, but other than that the overall experience was great. We definitely recommend this hotel...great location and walking distance from several main attractions.

First let me say the check in time is at 4pm, when I arrived at 4:50 they told me the room wasn’t ready. The room was ready at 5:15. They didn’t offer me an explanation nor a compensation. I specifically arrived after the check in time so I wouldn’t have to wait and I ended up waiting. The check in time was already late and to not have my room ready was extremely frustrating. The front desk wasn’t even a little sympathetic. I asked if they could offer me something and she responded no. I wanted to get a refund and just not stay there anymore but they told me they couldn’t offer that. Then she proceeds to ask me “do you still want the room?” Well if I can’t get a refund I guess I don’t have a choice right? Usually a hotel will offer a free meal ticket or something to makeup for the inconvenience but nope not this one. The room itself was small but pretty standard for nyc hotels. It was clean and the design was nice. The bed however wasn’t comfortable, it was very soft my back was starting to cramp. It’s a very modern design there’s a lot of buttons in the room that have no explanation for what it’s for. Some are self explanatory but there’s one in the bathroom that has like 1 minute, 60 minute switch which I had no idea what it was for. The tv had no TV guide I had to go on the internet to check what was on tv. It had regular cable channels and hbo. Nothing special as all the modern tv now has Netflix, Hulu. There’s a burger restaurant located right downstairs, I got a burger and fries. Burger was average but the fries were soggy... unfortunately I ordered take out. Wonder if it would be the same if I dined in? I wouldn’t come back as service was below standard and I didn’t get a good nights rest. The people in the hallway from the other rooms were making so much noise at 8 am and the walls are paper thin so it woke me up. Wouldn’t suggest coming here, there are better hotels in the city for the same price and better service!

review_body: We enjoyed our stay here...great location, close both to Times Square, Hells Kitchen (great restaurants), and Broadway shows. The rooms are a bit tight, but that's typical of NY. Bed was super comfortable! Rooftop bar was a bit pricey, but drinks were awesome and the view was spectacular! Only negative was that we requested extra blankets one night and it took an hour and a half and an extra phone call to get them. We'd definitely stay here again!

Fast check in, friendly staff, clean rooms, comfy beds, we only stayed here for one night but, we did go to the rooftop bar and had breakfast at the restaurant the next morning. All was great. Good location! I would stay at this hotel again, and would recommend to my friends.

I saw this hotel online and decided to book for my birthday evening. I specifically booked this hotel for the hotel bar which closes at 1 AM on a Friday night and for NYC that’s early. I was so disappointed that the bar was not open later but I figured as long as the room was nice I could just go to another bar. Upon check in, I waited about 20 minutes while hearing some annoying loud and consistent beeping sound from their alarm system on the wall to the right of the front desk. Not one of the staff thought to eradicate the sound. Someone wearing all black walks in after spitting in the garbage can in the lobby and turned it off finally. Once I finally got to the desk, I was prepared to just pay for the room incidental charge of $150 that I was aware of. I was told that the room was never paid for even thought I went online to their website to pay. I then advised the two people handling my check in that I paid online and I wanted to use a separate card to pay for the $150 fee. Since the room was never charged I gave them permission to use the details they had online to pay for the room. The front staff said “I’m sorry it declined”. I told her that’s impossible and to try again. After she tried again I asked, how much are you charging to this card? She then replies “oh the room charges plus the room incidental fee”. I immediately got angry because I waited all that time, then had to deal with the confusion of them not already charging the room to my card as intended and her not listening to me saying from the beginning that I would be using another card for the room incidental charge. I was tired and frustrated that I had to repeat myself AGAIN! The process was slow and very much annoying. I finally get thought the check in process and get the room keys. I go up to the room and it’s the size of a matchbox. I didn’t expect a gigantic room as I’m from New York and know hotel rooms in the city are usually not very large. I didn’t however expect that the bathroom would be an arms length beyond the bed and hidden behind a mirror on the wall like a closet. The is probably the smallest NYC room that I’ve ever had. I spent over $200 for one night in what I would consider a cage. I called to tell the front desk that I was unhappy with the view and asked for a room on a higher floor. I was told that the hotel was at full capacity so they couldn’t move me. I know that was a lie because when I was at the front desk checking in someone just had their room moved and the staff said they were looking though the available rooms for “king beds” because that’s what I paid for. The thing to notice here is that there were other room options that I was not offered period. The room temperature when I walked in was like a sauna and I had a view of a rooftop parking lot! I was so upset by this. Overall, my trip was ruined by this hotel stay. I wish I never booked here and I will NEVER go back not even for free. The only thing I want at this point are the 3 free gifts I was promised for booking directly with the hotel which I STILL don’t have. HORRIBLE STAY, TERRIBLE CHECK IN, AND HORRIBLE ROOM & VIEW

I highly recommend this hotel! The room was small but confortable. Everything was very clean. The location is great and the staff is very kind! I also liked the decoration of the hotel, especially of the rooms!

Let's start by saying my review will be broken down into a couple parts. Let's start with check in, the absolute downfall to my stay. We arrived in NYC from AZ on a redeye. I didnt expect the hotel to check us in at 0900hrs, however we arrived to drop our bags and hit the town. Upon arrival, the lobby is tremendously small and cramped. The desk lady was nice, checked our bags, sympathized with us being on a redeye and told us they would text us as soon as a room was ready, so we could check in early and get cleaned up. Hours go by, no text. Get to check in time, stil no text. So we go back, after standard check in, and attempt to check in. By this time, my wife and I had been up for 36hrs. Get our room keys, go to the room. Room door bell is red, and key doesn't work. I recall seeing online that a red doorbell means do not disturb. Our key doesn't work. Back down the limited elevator. After a wait, they give us another key, assuring us the room was empty. Back up after a 10 minute wait for an elevator. Key doesn't work. They call in an engineer. They say it's mechanical failure. Wait another 30 minutes, then are told the room is ready. About to board elevator, and told actually the room is not ready. Wait another 20 to 30 minutes. Manager offers us one drink. We accept, and defer until after we get cleaned. Tech takes us up, says theres still work to be done on lock but he will over ride and get us in room. He bypassed the lock to find the privacy lock latched. Privacy lock latched plus do not disturb equals someone probably in the room, but that didn't click with them. They force privacy lock open to find people still sleeping in the room.. oops. Sheer embarrassment on hotel staff faces. Back down we go to get another room. About 30 more minutes go by. They assign us an "upgrade" room. We get to that room, doorbell is white. Key works. I had to ask for a second drink as compensation as they were content leaving it at one drink initially for almost 2 hours of mess ups. Room was very clean, but very VERY small. Not sure what the "upgrade" was. Bed was very comfortable, view was good. Staff downstairs was very disorganized. We get up to the roof bar for our drinks and order round 1. After round 1, I attempt to order round 2. They say hotel staff only granted us 1 round. I tell them no, we were assured 2. Rather than call, the bar manager has to go down 41 floors to confirm it is in fact 2 rounds. Comes back up 15 minutes later and takes our next order. Moral of the story is, if things go smooth, you'll probably enjoy your stay in a very cramped room. If it doesn't, hotel staff doesn't do well with things not going their way. Will not stay here again, as the compensation for our troubles was not worth the trouble itself. Not even sort of. Stick with a bigger name hotel who has the bugs worked out

A++ service nice selection of facilities and very clean also the location was very central to all activities all walking distance I would deffinely stay again Also roof to bar is very impressive thank you

The room is clean and according to the description in the web page. We have been very satisfied with the service received, both in reception and in the breakfast service hired. The staff very friendly and very attentive.The cleaning was unsurpassable.The situation is very close to Times Square (Midtown), and very well connected to the best areas of interest.Something to improve: Amenities. We recommend vessels to drink or toothpaste.  Say what you liked best & least

good hotel and location; sleeping quality is very nice as well cleaning of the rooms. No experience with food and beverages; I would be usefull to have somer more documentation of new York.Overall a very good Hotel.

An hotel that tries both in attitude and endeavour. well situated near an entrance to the 42 street metro.I only ordered breakfast but this was superior to the offerings available in the vicinity. Worth the money.Beds incredibly comfortable

A well placed hotel from where you can visit all the sights on offer in New York, rooms are well appointed, but slightly on the small side, no seating area except 1 desk chair, but they have all that you need for a short visit, coffe machine, steam garment press (hand held), safe. Bathroom was als well appointed with a good size shower. Make sure you visit the 40th floor "Dear Irving" cocktail bar, the views are great. All staff were very helpful and friendly. We didn't eat in the hotel, but there was food available, although the menu seemd a bit limited.

The location was fantastic! Everything you could ever want / need in a very short distance walk! The rooftop bar was STUNNING. We got very lucky the Friday we were there because it was slow and much more intimate- quieter and a really nice relaxed spot to drink and enjoy the view. On Saturday you couldn’t even step into the place which wasn’t surprising given the amenities and views. My only complaint was THE BEDS AND PILLOWS. Wow. Incredibly uncomfortable, the sheets were so tightly tucked in I never fully untucked them during my 3 day stay. And the pillows were so elevated there was no way to sleep on your side or stomach. Overall, a perfect trip nonetheless.

New hotel, excellent service, attention and good place for business. The location is the best, liked the room very comfortable but the breakfast was slowed. Thank you for attention in spanish and english.

The best part about this hotel is its location. You can reach Times Square and most Broadway theatre with 5-10 minutes walks. There's an entrance to the subway just a few steps from the hotel. It's the 42nd St - Port Authority, which is connected by an underground path to the Times Square subway station. The room is fine with a nice bathroom, although it is quite small (but that's to be expected in Manhattan). The staff was great.

Nice hotel in a central location with an extraodinary bar and cocktails.The view was really great and the rooms were quiet even if we were on a large avenue.The staff was quite helful.Small beds for three adults.

I have selected Aliz Hotel due to its great location at Times Squre. The service of the staff is excellent. The hotel room is very clean and comfortable. I will stay again on my next trip to New York.

Our last minute air bnb cancellation was a blessing in disguise because we discovered this amazing boutique hotel! Spotless, modern, staff so nice, close to everything! Stunning view of Empire State Building.

We had a great stay at Aliz. It was difficult to get out of bed in the morning because of how comfortable the beds were. The rooms are small but that’s just about everywhere in New York. Nice showers and nice everything that mattered.

Nice new hotel, good location but.... Smells from the drains coming up into the bathroom and into the bedroom all the time, they have bright blue LED switch's in the bedroom that you cannot turn off which make it hard to sleep, the beds are way to soft and hurt to sleep on and the plugs on the desk are underneath the TV and to close so you cannot plug in something when also using a travel adapter. To top it all off they then couldn't find our bags that we had left with them when we checked out until I went up and identified them.As I said could have been good but still have some rough edges to fix.

Great reception however the outside area is a bit dodgy with trash on the doorstep of the hotel. But I guess that’s NYC for you. Once inside the hotel the view of the Hudson River makes you forget about it all,until you step outside. Very convenient to Port Authority terminal literally 50steps away from the hotel. A bit further to Times Square and garment district but within reasonable walking distance.

Very modern hotel. Rooms are not big, but they are comfortable, clean and there's a superb view from the rooftop. Very close to Penn Station , Times Square and all Broadway attractions. I would certainly recommend!

Thoroughly enjoyed my city visit, large part because of the Aliz! The hotel is beautifully decorated and the staff are super friendly and spirited! Will definitely return! A great value and posh experience!

Hotel is quite new, everything is clean and staff is friendly, however there’s a few problems with this hotel:- The mattresses are way too soft, i.e. not firm enough. They probably bought a cheap type. Not comfortable to sleep on, and it made me wake up in the middle of the night all the time- The hotel has 41 floors, but only 3 elevators, which are also used by hotel staff. This means that at busy times you’ll be waiting 5 or 10 minutes- The heater is this combined heating/ac that blows cold or hot air into the room. It is installed on the bottom of the wall, next to the desk. When I wanted to do some work sitting at the desk, I had constant warm or cold air blowing in my face. Shutting it down would make the room too cold (I was staying in the winter), also because cold air would come in through the unit, freezing my feet. Also, the air was extemely dry, my skin peeling and itching.- The top sheet of the bed is extremely staticly charged. When removing that sheet in the dark, the whole room was lighting up as if there was fireworks in the room.

This hotel is well situated in Times Square- (central location) The hotel is relatively new which is always a plus! Walls are a bit thin so you might hear music from neighboring rooms. TIP - Be sure to request a room with a view! The rooftop bar is also pretty cool!

Great location and all new so looks good. Great roof top bar. Bedrooms are small but you are not in them that much so doesn't matter. Beds are comfortable but pillows are not. Great coffee machine in the room. There is a smoke alarm in the room on the wall and it flashes all the time which is very annoying when you are trying to sleep. It is very noisy around that area and every vehicle or siren that goes past in the areacan be heard.They take a $150 off your card in case you spend anything while you are there and it takes 10 working days to go back on your card which I don't agree with at all.

we stayed 4 nights, 5 days . check in quick although the assistant did not give us enough information and seemed irrated when we did. she was pregnant so Maybe that affected her. just a simple you need your room key to go up in the lift,we would of been ok ...everyone else was great ! particularly the conseirge guys to of them who attend the doors and to luggage. one booked our taxi for 70 dollar but something the hotel need to look into as the taxi driver charged us 84 dollars and he told us the guys at the hotel only want good tips so we should not take any notice of the hotel. I trust the guys at the hotel so Maybe the taxi guy was putting his own on ! The guys who work in the restaurant are faultless ! we ate there last night and they give great service. food is fantastic and can be cheaper than some of the restaurants we ate at. The maids do a great job ! hope they get paid well ! hotel in great location for station , times sq and hop on hop off bus ! view is amazing ! empire state and new world trade centre. feels very safe in the area. rooms a bit small but we'll equipped. huge TV and great sized bathrooms , good shower ! roof top bar is amazing too ! on 40th floor ....give it a try! brilliant hotel . we will be back xx

DO NOT PLUG IN YOUR PHONE TO THE USB CHARGER!!! It is hacked and someone will access your phone. As soon as I plugged my phone to the USB port, someone started browsing through my phone and messages and personal data! Invasion of my privacy and is NOT ACCEPTABLE!!!Staff was nice and room was great!

I loved this hotel! The rooftop bar and lounge was very nice and so was the breakfast. Check-in was extremely quick and our room was ready as soon as we got there. The location is very close to Times Square which was convenient.

We visited NY for 4 nights and had a great stay at the Aliz Hotel. Opposite Port Authority and next to Times Square the location is ideal. The rooms might not be too big but we were only there to sleep, the action is happening outside! The beds are comfy, the bathroom neat with a strong shower, everything you need is there. We will certainly stay here again when we next visit NY!

with Ali’s you get great value for your money - the location is perfect - near time square, near penn station, near the bus stationthe staff is great - always helpingthe rooms are well decorated although a little small (like any room in NY)

It was my birthday.I only stayed for one night.It was my birthday.The room was beautiful. The room was very clean and I slept very well. I definitely will be coming very soon. I live in Nyc never even knew we had a place like this here.

We stayed at the Aliz hotel and really enjoyed it! Service was on point! Kind front desk check in and clean room. Bell man-Kelsong could not have been more friendly and helpful! Thank you Kelsong! Definitely will be back.

I loved staying here. Customer service was amazing. My room was so clean and being located on the 34th floor like i requested was a dream and the cozy robe was magical. Not noisy at all and just a dream. i can't wait to go back :).

Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: Excellent location, spotlessly clean, attentive staff. cannot fault it.We stayed on the 32nd floor wonderful view of the city. hsd breakfast in the hotel on the last day, well stocked buffet and good value (relative to other NYC Eateries)I'd happily return without a second thought

Place is accessible to our main concern on this trip, watching all the scheduled plays we already booked. Love the deck to unwind with family and friends after the whole day walking. Farm to breakfast is perfect in meetings though needs to add food choices for breakfast thanks

The hotel opened in October 2018 The lobby is nice , small bar with a nice selection. there is a nice resturant farm to burger. vegan selection available. Check in easy ,valet parking available. The rooms are tiny , i had to go outside to change my mind (ha ha ) . The bathroom has a great shower. Good location for theaters . There is a duplex rooftop bar , although it was closed for a private event. The desk gave us 2 free drink vouchers for the lobby bar and free breakfast .

You never know what you get when you book on line, but I was very pleased with this hotel. Everything was so clean and chic. We will definitely return to this place. The staff was helpful and pleasant.

Aliz Hotel is located just off 8th Avenue on 40th. Its a short walk from Penn Station (at 34th st) and its around the corner (8th Ave) from the Port Authority Bus Terminal. This is a plus and minus. A plus if you are using public transportation to visit NYC. We parked in Secaucus and took the train in. It saved me on parking & tunnel fees. That positive is offset by a negative however. I was accosted by those in need whenever I left the hotel and walked down 40th or 8th. I also had to walk through a bit of pot smoke each time. Adjacent to the hotel is an apartment building, then a Chinese food restaurant and then an entrance to the Port Authority Bus Terminal underground. Aliz Hotel itself is nearly renovated. The rooms were small -- but that is common for the city and in older buildings. The bathroom was beautiful. Dual shower jets were glorious. The mirrors on both sides of the walls attempt to make the room look larger, but sort of fail. The bed in our room could be replaced. It was a little lumpy. Again...location location. The noise level of Times Square can be overwhelming at times. So having a good mattress can matter to a light sleeper. The room was clean. Aliz Hotel wants to be upscale. The lobby was beautiful. The bar looked entertaining. We did not use the restaurant or skytop bar. Nor did I use the cycling center below ground. I saw many guests use both so I'm sure they are very nice. Recognizing that Aliz Hotel wants to be upscale..I have to say. They put a hold of 150.00 on my card for 'incidentals'. Meaning I guess, it would be their version of the minibar? 2 Fiji 15oz waters and a 1 liter Fiji water. in a mini fridge. The 1 liter Fiji water would have cost 8.00 if I had used it. From a hospitality standpoint. I was disappointed. The reservation clerk upon checkin/check out said 'all' the hotels place holds. I've been staying in NYC for 20 years and this is the first time. I've stayed at several upscale hotels and no hold. Merely the charge for the room. Because of that...we will not return. Coupled with its location. There are better hotels, in similar locations. The staff was nice. They did their jobs professionally.

The hotel was nice and the location was great. I only had a problem with the door in my room I found out after a few nights that even though my door closed and the handle would not turn that with just a little pressure on the door it would open without a key. The issue was fixed after having engineering come to the room a couple times. I just felt like the staff and management didn’t care that I was dissatisfied and never came to me to apologize. Who knows how many other doors have this same problem.

Great experience clean and very friendly staff. Loved the roof top bar great service and view breathtaking. Food in the restaurant lobby was very good the wait staff friendly and helpful. Totally recommend this hotel loved everything about it.

this hotel is newly renovated, clean and nice location at Time Square. Public transport are very near. Easily to find or grab a uber. Staffs are friendly. Luggage storage service is excellent. Sky bar is nice but needs to book as it is quite popular. My 3 nights stay was very good.

Excellent 47th anniversary. Enjoyed the environment of the hotel, the noise of the city and the activity of all the people. From the moment we arrived, the staff was so very kind and welcoming. Please visit this hotel ... you won't be disappointed.
