review_body: The hotel is small but has everything you need. The customer service was amazing and the cleanliness was excellent. Very convenient if you are driving into the city. The hotel is one block away from the main action of Times Square and has a very limited room service. Overall, a great experience.

Great staff and room were clean and quite. The rooftop bar is amazing. I was a solo traveller and the staff were very welcoming. I will definitely be returning when I'm next in New York. Great location too

Hotel had an excellent location next to the Port Authority and everything looks brand new. Rooms were smallish, typical of NYC, but enough for a King Size bed and us. Bathrooms were very clean and had very nice towels. The room also included a small refrigerator. We also had a view of the Empire State building (reflected on a nearby mirrored building). We were on the 16th floor and the hotel was pretty quiet, probably since it was located between 8th & 9th Ave and not on one of the Avenues. Beautiful rooftop (inside) bar that we didn't end up using.We stayed here several nights and would definitely enjoy staying here again!

Absolutely amazing hotel for our first wedding anniversary. Great location and amenities. Really high class. Lovely rooms. Good food. Helpful first class staff. The roof top bar addition is really amazing with great views of the big apple.

Great staff and location. Rooms were comfortable. The hotel is new so the property was in very good shape and clean. The onsite café was convenient. The hotel definitely needs a full service gym. Good hotel.

Just returned from 4 nights at this hotel. It’s brand new the decor is classy and the rooms are spotlessly clean. A few of the reviews mention the room size but it didn’t cause us any issues there were 2 double beds a wardrobe and an en-suite with a fab shower. At the end of the day your only going back to the room to sleep. The location is also good your one block away from Hells Kitchen which is great for restaurants which are a lot less expensive than the ones in Times Square and your 2 blocks away from the centre of Times Square. All the staff were very friendly and couldn’t do enough for you would definitely recommend this hotel thank you for a great stay.

The location is very nice, close to everything and the view on the 26th floor was amazing , but room it self was too small, even with the king size of bed.I am not sure if I will choose to stay in this hotel next time.

Alize hotel Times Square is New York best kept secret hands down!!! Offering free WiFi & a two-story rooftop bar & lounge with views of the Manhattan skyline it’s the most amazing thing to see at night!! If that's not enough the bathroom has floor to ceiling marble beautiful!!!

review_body: You must go to form your our opinion. We really enjoyed our one night stay. The bedroom size was decent, We stayed on the 24th floor so we was able to see an AMAZING VIEW of 42nd street. the staff was very professional and helpful. Was unable to visit the roof top nightclub and lounge, but plan to visit on our next couples night out

Aliz is very close to Times Square. The rooms are a lot smaller than expected but it was fine considering most of the trip was spent out and about. The hotels overall decor is lovely and very modern. The staff is very helpful and polite.

I thought this was a great hotel, comfortable beds, nicely remodeled. Not quite as close to times square as I thought it would be but not bad. Great staff. They have a stupid policy that you can not even walk into the rooftop bar to check out for future stays if you aren't buying a drink.

We stayed here for 5 nights at the end of January and I couldn’t fault the hotel at all. It is a brilliant location and the price was great, you can pay far more for hotels which aren’t anywhere near as good in NYC. The rooms aren’t massive but it’s New York and to be expected, they are beautiful rooms which are really modern and very clean

I booked a deluxe king room for one night while attending a conference at the Javitz Center.The location is convenient to the Convention Center and to Times Square.The lobby is modern and clean and the reception desk was polite, but not overly friendly and seemed like they were still learning the position.My room on the 24th floor was tiny! There was no space to put any of my belongings in the room, very little closet or drawer space.A very strange space with a mirror next to the window.Bathroom was also small and nothing spectacular. Bed was comfortable.I didn't try the restaurant as it was closed when I arrived after 10pm and there was no room service available either.Price was reasonable-about $150, but only good if you don't need much or want excess service.

I and my girlfriend went for 5 days and the trip was great, we loved the city. The hotel was more the adequate while we were there, the staff were helpful, the rooms were clean and it's in a great location. Although the trip was tainted and spoilt when I returned home. As part of New York state law, the hotel takes a $150 dollar payment (I've yet to receive this back, which they claim is my bank & I've never had a problem with before) which is fine. However they also decided to charge me again for my prepaid room, I've noticed now I am not the first person this has happened to. After calling the hotel they advised me to email, they responded to my first email but decided to ignore the next two! After calling again they claimed on the phone that this had been refunded, but I'm yet to see any sign of my money! I'm over £300 out of pocket at this point and I essentially view this as theft! I would have happily recommended this hotel to any friend or colleague as my company has an office around the corner, but there is now no chance of that. In honesty, the hassle this has caused me in relation to the actual stay does not make it worth it!

The Aliz Hotel is couldn't be in a better location. There is a subway stop on the same block, close to Time Square, but far enough away that you aren't bothered by the lights and noise. The bathroom is spacious and modern with great water pressure and tons of space in the shower.The beds were a solid meh...The beds move easily from the wall and the pillows are pretty bad. My neck still hurts from sleeping there.If you're going to NYC for a quick getaway and want to stay somewhere central to all the action..the Aliz Hotel is perfect for you.

We booked this hotel on a special and it was well worth it. Great location, easy to walk around and go to all the various sights and activities since it was close to things. The room was a typical New York size room with a king bed. The bathroom was very nice and the room itself was very nice. Everything was new like and we had a nice scene from our window. There is also a nice restaurant on the premise and a nice bar located in the lobby area. There is a 40th floor bar which allows one to enjoy NY even better. Nice place to stay and get around easily.

I will definitely stay at Aliz Hotel again. I do not speak English very well and everyone looked for a way to make our stay exceptional. They always greeted and looked for ways to make me feel very good. We were a group of 7 friends and we were all amazed with everything.

Pretty average hotel. The location and the breakfast were good. The room was not very clean. During housekeeping the elevator was used by the staff so we ended up having to take the stairs 16 floors to get to the lobby.

Nice boutique hotel with active lounge on top floor; easy check in with walking distance to countless restaurants, shopping, rail and bus station. Rooms are a nice size with blackout shades, sufficient WiFi service and wet bar amenities.

Excellent.....comfortable and convenient hotel. The roof top bar has great bartenders and drinks, and view is amazing. Beds are so comfortable and the staff is very friendly... we will be back for sure next year and will pick this hotel for sure.

Location can’t be beat. Customer service needs improvement. The staff at the reception and at the rooftop bar were both rude. Lobby can get extremely crowded during busy check-in and check-out times as there’s no space for luggage while you’re waiting to speak with someone at the reception desk.

It's new..opened October 2018. Found this place through BA's Janurary sale.What a find!! Spent ages looking for a 'nice' hotel in NY and quite frankly was put off going looking at the hotels for our budget, all looked well worn and many reviewed as 'could be cleaner', as soon as we saw the Aliz we booked there and then.Our deluxe double was stylish & spotless, the bedding was high quality and the bed was super comfy. There's plenty of USB plug sockets, nice mood lighting, big flat screen, fully marbled white bathroom with a shower.You want a view..from our 37th floor we could see the Empire State Building from our bed, (big shout out to Kelvin for picking this room for us and taking the time to meet us personally)There is a 'sky bar' on the 40th floor (42nd floor opening soon) which is a great and stylish place to view the city at night.All the staff are friendly and genuinely interested in making guests stays a great experience. Would return without any hesitation..it's our 'go to' New York place.

We stayed in this hotel for 3 nights. The location of the hotel is great, with plenty of good restaurants/bars close by. The staff at the hotel were very friendly & helpful. They recommended some lovely diners for breakfast & restaurants for dinner. They held the door for us when leaving & entering the hotel. The rooms are small but they are clean & the bed is very comfy. But we are in NYC so there is so much to do & see that the room is just for bedtime & is perfect for a good nights sleep. The showers do take time for the water to get hot but once you know that then it is no prob at all. The rooftop bar is really buzzy & again the staff up there were very friendly. We would definitely stay in this hotel again.

My partner and I are currently staying at the Aliz. After a very long flight we arrived at the Aliz to not be greated or welcomed. We made our way over to the front desk and took it upon ourself to introduce ourselves and ask to be checked in. We got the reply ‘our system is down, give me your credit card and take a seat’. 40 minutes later we was handed a room key. Our room on the 7th floor was the smallest hotel room I have ever seen with a view of a car park and nothing else. I went straight back down to the front desk to be greeted with ‘what do you want’ from the reception staff. I explained that I want a bigger room with a nice view. I was told all the rooms were the same size but after several sighs the manager agreed I could move.We are currently staying on the 30th floor, the room is so small we have to walk over our suitcases to get to the bed and our shower is freezing cold. You can leave it running for 10 minutes and get a luke warm shower but that’s about as good as it gets. Hotel interior is new and lovely however I will not be staying here again unless the staff and showers change!

This hotel was everything and more! The room, the location, everything was excellent! A few minute walk from time square, close enough to everything and definitely a hotel worth staying at. Def coming back to this hotel when I get back to NY!

So, to start positive; the stay was perfect. The hotel has a great location, rooms are def big enough and the rooftop bar is great. The view is amazing. We loved staying in this wonderful hotel. There are some points this hotel can work on, check in was not personal or friendly at all. The receptionist was calling while checking me in, not even apologizing or explaining to me. 1 out of 3 elevators was broke, this made the wait sometimes more than 15 minutes. All of this is understandable, the hotel is new and i’m sure that once they will improve this your stay will be great. Once again, the room and it’s location are perfect. The bad ending was the bill we got. They have charged us breakfast, that we have never ever used! They didn’t show the bill while checkout and told us that everything was okay, that they will charge the room and that’s it. Returning home and finding out you are charged for a (really expensive) breakfast you haven’t had, is ending on a bad note. I already emailed them but they are not responding as fast as before. So i guess it’s just wait and see..

Nice rooms, clean enough. Lifts were slow at peak times but service from the staff was really good. If you want to spend more time downtown then probably not the best location but great for Times Square and the main attractions. Rooftop bar is expensive but good view and nice drinks. Nice hotel, would come again.

Friendly and accommodating staff, engaging front office manager, Anthony DelVecchio. Spotless hotel and rooms with the most plush bathrobe I've ever worn. Including a meal would be most welcomed. All and any eating facilities nearby including an indoor mall opposite the Aliz.

Thoroughly enjoyed my stay at Aliz! I stayed here with my family for three nights from 16th-19th January and none of us had any complaints. The room was very modern, clean and tidy with comfy beds and a lovely view! The room was fairly compact, but didn’t feel claustrophobic. The hotel is in a great location, few minutes walk from Port Authority Bus Terminal, which is very useful for getting around! Times Square is just a few minutes walk away also. Staff were helpful and friendly. My family and I would especially like to thank the lovely Zachary who greeted us and took our luggage upon our arrival and also helped us with our luggage on our way home too. On our last day we left our luggage in a store room upstairs as check out was at 11am and our flight wasn’t until later on that day. As we were leaving the hotel the evelvators became very busy, and to save time Zachary carried all of our heavy luggage down the stairs from the the luggage store room to the hotel lobby. There were six of us each with full size suitcase and hand luggage cases!!! We were extremely impressed, thank you very much Zachary!

Let's begin with the booking. I booked through travelzoo.com and received an amazing rate of $127.00 per night. We stayed 2 nights January 2nd and 3rd. I called the hotel directly to see if we could add another night for the 1st but they were sold out. The rate quoted was $375.00. Big difference!We arrived at the hotel at 11:00 am on The 2nd and thought we would store or luggage untill the check in time later that evening. Upon arrival, we were greeted by a well dressed porter and front desk attendant. There were no lines. The lobby is very modern and clean. The lady who checked us in was friendly and efficient. She stated they would not need to to store or luggage and could accommodate us right away. We were so excited to get into our room early!****When we got into the elevator we realized it would not work until you flashed your card over a reader. This is a VERY important detail that needed to be told when we checked in. There were 5 other people in the elevator with us and they had no idea either. I am use to inserting a card to go to certain floors but not to actually "run" the elevator. ********I read all the negative reviews on the size of the rooms ahead of time. I found the room to be a good size. There were 3 of us ladies with several bags each and we made it work. The room decor was beautiful. The room was EXTREMELY Clean. The marble bathroom was so nice. Water pressure was firm and the water was HOT. That is all I need to be happy. The room temperature was hot. We cut it down several times but it seemed to never truly cool off. **** The chrome door handle on the sliding bathroom door was very sharp. I did not break skin but came very close several times****The rooms provided hair dryers, coffee , tea and water. Only the small Fiji waters are complimentary. The large ones are at a cost.We had absolutely no complaints on our room. We used the do not disturb the entire time so I have no opinion on steward staff.On our way out to explore the city, we noticed flavored water in the lobby. What a very nice touch!We did not dine in the restaurant. We did utilized the roof top bar. We got into the elevator and couldn't figure out why it would go to the top floor. I finally gave up and asked someone. They told me that all the elevators do not go up. You have to use a specific one. *** There were no signs and the front desk did not mention this***The second you step off the elevator to the rooftop it takes your breathe away! Remarkable views of the city. There are 2 sides of the lounge, make sure you visit both directions. The doors are Plexiglas and appear to have the ability to open all the way for alfresco dining in the summer. I can only imagine what that will be like!We ordered a drink and was told they couldn't make it. That they only could make drinks from their list. I looked over the cocktails and settled on a Manhattan. I am in the Hospitality business and have been for 27 years. This was the first time I have ever returned a drink. It was not good. I apologized to the bartender, he explained that they only serve Pre- prohibition drinks and that they may be an acquired taste. I'll say.. It just wasn't good.In my experience you shouldn't limit your offerings to one "type" of cocktail. But he took care of us and credited the drink. He was very accommodating.The area around the hotel is fine. Some people say it is sketchy. Not at all. It is very close to the Subway too!Times square in 5 minutes walk. Great location for everything! We thoroughly enjoyed our stay. I will definitely be back. I am a fan!I hope you find this review helpful! I am happy to answer any questions you may have.

Spent a weekend in NYC just after thanksgiving to see the tree at Rockefeller, go ice skating and do all the tourist stuff. Hotel was located in a very accessible area (I don't know NYC too well), enough to be able to walk to all the major midtown attractions.Hotel was nice and clean and our room was also very nice.Front desk and staff were attentive and polite.Price was great.Overall I really enjoyed this hotel.

review_body: After looking at some of the negative reviews about this hotel I wasn’t expecting too much, however completely ignore those reviews, I’m not quite sure what they are talking about.The room is of ample size unless you wanna breakdance in your room, it was clean and extremely comfortable, all the ammenities you could expect and more. Ok there’s no iron however there’s a steamer in the cupboard. The bathroom was lovely, my only Critisism is that the water takes a very long time to heat up ( allow at least 10 mins for water to heat up)Great location for all attractions and places to eat.The High line is a short walk and worth the visit.Be sure to check out the roof bar the views are amazing.Overall this hotel is a solid 9/10, I just hopeIt stays that way.

Well, as I have said in the title, this was a great hotel stay until after I checked out. It was my dream to visit New York but did not have a good experience with accommodation. Having not realized this is a new hotel, I booked without much hesitation as the room prices were good value, considering it was over the new year period. After reading other reviews and the experience I had I now see the hotel has a lot of teething problems. So when myself and my partner checked in my bank card was CHARGED the full amount of the stay plus a 150 dollar deposit, which I understand as this is a lot of hotels policy. I was told this was going to be the only payment taken because logically it included the room and deposit. So why would there be a need to charge the card again? Little did I know. We had a nice three day stay, the room was comfortable and clean, the rooftop bar was excellent and the location of the hotel was pretty much perfect. To me the rate of the room seemed very fair as it was a great hotel in the centre of manhattan.What caused me stress and hassle was when we checked out the girl at the reception, who was quite unfriendly, failed to mention that my card would be charged the full room rate once again. She said everything had been taken care of with the room when we checked in. So we left. The next day I checked my bank and discovered the card had been charged again. So at this point the hotel had taken 549 + 399 dollars from my account. The excuse is that the 549 is held, but it is as good as taken out as the bank does not allow you to withdraw that money and therefore you are left with very little money, as most people I imagine are in January after the holidays. This to me was totally unacceptable. After trying to solve this over the phone with a woman who worked at the hotel, who more or less told me I was mistaken and definitely didnt have any time for me, I had to get in contact with the manager of the hotel, who told me the first charge would be refunded to my account within 10 business days. Then after the 10 business days my card was charged 399 dollars again! For what reason this is beyond me...then I had to wait another 2-3 days for that to be refunded.Safe to say I am very unhappy and will not be staying again.If you choose to stay at Aliz be sure the same doesnt happen to you.

Good location and a brand new hotel. Rooms are small, but very comfortable and well appointed. Bathrooms are beautifully done with great showers. Staff is very friendly. When they found out we were celebrating our anniversary, they gave us a complimentary glass of champagne. Roof top bar is beautiful, but a little pricy. Restaurant downstairs is good for a quick bite, mostly burgers, but very good. They also serve a buffet breakfast, but we went out for breakfast. We got a great deal on room since it was brand new and January, would definitely return if prices hold.

Lake Grove, New York

review_body: Aliz Hotel is a 4 stars very well located close to times square. The rooms are very clean with space enough, the service good and the roof top bar is a must. I recommand strongly. I will go there again

Worst New Year’s Eve party ever. We were promised access to the rooftop and a party until 2.30. Access to the rooftop was denied and the party shut down before 1. Hotel management was unable to come up with any solutions, restaurant manager and security were extremely rude! Very bad experience, don’t go here!

Great hotel! Very clean and comfortable and the rooftop bar has excellent views of the city. I would definitely stay st this hotel again. The hotel staff was very accommodating and friendly. It’s a new hotel.

We really enjoyed our stay at this hotel. Nice updated theme,convenient location near times square. Our rooms were clean with friendly staff and a rooftop bar. Breakfast was too expensive though but that's york.

We enjoyed our trip to New York City!! Aliz hotel was comfy, clean and we experienced wonderful customer service!!! We loved the roof top bar!!! We definately will come back and also would highly recommend this hotel!!!!!!!

Hotel was excellent. The hotel is located in Times Square. We have barely used other transportation. Pleasent and helpful staff. Beautiful rooms. Comfortable beds. Rooftop bar on 41st floor with great view on Manhattan skyline.

Two double beds and a good sized room. Nice glitzy bathroom and big fluffy towels. White clean linens. Perfect and good online prices. Smack bang in the middle of everything. Very good service. Reasonable room service prices but expensive bar downstairs. Would happily return:)

Clean, friendly and great location. Room was a little small, but it’s NY...Hotel is brand new and very clean. Our biggest fear was booking a hotel that looks good online and then getting something different when we showed up. This place is as advertised.

No UBERS, just a few minutes walking to great shows and dining was our goal. Another was a new hotel (I am kind of a germ bug and don't care for older hotels). The Aliz was perfect. Well appointed rooms, great bathroom (the rooms are small but very well designed). The 40th floor has two bars and views of the Empire State Building. Both at sunset and night, this was an amazing added bonus. A few hiccups in service, as expected with a new staff, but definitely will be back.

They didnt have much of a variety on there roof bar witch was disapointing everything else was absolutely amazing. Very clean. Great staff. The price was amazing for the location will definitly consider it again for my next visit to NYC!

I stayed at the Aliz last weekend to be in the heart of New York. I also like the fact that the hotel is brand new. The lobby is small but nice and same for the room. The bed is comfortable and the bathroom was clean. The main plus point for me was the amazing woman at reception who was not only charming and professional but also very knowledgeable. She gave me lots of tips about restaurants and places to visit. She is British and very smiley and her name is Kit. If you stay here, make sure to ask for her. She really made my stay!

review_body: I booked through Booking.com. I’m not being compensated in any way for this review.For the past month, I’ve stayed in a couple of different NYC hotels. I am a frequent visitor to NYC and am very familiar with all of the boroughs. However, despite my many trips through Port Authority, I had no idea that this hotel was literally next door on 40th street. Most of my hotel stays have been at Marriotts around the country, so that is my “gold standard” for hotel service, quality and amenities. Aliz Hotel is solid gold. This hotel is all about luxurious details so prepare to be “wowed”!The location is perfect for tourists. Port Authority is not only an interstate travel hub, but the subway system is inside, so all you have to do is cross the street and be connected to almost all of the subway lines. Plus you’re only 2 blocks from Times Square.CHECK IN: I was immediately and warmly greeted when I arrived early. I was allowed to check-in early, which was very convenient because I was very tired from traveling. There is a $150 incidentals credit or debit card hold. The lobby is clean, gorgeous and luxurious with many seating areas. When I arrived there was no Elevator operator, but later that afternoon and evening, polite young men were stationed to press “Up” or “Down” for me which was a nice touch, but probably too extravagant for my taste.Elevator service is fast (there are 41 floors) and the Elevator is an experience with music and mirrors! My room on the 12th floor had a nice view of Times Square and only 1 window. I could also look down on Port Authoritys rooftop garage which I never knew existed!MY ROOM: Extremely elegant and clean room as pictured. Unfortunately, I did not get one with a bathtub. I asked the Front Desk about it and was told that rooms with tubs must be requested. The bed was the most comfortable I’ve slept in (other than the world famous Marriott bad). My bed at the Holiday Inn-Financial District was very good, but not as good as this one. My bed at the Hilton-Garden Inn Midtown was also not as comfortable as this one. But my bed at Madison LES is a close second to this one.The COMPLIMENTARY ROBE was soooo soft!The floors DO NOT HAVE CARPET so bring slippers or your feet will be cold. Lots of TV channels. Because I was feeling a little sick, I stayed in more than usual. I was surprised by how many cable channels were available. There is a FRIDGE in the room stocked with WATER (you will have to pay if you drink it). I didn’t have any food to store in it so ask the front desk before you open it.The BATHROOM is OUTSTANDING. The shower attachment is very rare in hotel rooms, especially at this price point (Less than $100/night). The bathroom wall has a light timer of 1,5, 10, or 20 minutes. Every surface is marble (or marble-ized) and sparkling clean. Water temperature is consistently hot at all times of day and night. The toilet tissue is artfully arranged. Excellent goat’s milk amenities (shower gel, shampoo/conditioner, lotion, and handsoap. A DOORBELL is on your room. So when the Front Desk brought me sugar, they rang it. It’s a very cute touch.NYC hotel rooms are not large and I felt a little cramped (I’m 5’5’”) so a really tall or large person may still feel slightly cramped,but the elegance of this property is worth it.STAFF: Both front desk and housekeeping were all warm and polite. I asked a couple of different staff how to get to the business center, including one who appeared to be off duty and everyone was consistently warm and polite. BUT I think the front desk staff should at least offer upgrades or ask about preferences (like high floor availability).AMENITIES: I used the business center downstairs with my iPad to wirelessly print. It’s just a corner with two computers and a printer.The gym is right next door. It’s not full service, just a few treadmills. As soon as the elevators open, anyone can see you working out.The ROOFTOP deck is SIMPLY EXTRAORDINARY. You must go up at night. The view is spectacular.DRAWBACKS: Old-fashioned chain shade pulley in room. It was very loud and a bit hard to pull. No complimentary breakfast (restaurants are on site). If you want an ultra-elegant and affordable stay in the city, THIS IS IT!

The hotel is not worth your time. They promise special new years events which they can not provide. On top both the front desk and general manager were unable to provide solutions and started to close the venue two hours earlier than promised. A shame.

Exceptional cleanliness. Loved that there is no carpet in rooms or reused comforters. The restaurant breakfast was delicious and great server Disappointed rooftop bar closed on Tuesdays. Overall an excellent experience

The hotel is in a great location. They held my bags prior to check in and after checking out. The room was comfortable and clean. The staff was friendly and helpful. I will definitely stay here again!

For my last minute trip to NYC before New Year's Eve, I came across this hotel. Immediately upon arriving I was blown away at how courteous and accommodating the hotel staff was. I had arrived 8 hours prior to check in, and although my room was not ready, I was able to leave my luggage in storage and they offered to text me when it would be ready. This allowed me to head around town, grab breakfast and get things done without having to worry about my luggage. The staff reached out to me 2 hours prior to the check in time and informed me that our room was ready! It was, without a doubt, a surprise and delight moment in which they also offered to bring our luggage to our room. The rooftop lounge had a stunning view of the city, and the servers were also pleasant. Joseph served us two nights, and his customer service was exceptional alongside his suggestions. The lounge is only open from 4-11, and when we asked, they mentioned that it was because it was still relatively new. This worked out for us because it wasn't crowded or overly busy. The room was slightly tight, but it was comfortable, had a great view and did had everything we needed. The Aliz is a hotel that I will continue to stay at in my many upcoming trips back to New York City, and is one I will suggest to family and friends wishing to visit. It is a reasonable distance from the shows on Broadway, Times Square, Hell's Kitchen and many amazing $1 slice pizza places for those late-night adventure seekers!

We stayed at the Aliz hotel for 4 nights. The hotel itself is very modern and luxurious. The rooms are extremely clean. The staff are friendly and helpful. The hotel is in an excellent location. We will 100% be returning.

The rooftop lounge closes extremely early. The security staff is rude. The elevators performs slowly. The rooms are tiny. I could touch the toilet from the bed. It’s deserted out front and is next door to a liquor store resulting in many stragglers nearby.

We were looking for a place to stay near a theater where my son was performing and this was a perfect location! Just about everywhere we needed to go was within a 10 minute walk. The hotel was very clean, the rooms were very small but functional, elevators very prompt, and staff accommodating. Because of the small rooms we couldn't gather with family...and there really wasn't any quiet place to come together to hang out for a little while unless you wanted to go to the restaurant or sit in the busy lobby. Would have been nice to have some kind of little space for that.

A good Hotel, well situated, although the area is too noisy. Good value for money. I would recommend it. Shuld have more facilities in rooms, for instance a microwave. And more chairs un thge room, we had to ask for an extra chair.

A great stay if you want to be close to pretty much everything Manhattan has to offer. Love the beds, very soft and comfy! The staff knows how to skip directly to all the goodies without any fuzz!Just around the corner is the Port Authority bus terminal which will take you to Woodbury Outlet and more. Here's also the taxi service point.

The Hotel was in a great location. It wasn’t to far from anything. The room was a bit small but the Decor of the room was awesome. The bathroom was cool but should of had a tub. The room service food was not so good, but my overall experience was ok. Also the deposit was unnecessary was more than the room cost.

Checkin was pretty quick. Not much help with bags or door in lobby. Room was a typical smaller NYC room but very nice! Very clean and very modern. There seems to be some unfinished business at the Aliz. Not a bad price for a night in the Big Apple. Centrally located about a 7 minute walk to Times Square. Breakfast an NYC typical $25 per person. I would return to the Aliz and just hope next time everything is all done.

Amazing birthday weekend stay at the Aliz Hotel! Superb staff. Beautiful decor and clean rooms. Bed was very comfortable and walls soundproof, couldn't even hear the hustle and bustle from the city streets.

Stayed last week - Fantastic hotel, wonderful service from the staff who could not have been more helpful and a fantastic bar on the 40th floor (shout out to the hospitable and knowledgable Justin). Amazing holiday all in all - thank you!A quick stroll away from times square & surrounding area - but far enough away to not get tied up in the noise and disruption that comes with that area. Good bars & restaurants within a block.

The Aliz is a amazing hotel !!! Great staff !!! Joshua is such a wonderful and helpful staff member !!!! I would definitely stay at the Aliz again !!! Roof top bar AMAZING !!!! Thanks so much and see you next time !!!!

Aliz hotel in times square is a beautiful hotel, but if you are a single lady staying in this hotel, I wouldn't recommend to stay on your own as alot of people in this area are on drugs and I have witnessed them being violent towards each other from just walking down the road so i personally wouldnt recommend a women travelling on her own to stay here but it's a beautiful hotel, a lovely roof top bar, beds are very comfy and staff are very pleasant to deal with.

Stayed at the aliz hotel 18 th dec to 27 th hotel was lovely and beautifully decorated. The room was very small but most rooms are small in newyork. The bed was amazing we had a great sleep. Housekeeper was in everyday and made beds. Floor wasn’t brushed mind you. But wasn’t a problem. The roof top bar is amazing . The views are spectacular. Hotel is right next to port authority and in a great location. Staff were lovely we got floor 8 and I asked for higher and got floor 35, wasn’t s problem. Found them all very helpful and polite. Def stay in the aliz again and will recommend to family and friends.

Loved the whole experience.Staff was wonderful.Breakfast was great. Loved the fresh fruit and the almond croissant. And breakfast crew were attentive.Michael went above and beyond (Thank You!!!)We would stay at this hotel again.

First off when I walked in there were 3 ppl at the desk. One on a call the other 2 chit chatting. There was no one else checking in yet I waited to be greeted and acknowledged and surprisingly they really acted as if they all didnt just see me walk in. One person walked away, the other still on a call and the young lady just stood there STILL not acknowledging me or calling me over to check me in. A few minutes pass and she looks around then asks me "Are you being helped?" I said "How am I being helped when you just watched me walk in and still havnt said anything to me?" She said Oh im sorry and proceeded to check me in. The room I got was on thee 10th floor, as I opened the door I got gum stuck all over my hand because someone put gum all over the knob of the door to enter the room. I called front desk I was moved immediately. The 2nd room I got was on the 38th floor and although it was nice and high up, the room was pre-made for someone else! I had a baby pack & play in the room, a fruit plate and a welcome card or a "Heather" ??? I ate the fruit none the less. The worse part of my stay was being woken up at 7am by the fire alarm in the building which went off until 9 am!!!!! All you can hear is the Fire Safety Director speak that he was trying to figure it out but meanwhile the alarm would not stop!! Now I work in hotels so I knew this was a false alarm however alllll the frantic people who ran out their rooms was insane. I had to be at work early and booked this room to sleep and be close but I was better off sleeping at home. It left e with such a bad impression, dont think Ill recommend or go back again.

The hotel is really well located at a short walk to the Subway stop "Port Authority".Arrived with my sister on December 21, the welcomr was absolutely not warm, you have the impression that you disturb. The hotel is very dark + the non-friendly staff can be very repulsive. I had requested a room in the high floors and I get a room on the 5th floor, the problem was solved the next day. The room is very cocooning but extremely small (a suitcase can not open in the room, you will have to put it on the bed to do this). The bedding is excellent and the room was clean. Cleaning is done at the end of the day around 6pm. Even if the floor is dirty the housekeeper does not the vacuum or broom. The maid only remakes the bed. During my stay I was "hacked", someone took control of my phone. It only happened when I was in the room, outside and in France I never had this kind of problem ... I would not recommend this hotel. The real big problem of this one being the staff ... I understand that the staff is young but it would be necessary to make an important effort and to review its bases of customer relations...

Very good location. Walking distance to time square ,central library,5th avenue,trump building,central station, walk to the threat on the broadway. So many delicious and famous restaurant around the hotel

My wife, 19 and 16 year old stepsons, and myself loved staying here. The location of the hotel was perfect for us. You're pretty much right at Times Square and you have great access to the subway and walking distance to about anything you could want to visit.All of the staff was super friendly to us. Joshua went out of his way to make our stay memorable. I've seen some people say the rooms are small, but from what I've read, most hotel rooms in NYC are on the smaller side. The four of us had no problem staying in a double room. We thought the rooms were very nice, especially for the price. It had a big screen tv, mini fridge, Keurig, hair dryer, steam iron and a shower with a handheld showerhead if you wanted to use it. We thought the décor was beautiful too.We were able to go into the rooftop bar to see it before it was open for the evening, which we were very appreciative of. The views from there were AMAZING!! If I had to pick something negative, the only "complaint" from our entire stay at the hotel was we asked two different people if the rooftop bar would be open Sunday night and we were told yes both times. Unfortunately, when we tried to go to it Sunday night, we were told that it's closed on Sunday and Monday nights. I'm sure being a new hotel and new staff, there was just a miscommunication. If that's the worst of our stay, we can deal with it.I think you'll be happy staying at this new hotel if you give it a chance.

We stayed at the Aliz hotel for 2 nights in December (we cancelled the third night due to problems we experienced during our stay).Location: Close to Times Square but the hotel has been built in a rather grubby part of town close to the Port authority bus station. I suppose it has built to improve the street so hopefully the rest of the street will be updated soon too!Room: Extremely small but very clean. We had an issue where the toilet blocked. I called housekeeping at 6am but they do not start until 7am so someone came to fix the toilet but the bathroom was still flooded so we could not use it. I asked for housekeeping to come urgently. When we returned to our room in the late afternoon it was still not cleaned. We had to go downstairs to wait for at least an hour until it was cleaned. We were told it was ready but when we went upstairs it was still not done. Went downstairs again to wait and were offered complimentary drinks at the restaurant. Unfortunately the staff were not told they were complimentary and ran after us for payment!Restaurant: Breakfast is good. Cereals and fruit and some hot options of egg, sausage and bacon but these were only luke warm. Lunch/Dinner at the restaurant was excellent although the menu has limited choices.We would have liked to visit the newly opened rooftop bar but this was closed for private functions on both nights we were there.The reception staff were not very friendly and I got the impression that because the hotel is so new, the staff are rather untrained. With so many hotel choices in New York, this hotel needs to up their game. It's sad because it could be fantastic with just a bit more attention to detail and customer service.

This Hotel is in a great location near Times Square and Bryant Park. It is very clean and the staff are extremely helpful and kind. Will definitely be back. The rooftop bar is worth a look. Most all sites a walk away

Staff were very friendly. I did not encounter any issues during my stay. I slept really well. The morning light did not stop me from sleeping. I ordered room service during my stay and I really enjoyed the food.

Wonderful location, great hotel, it exceeded my expectations! Close to all the attractions. The staff were very friendly and helpful. Arrived 2 hours early and they were very accommodating. Front desk staff were helpful with local sites to see.

I booked this hotel last minute for a 2 day stay and i must say it did not disappoint. It was spacious enough for 2 to 3 people and the room was new and designed with clean and minimum clutter.The bathroom was clean and absolutely modern in design as well as the bedroom. THis hotel is located right next to the Port Authority subway and bus terminal which made it so convenient for those that will not be able to walk much. Times Square was just up the street on 42nd and a 5 minute walk away...Will most definitely be visiting again as the Front Desk and Lobby personnel were friendly and helpful!!

I had the opportunity to stay away the Aliz Hotel recently ....and I have to say this place was an amazing place to stay. The decor re-add very modern and minimalist in my opinion, lots of glass and marble. The rooms are immaculate ....and extremely comfortable with a fantastic view on NYC. The bathroom was all glass and marble with plenty of towels. Keurig coffee maker, hair dryer, clothing steamer and plenty of hand in the wardrobe. Are slept like babies ....and checkout was seamless in short a most stay hotel of your're on New York City .

Good points - Good place to stay. It is in a good location for shopping and tourist bits. Room rates are reasonably priced and unl8ke most of New York you paid what you were quoted and there we NO hidden extras - a definite plus point. Also staff were very polite and helpful.Negative points - nothing really to note about. As it’s a new hotel there were obviously a few problems with slow/late room cleaning and fire alarms going off but these were basic teething problems that I am sure will get sorted out.

The location is perfect and the price is decent for that location. ad a small problem with the elevators but it was no big deal. Also they had a fire drill at 7 in the morning, which was kind of weird.. Other than that it was really nice

I never write reviews but please consider this before booking your stay with Aliz. I woke up in my room at 7am to the sound of a loud fire alarm that was going off in every room throughout the hotel. It went on for about 10 minutes before it was turned off. I called the front desk and they said it was a false alarm. It then proceeded to go off again. And again. The alarm went on and off again and again (starting at random times until someone shut it off) over the course of the next TWO HOURS (7am - 9am), and when they finally had it under control at 9am and the alarm stopped going off, they announced over the loud speaker (which is in every hotel room) that it was a false alarm and they have everything under control now.I attempted to call the front desk to see if I could get a late check out, but nobody would answer the front desk from my hotel room phone.When I went down to check out, I asked for a partial refund. Given that the fire alarm was going on and off over the course of 2 hours (about 20 times total... not an exaggeration), I thought this would be fair. The woman at the front desk went to speak with a guy (I’m assuming he was the manager), and then came back to tell me they’re not offering discounts but instead are offering credit for a future stay. I asked if there was anything they could do about THIS stay, and she said unfortunately not. I then agreed to a credit and she went back to talk to the manager (same guy as before, presuming he’s the manager), and then they both came back and he told me that “the information had been miscommunicated to me and that credit is only being offered for repeat customers”. Since I hadn’t stayed with them before, the offer was not open to me. I asked if there was anything they could do and they said they couldn’t since it was a real fire alarm (which isn’t true because it went off about 20 times on and off and they also ANNOUNCED to every hotel room that it was a false alarm), and then the manager walked away. It’s the holiday season in NYC and this hotel wouldn’t give me the time of day or consider my basic needs. There are so many options in NYC and Times Square - Consider your other options before staying at Aliz. Truly close to the worst hotel experiences I’ve ever had. If you want to feel rested for your day in NYC, choose another hotel!

Stayed here for business last week. A great location with a good price. Rooms were small but very nice. Location was great, only a couple of blocks from the subway station. Times square lots of restaurants and night life to choose from. Would stay here again when back in town.

Pros:-location (easy walking distance to Times Square)-chic lobby w/ very nice bar & barman-in house restaurant lunch & dinner is good-wonderful view of the city-spacious room & bathroom-very comfortable bed & pillows-mini fridge in roomCons:-no black out curtains (usually a deal braker for me but wasn't bad!)-breakfast buffet is extremely overpriced-no complimentary bottled water ($8 for Fiji)In conclusion, I loved this hotel and hope to stay here again. Yes, it was expensive but, in my opinion, worth it. You get what you pay for!

I was able to booked this room for a really good price on booking.com. Most rooms with two beds were listed for at least $300 per night I’m assuming due to the influx of people visiting NYC for the Christmas holiday. Location: The hotel is in a great spot. The street the hotel is on has a plethora of other hotels and many eating places. Short walk to the middle of Time Square. Hotel: From my understanding the hotel is fairly new so the interior and exterior reflect a modern clean feel. There is a bar, sitting area, and of course check in desk. The young lady who checked us in was great. She informed us about the hotel’s amenities. This is a boutique hotel so smaller in nature but plenty of modern charm. The room itself was a typical smaller NYC hotel room. Reading the reviews from guest I gather most people have either have never travelled to NYC or have not read the reviews regarding the room size. Guys... please understand the room is not huge and you shouldn’t expect that in NYC. I booked a double room (2 beds). It was equipped with tv & chair and desk area, clean and bright white marble bathroom, and and a small cabinet which housed a Keureg coffee maker with sugar, cream, etc. there were plenty of hangers provided but not enough for two people so decide what’s important and hang accordingly. Keep in mind there is NO closet. There is one luggage crate so again decide who gets what. The beds were very comfortable and the lines were fresh and clean. The bathroom was clean and had plenty of towels for two people. My gripe regarding the bathroom would be the bathrobe. With booking a double room I would assume two bathrobes would be provided but no only one. The outside room doors in proximity to other doors are VERY close. With that in mind please be aware you will be able to hear conversations outside your door and doors slamming as well. No fault of the hotel you should just be aware. Now for the not so good:Elevators: On the website it states the hotel has invested in a state of the art elevator system. Though the elevator is fast in nature unfortunately it’s not always efficient. The numbers were not accurate as it is displayed and people were visibly upset that the hotel only has 3 elevators. Rooftop loung and bar:So according to the bartenders and front desk the rooftop lounge and bar has only been operational for about 3 days. Let me just say it is EVERYTHING and more! The view is breathtaking and the ambiance is unmatched. Drinks were around $17. BUT for the petty unhappy me. Saturday the space had a private event so guest were only to enjoy the space for 1 hour. The special event started at 6:30pm. I was a mad somebody. This is your third day and it’s closed!!!!!!! Ok... so let’s fast forward to Sunday. I’m all excited it’s been raining and snowing so let me take the elevator to the 40th floor. Guest what guys it’s dark no bartenders no one. I go down to the lobby bar to ask when it’s open and guess what. IT’S NOT OPEN ON SUNDAY!!!! Now I’m speechless. Literally everyone at the lobby bar made the same statement on how they couldn’t believe it was advertised but not open. Let me make this statement so I’m clear. The more this bar is shut down the more unhappy comments will show up on TripAdvisor. I’m calling it now. They have to correct this and fast. All and all this hotel has major potential to be a great spot in NYC. Would I stay here again YES it was worth every penny.

review_body: Unless you want a SMALL ROOM with no where to hang clothes and put away anything. DO NOT STAY HERE! The room did not contain an iron which is essential for any hotel room. Upon requesting the iron, it took almost 2 hours to bring. And only AFTER if called the front desk back several times requesting a status. No place to put any bathroom cosmetics or soap. How do you expect a person to shower with their own soap, shampoo and not have any place put the items during or after use? We literally have to put the items on the shower floor? The elevators are SLOW and of the 3 in the front, one of them were block the entire time for “special” accommodations? Will not ever stay at this hotel again!

Hotel was well maintained. The staff was professional and courteous. Room was adequate though a bit small. Not a problem for a very short stay. Longer stay and more than one person would be cramped as storage is limited and women need room for their belongings!

We were in New York for a long weekend and picked this hotel to be close to the theatre and main attractions. The hotel is new which is nice. The girl who checked us is never smiled and no information about the area was given. The room was basic but clean. However, in the evening, we were greeted by the nicest receptionist we have ever met. She is called Kit and she knows everything about the area and gave us tons of information about good restaurants and places to visit and the best way to get there. By the second night she remembered our names, greeted us like old friends, remembered what show we went to see and was excited that we loved it. It felt like we were coming home. She made our stay!

Gorgeous property with the perfect location. Read the fine print carefully and know exactly what’s included. Apparently multiple websites are only suggesting that breakfast is included. That was a surprise to me at checkout when I had an extra $250 in charges for a breakfast I thought was included in my stay. One day was comped after I suggested that clearer advertising would be good. Some staff is helpful...most are not.

We travelled to NYC for a 4 day break. We arrived at the hotel near midnight we had a lovely greeting and were told we had been upgraded. Had a lovely room on the 34 floor. Despite there being 4 ladies in this room we had plenty of room. Beautiful decor and the comfiest bed I’ve slept in in a long time. Amazing hairdryer which is unusual for a hotel it actually dried our hair. Very polite and helpful staff. Room was cleaned well every day. On our day of leaving the amazing British receptionist got us off to the airport in the most reasonable and quickest way. All in all highly recommended hotel close to everything and amazing service

Good location but too expensive for value. Room is clean but everage service level of staffs. I arrivered arround 1 pm and asked early check in and she promised to call back when room is ready but no call ever.

Me and the wife have just returned from a week staying here for my 40th birthday. This hotel is amazing. Great staff, lovely and new, very clean. The hotel has everything you could ask for. We've stayed in many hotels around the world and I think Aliz hotel beds are the most comfortable. We will be back.Shame we missed out on the rooftop bar being open, but that's another addon for next time. Great location.

Stayed here in November 2018, shortly after the hotel opened. The hotel is nice, however the rooms are smaller than typical NY hotel rooms, although laid out nicely. Even though very small, two of us were able to make the room work, and had room for our luggage and other belongings. The design was modern, clean and functional. Unfortunately, the street where the hotel is located is unpleasant, and the hotel is only about a block from a dirty adult entertainment/video booth establishment. I was harassed by vagrants asking for money as I entered and exited the hotel. Maybe this will improve with time, but I would avoid this area now - as it didn't feel safe. As others have noted, the rooms do not provide typical "do not disturb" door signs, rather they have an electronic means of indicating either do not disturb or please clean my room. I had the do not disturb indicator lighted, but the maid still banged on my door at 9am. Someone should explain what DO NOT DISTURB lights mean to the maids - LOL. I probably would not stay here again, although it is a nice hotel and perhaps the neighborhood will improve and perhaps they will someday train their housekeeping staff on how the indicator lights work!

Had the best time at the new Aliz hotel! Yes the rooms aren’t as big as other cities or other locations but you’re in the heart of it all and if you’re visiting the city, you’re only in your room after a very long day of visiting the city! We had two large suitcases and two bags and were able to make the best use of our space!

First solo trip to NYC so wanted a safe and nice hotel. Aliz was clean, new (or updated?), safe and in a great location, friendly staff, reasonably priced. Great place to relax. Would definitely stay again!

Was all ready to leave a good review but having got home & found that the room we’d paid for when booking had been charged to my partners credit card again I’ve become disillusioned... despite emails & FB messages I can get no response. Great customer service before our stay - absolutely no response since .... come on Aliz, your customers deserve better.

The hotel is fairly new but seems to be off to a great start! We checked in late, around midnight, and after a long day, Kit and Michael we're absolutely delightful upon check-in. Room was clean and even the dresser still had the new wood smell to it. A+ rating coming from a hotel manager. Highly recommend this property. Thank you for such great hospitality!

Absolutely wonderful! The staff is so warm and friendly! The food and drinks were great in Farm to Burger. The room was spotless and quiet with stunning views. I really enjoyed my time and I would recommend this Hotel for anyone!

Stayed here recently one night after seeing a show at the Beacon Theater. Located right across from Port Authority and near the 8th Avenue subway. Check-in was quick, even in the middle of an early snow storm. Room was small but comfortable and clean. Loved the Beekman 1802 bathroom products. Would definitely recommend this hotel!

This is a newly opened hotel and there are obvious service issues. I'd recommend waiting until mid-2019 at the earliest before booking here again. Very slow elevators, housekeeping items missing from my room each night. Room not thoroughly cleaned every night

I booked this hotel for my boyfriends 21st birthday, and one of the reasons was for the rooftop bar. Then a couple of weeks before we were going, I looked at reviews on Facebook and someone said that it wasn’t open yet. So I contacted the hotel and they apologised that I was never told when I booked as I had paid a lot of money to stay, and that they would come and meet us when we got there to make sure everything was ok...this never happened. We got to the hotel and the receptionist tried to charge us the whole bill again as apparently they had no record of payment. I then told her I can show my online banking as I had paid it and then she dissapeared into the back to find out what happened. She then came back and was not apologetic at all, just continued to tell us we had to pay another $300 for a deposit!!! I understand paying a deposit, but $300 is very excessive and left us short for the rest of our trip. We then went up to our room and it was tiny!! The pictures on the website are very deceiving and there is no room at all, I had paid for a view and it was ok if you looked upwards but straight ahead was a huge car park! However, good parts were that check in wasn’t meant to be until 4 but our room was ready early which was great. After the first day, the rest of the staff are always happy to help and let you use the reception phone and our room was very clean. Overall, I would not reccomend this hotel if you are going for a celebration as it is probably better for business trips on your own as it is very very overpriced and cramped.

I would be very careful staying here with children. My son split his head open on the sliding bathroom door, which is very sharp to the touch. He needed 4 stitches in the back of his head. Hotel staff seemed to struggle to handle the situation, and I ended up having to walk my son to a nearby urgent care for treatment.

I stayed in the Aliz for a long weekend in mid November. The room was small but acceptable for NYC, though it did appear that the rooms were not quite ready yet (i.e. a hole in the wall above the door where a fire sprinkler likely should have been). During the stay one of the elevators went down for quite a while. This was particularly problematic just because of the limited elevators and the crowds sometimes waiting for them. The biggest problem with the hotel was the horrible customer service I received with an issue as I left. I was in a rush to leave on a Sunday and left a blue blazer inside the closet of the hotel room. I called the hotel within 24 hours to report it and asked them to send it my way. They said they hadn't found it yet but would call me back with an update. The staff never called back. I called back a day or two later only to be told they didn't find anything and that there was nothing to do. First, it is absurd to think they couldn't find the blazer given the size, location, and time in which it was reported. Second, promising a call back and then failing to deliver is absolutely unacceptable behavior from a hotel. Finally, the way the staff responded to my issue was rude and unhelpful. It is things like this that show a hotel staff isn't ready. Unfortunately it will probably keep me from ever staying at this or a related property again.

We stayed at the Aliz Hotel over Thanksgiving break for 3 nights. The hotel is brand new with gorgeous hotel rooms, beautiful views of the city, and a great restaurant & bar on site! The hotel staff was very accommodating. Would def stay again!

perfection (restaurant, rooms, employees) Everything was perfect. Smile, pro, clean, wonderful breakfast. Very quiet. I recomand this hotel without objection. We loved everything. A very good place to be

Location is great. Easy check-in and check out. Rooms were clean and decor was fabulous! Staff is very friendly and extremely efficient. Great place for all ages and is kid friendly. I will definitely go there again.

Great hotel! The rooms were lean and functional. I liked the sleek look of the black leather accents. The big mirrors on the doors were a nice addition. Big screen television. The view was of an empty parking lot, but we didn't go there to look out the window. Nice contemporary hotel and good area. Overall Great experience!

Don't get me wrong this hotel is clean and comfortable and has all the mod cons. The staff are polite and friendly. It just needs refining in a few bits. The lifts take ages to come to top floors and the have the loudest dance music playing in them all the time which is quite intrusive. No restaurant or Rooftop bar yet and it feels some processes are still bedding in. But the room itself was clean and tidy and sorted every day. Location is perfect.

Great location near Times Square and across the road from NY Port Authority Bus Terminal.Rooms have plug and USB sockets by the bed.Breakfast is available but we found the restaurant empty as lots of cheaper places close by.

I stayed at Aliz during the Thanksgiving holiday while visiting family. The hotel is centrally located, clean, and the room size was perfect for just me. The bed was very comfortable and I found the furnishings of the room and bathroom to be done really well. Uplighting in the bedroom, marble in the bathroom, mirrors throughout. The location is ideal. A brand new hotel right in the center of Manhattan. Just steps away from every major subway line and transit system as well as walking distance to other sights like Times Square and the Empire State Building. The staff was exceptionally kind and I really enjoyed my stay! Look forward to staying again!

One of the best places I have ever stayed at! Great location, AMAZING staff, cool vibe. The service is top notch. On vacation, the last thing I want to worry about is where I'm laying my head and this place is nothing to worry about at all. When in New York, I will away’s stay at Aliz hotel. There is none that compare! FIVE STARS PLUS!!!!

This is a new hotel and is just round the corner from Times Square so a great location as so much to do in easy walking distance. Hotel itself is exceptionally clean with modern decor throughout. We had a room on the 30th floor with a nice view. Room was on the small side but had all that we needed and if you’re visiting New York your hardly in your hotel so the size didn’t bother us. It was modern, clean and had the amenities needed. There’s a cleaning system button by your room door you need to remember to press if you want your room cleaned and when we had it cleaned we were impressed as was cleaned well. Staff were very friendly and very helpful. We never ate at the hotel so can’t comment on the food and rooftop bar wasn’t open (was a great shame) but still it didn’t hinder our experience. I’d certainly recommend this hotel.

This Hotel recently opened with a major renovation. We spent the weekend there Nov 17-18. It has a nice contemporary feel. It has a narrow footprint but is laid out well. The rooms are small (typical for NYC) but have a great contemporary feel, no carpet, sleek modern design. Our washroom was spacious with a heat lamp, marble surfaces and generally nicely appointed. Our King Bed was very comfortable, and they have large a large TV in each room. Staff were very helpful including the front desk. We were actually able to secure our room hours before our check in. Wifi was great! The Hotel was very clean. The location is great - and close to everything! The Port Authority Bus Terminal is across the street, and just steps to the subway. We were on the 11th floor, and our room was very quiet relative to other hotels in the area. The hallways do not have carpet, so you do get some echo from people walking around. They just opened a nice restaurant on the main floor. The only real complaint is they had issues with the slow elevator throughout the weekend causing the lobby to back up. Nonetheless, I recommend this hotel and would look forward to returning.

Stayed here for 4 nights during the NYC-marathon. Before traveling we spent a lot of time on the internet trying the find the perfect hotel I NYC. Yes, prices are high og locations are not perfect. After we found this one we had really high expectations. But they delivered! After some small problems at the check-in everything was great! Clean and quite rooms, good size, good beds, and best of all: a really cool lobbybar to just sit, relax and look at the the people.I read som reviews about slow elevators and a blue light in the rooms! ;-) Get real! The elevators are fast and the if you can't sleep because of the blue-nightlight, my tip. Run a marathon if NY hasn't worn you out already. Great hotel! Worth the money. We will be back!

loved the helpful and friendly staff! and having a nice bar and restaurant there was great! Rooms a little small but very nice and clean! Location was interesting but still pretty good, kind of on the edge! Loved the very diverse guests. Met people from everywhere in the world! We all got along wonderfully-can't understand why our governments have such a hard time getting along!Really enjoyed our stay there! Would recommend it and will come back.

Stayed at this bright, clean brand new hotel for 1 night while visiting family over Thanksgiving vacation.Room was well appointed with a coffee and tea maker , fridge and small clothes closet.Comfortable bed!Staff was very pleasant and accommodating.A terrific value for they’ve proximity to the theatre district !

We had an excellent time in the Aliz Hotel. It is a bright new modern and very practical hotel. The room was very comfortable and the view on the city from our room was fantastic. For our next trip to New York City we definitely look forward to stay with Aliz.

My husband and I had a great night in NYC at this really gorgeous, yet super cozy hotel. Location was perfect for a show in the Theater District and then a fun dinner and drinks in Hells Kitchen. A truly accommodating staff! They made sure we were enjoying our stay but also kept their distance so that we could have some peace to explore on our own. The views at night when the city is lit up are outstanding --

New hotel at excellent location. Higher floor view is nice. Room is clean but on smaller size. Overall very comfortable stay. The staff is friendly and very helpful.The gym only have cycling machines.

Great experience Loved the room. Easy checkin and out. Easy to catch any train in the city. I would definitely stay here again. Great value . Staff was very attentive. The bathroom was perfect size. And coffee in room

The 31st of October this year found me jetting off to New York for the first time. Naturally I was wondering what awaited me on the other side of the "pond" when I got there. The reviews I had read regarding the Aliz Hotel were very favourable but we all know what reviews can be like at times. Well I need not have worried, my transfer vehicle was met at the door and from there on it was 5 star service. The staff on reception were most polite and especially helpful when they knew that I was a solo traveller first time in New York and the US. They advised me on the best way to travel around and where to get a pass for the week which covered buses and the subway and also supplied me with that essential item known as a map. Also my luggage was taken up to my room while I finished the check in formalities so I was able to have a most welcome G and T in the lobby bar before going up to unpack. And what a room. Spotlessly clean well appointed with a fantastic on-suite. The shower was more than roomy and a pleasure everyday. The bed was a joy to lie in,so comfortable it was difficult to get up in the mornings and if it hadn't been New York I would probably spent most of my week away in that bed..There was plenty of toiletries in the on-suite and the bathrobe was like wearing a fluffy cloud. Excellent coffee machine as well. Would I recommend this hotel to others, certainly I am already planning a return trip in the very near future.

My husband and I live about 90 mins outside the city, so when we go in for evening theater we often stay over. We’ve stayed in many of the hotels in the theater district and decided to try the brand new Aliz last night. Big mistake. While the room was smaller than we’re accustomed to, the fact that it was brand new and immaculate made up fit that. The problems are the elevators. Only two of the three elevators were in service during our stay. And somehow, they kept passing our floor without stopping. We literally waited 20 mins to get downstairs. We heard them ding and then whiz by without stopping. When we returned after the show a fellow guest could not get the elevator to stop on his floor so he rode up to ours and walked down 5 flights. He had a key card and it just wouldn’t work. In addition to the elevators not working properly, there is the permanent problem of no service elevator. When an elevator finally stopped, in addition to being crowded with guests, the cleaning staff and their buckets were crowding on too. On my last trip out there were 5 or 6 guests in the elevator when a staff member, with a large luggage rack pushed his way on. Also, the insulation is so poor, we heard the elevators dinging until 2am. It’s really too bad, it would have been nice to have a new hotel in the neighborhood.

I stayed here for 3 nights over the weekend of nov 9-12. I understand that they just recently opened so hopefully they will improve...Pros: good location, nice new decor, friendly staff. Rooms are modernized. Nice shower and vanity. Free Fuji water bottle in fridge on first day.Cons: Elevators are dreadfully slow, bar in lobby is very awkwardly placed among traffic so i didn’t bother. Took awhile to get my checked luggage to leave.Walls are very thin, i can hear my neighbors upstairs and side. Only saving grace was that i was on the 34 floor so less outside noise.The window views are tiny so you really cant enjoy it.

Although the room is very pleasant the first room hadn't been cleaned when we entered and then we had to wait for 2 hours for another room. At no point did anyone come and speak to us, we just had to keep going to the desk to check. The staff weren't very polite about it which took the shine off our first trip to New York. Finally when we booked we also expected their roof top bar to be open which it isn't.

We booked through a promotion on hotels.com and went for a 2 night weekend stay to celebrate my sons 16th bday. We drove down and arrived around 130 and were told check in was a 4 so we planned to drop our bags and car and explore. Front desk to,d us that they had a room available so we got to check in early which was great. We were in room 3703 which had a nice city view as well as rooftop of port authority. Room was tiny even co spread to Tokyo Japan but well layer out. Bathroom was 2 feet from bed. We wished there were 2 queen beds instead of full beds which were tight for the 4 of us. Location is great, 5m walk to time square and Bryant Park and 10m to grand central. We walked to tavola Italian restaurant and beer authority almost next door, both great as no restaurant or rooftop bar open yet at hotel. Bathroom was modern and clean, nice lines and loved refrigerator and coffee maker in room as well as large flat screen tv. It’s fine for a weekend but I would feel a bit claustrophobic in the room with a family and suitcases for a week. Breakfast we went out for as $ pp for buffet wasn’t worth it for small morning eaters. B/c it’s behind the train station area gets a bit sketchy at night but we were in group and felt safe as lots of other tourists also around. Recommend!

Aliz was a great find for our one night in NYC. We had tickets to Bruce on Broadway and waited until close to our show to book a hotel. The Aliz was such a great find. The check in was smooth. The entire staff were friendly and helpful, just awesome! I loved the view of the Hudson from our room. The room was clean and cozy. I would stay here again and again. I wish the 2 floor bar would have been open when we visited. Next time!

As a fellow worker in the hospitality industry. I have to say that I LOVED ALIZ and I will be back. Though I was only here for 1 night to celebrate everything was amazing. The day of check in was my bestfriends birthday and mine was the following day. The front desk was very accommodating by letting her check-in before me and we were given a room with two beds. The front desk agent informed me that breakfast would be included for a fee of $31 if we wanted it which was nice of them. We did not take advantage but will next time. The room was not very large but it was enough space for the two of us and the two other friends that came by just to hang with us before we went out for the night. I love the style of it very chic & luxury. The only thing is that I wish the bathroom was slightly larger. The mirror by the window and on the bathroom door really added to the awesomeness of the hotel. I feel that many hotels struggle to make sure us women have full length mirrors but this place is right on point. The overall service was amazing. One of my friends went to get ice and ran into one of the staff members. She mentioned that it was our birthdays and the gentleman offered to bring a comp bottle of champagne. WHAT A TREAT!! When he returned there was a door bell that rang. That was a wonderful added touch as well. I will definitely be back. I wish the team success. Keep up the great work, This hotel will be amazing once the restaurant opens and the rooftop. I cannot remember when it will but I am looking forward to it.
