review_body: Brand new hotel, boutique doesn't mean luxury though! No carpets on floor in room, hallway felt bleak.Restaurant and roof bar not yet open.Bed comfortable, didn't try breakfast.Some snagging issues advised to hotel.

We had an great overnight stay at the Aliz Hotel. Check-in was a little on the late side - 4pm - but the hotel is so conveniently and centrally located that we left our luggage at 2pm and took a short stroll to Times Square while waiting for the room to be ready at 4pm.The hotel is only a month old so everything still feels fresh and new. Rooms are comfortable and well appointed - not too small.Unfortunately they had some problems with the TV system - a number of rooms did not have TV - including ours. On check-out in the morning the front desk offered us a free breakfast to compensate for the TV debacle. Good customer service!All in all, I would definitely return for another short stay in Manhattan.

Although this is a cozy and beautiful hotel, operationally for a business traveler you have much work to do. As an IPrefer Elite member, I trusted the brand as a boutique, service oriented hotelier offering a certain level of experience per the IPrefer brand. Checked in to find my television was not working, the reception was very scrambled with sound cutting in and out. Staying for three days this would be an issue for me so I let the desk know and left for the remainder of the day. Returned at 9pm and nofollow up on the TV situation. Upon entering my room the tv still is not viewable. Visited the front desk and was told this was a hotel wide issue pertaining to the vendor. I asked this time to please follow up as to when it may be fixed and requested a room change. They are overbooked and cannot move me to another room until the next day and they are sorry. Ok...Decided to grab a cappuccino from the bar. (Bar is in lobby with literally four stools and about 8’ long) Great bartender but rowdy crowd and he actually helped me defer some handsy gentleman trying to buy me shots. Kudos to the bartender. He’s a gem. Go back to my room. Phone rings and Tiana lets me know the TV will likely be an issue and they will move me in the morning and she will give me a free breakfast. I informed her my rate included breakfast. Again she is sorry. Ok. Staff is nice but young and inexperienced...she didn’t know what my room rate even was. Hotel footprint is small so be prepared to hear your neighbors and the elevator all night. Comfortable bed and probably the nicest robe I’ve slipped on at a hotel, but with no tv to drown out the noise I didn’t sleep well. Wake up to take a hot shower in this tiny but gorgeous bathroom. I’m in for maybe three minutes and I notice the shower is not draining. Opt for dry shampoo and get out quickly as to not flood the bathroom. So much for a hot shower before my conference...Realize my blouse is a bit wrinkled and alas, no iron but only a steamer. Ok. Let’s give that a try. As others mentioned this is a tight room. Nowhere to really properly hang anything to steam it and the short cord doesn’t make it much easier. Now I have a semi-wrinkled water spotted blouse. Go to outfit two. While changing maintenance comes by to inquire about my plumbing leak. I have no leak but I’m sure someone else does. I tell him about the shower not draining and tv not working. He says he is sorry and will come back later. At this point I phoned the AC down the street. I’m silver with Marriott so hoping that may help secure a room. I pack up and go to the desk to try and cancel my next two days. Again they offer to put me in a different room later in the day and to have breakfast. No thanks. I already paid for that and I don’t have tune now to eat. I’m going to be late and need to figure out where I’m staying because I’m not doing this three days. I’ll take my business somewhere else. I needed a good nights rest, an operable shower and a tv that works. Additionally I could not figure out how to operate the lamp,sconces or track lighting. I’m pretty savvy but if it’s that difficult they need to provide instructions. Photos of scrambled tv and non draining shower. Again it’s all pretty but not operable. Staff is nice but all young and inexperienced. Billed me for half the night - but now when I look at the charge that is not correct either...go figure. They also do not have a roof bar or room service and only offer breakfast with a grab and go - $8 for water. Photos are of non operable tv and water filled, non draining shower. Walked down to AC and they took my bags and promised a room by midday. Scattered today but hoping for a better stay there.

Stayed at Aliz overnight. My sister, 10-year old niece and my 4-yr old daughter had a girls' night after taking them to see Frozen on Broadway. The hotel is conveniently located 4 blocks away from the theater. The hotel is new and nicely designed. Loved the croc skin wallpaper/background in the elevator which was consistent with the room decor. Loved all the mirrors in the room. The girls loved the bed and the sliding door with dual mirrors to the all-marble bathroom with great toiletries. The room size was ample. Since we stayed just 1 night, we didn't have suitcases which I imagine would take up space in a cozy room. Views were great as well. One thing I would've loved to have seen is bottled water in the room. Otherwise, we'd recommend this hotel especially if you're looking to be in the heart of NYC.

review_body: Love the style and how clean the hotel was. The location isn't really Times Square, but not bad at all. I love it, but I wish the roof top bar was open that would have been awesome. The rooms were small but very clean. We checked our luggage and they had some miscommunications but they allowed me to look for it myself and I found it. I think these are kinks for them to work out, as it is was just opened.

Stayed overnight for a girls weekend. Convenient location to theatre district. Rooms were small but were designed to maximize the space. Very clean and modern. Had a problem with valet when we first arrived but we were patient as we knew they were a new hotel. Offered a glass of wine for our whole party when we checked in. Due to the problem with valet, they sent a bottle of wine to both rooms. Checkout was busy but again they are new and it was marathon weekend. Staff was courteous. Would definitely stay here again.

The staff were polite but a few more smiles and greetings would have added some warmth to our stay. Our room was clean though a bit tight for someone with huge suitcases. Mirrors were ample and the TV was huge. We stayed for four nights and walked everyday to go sightseeing - to Times Square, Theater District, Central Park, and shops on 34th.

Teething Problems continue A review below quotes teething problems which are still evident. Staying here for 9 days and currently have 5 to go. Great location and staff friendly especially housekeeping staff. However the system they have for housekeeping is quite strange. Travelling with another couple they had their room serviced on first day and we didn’t. Asking at reception we were informed we didn’t request it. Well our friends didn’t either. The repose was they must have done with the light system on the door. I have since learnt green means service. Red DND and off is when the cleaning staff change it to when room is done. Not advised of this on check in Great if it works. You will come back after a long day. Room not serviced and both of us have had to wait in two occasions downstairs while rooms cleaned. Next is housekeeping will knock on your door while sleeping asking if you want your room cleaned after they had cleaned it. Seems they don’t understand their own system. Reception and housekeeping because both don’t understand when you ask how to fix the problem. Rooms are clean but small. Asked on check in if there are bigger rooms and told know. There are slightly bigger rooms we have seen them when doors left open.I think the reception staff think we are cereal complainers. We are not. But they look at us when we apprisch like we are Continplating if we should check or early Trevor Wilson

We stayed as a family of four for five nights at the Aliz. Lovely hotel in close proximity to Times Square directly over road from Port Authority bus/tube station. As our visit was for our 10th wedding anniversary and our daughters upcoming 18th, I had emailed the hotel asking for a room with a nice view for which I received an automated reply. I was slightly disappointed they didn’t consider my request and we got a room overlooking the building behind the hotel but it was worth a try. The hotel is very impressive decoratively and the rooms are lovely, although a tight squeeze for 3 adults and a child however most hotels seem to have the same limited space. Beds were possibly the comfiest I’ve ever slept on and our room was cleaned daily when we requested this by pressing a button in the room. Sometimes the standard wasn’t the same I.e floor not swept/coffee etc not topped up. Also disappointed there was only one dressing gown supplied for four guests because again, the comfiest dressing gown ever so we ended up fighting over it! Not a great deal of storage space but we managed and only a few hangers in the wardrobe so maybe take a few extra. We didn’t get a lot of information on check and I hadn’t been made aware of the $75 per night deposit as it wasn’t on the hotel info when I booked but this may have been the agents issue rather than the hotel. Check out was great and we left our luggage all day until we left for our flight. Would highly recommend this hotel for anyone looking for a deluxe stay at a competitive price.

Aliz is an excellent hotel, very quiet with a warm ambience, a few blocks from Times Square and theatre district. Doorman and staff are very welcoming. The overall decor throughout the hotel is soft and elegant. Tables are well laid out in restaurant, and many outlets for laptops/phones; with excellent choices for breakfast. Bedroom on high floor with great view. King bed is extremely comfortable and I love the plush bathrobe. Bathroom amenities top notch. Once I learnt from staff how to control the switch for the levels of lighting on the wall behind the bed then it went all the way down from bright to dim to no lighting. Had a great night's sleep in a pitch black room with room darkening shades, and no noise.  Good size desk in bedroom with a large flat screen TV above it are excellent to catch up with work, and relax afterwards at the end of a working day. Cannot wait to see the new rooftop lounge on 40th floor when it opens as I'm told it willhave sweeping river views. Yes, I will return, and recommend.

just spent 4 nights at this hotel its in a perfect location walking distant to all that new york has to offer or hop on the subway we were fortunate enough to be upgraded to the 39th floor with wonderful views of the city yes the window is small but you still have an amazing view it was quiet and no noise from the street which is a plus in nyc every member of staff we came across were fantastic i could go on forever about the aliz and how perfect it was but i will end with if you book this hotel you wont be disappointed i definatley will be back thank you aliz and your staff for the best trip to nyc ive had

My daughter and I stayed at this hotel for 6 days during opening week. Although they were nice enough to check us in early, since they were not fully occupied, they gave us a room that was already occupied! Then at night, while we were sleeping, someone else walked into our room!! Apparently they had alotted the room to someone else as well!! Key cards were required for the lifts, but they did not work, and we had to keep asking one of the staff to use their access cards to punch in our floor in the lift. One day, my daughter's card was not unlocking the room; when she asked for another card they told her there was no booking under our name for that room and kept her waiting for an hour!! The room was not serviced/cleaned the first day, since the housekeeping staff thought it was unoccupied. We had to ask them to get the room cleaned. The staff are nice enough, but very lost and disorganized. The room itself was decent with two queen beds and a tiny bathroom. Everything was clean and well maintained, since it was all new. Breakfast was not included in the room rate and although they did serve breakfast, it was steep. The hotel is conveniently located, close to Times Square.In all it is a decent place to stay. Were it not for the hiccups, I would not mind staying there again.

Firstly this review is critical because I have based it on what I would expect if I paid the same for a hotel somewhere else, hotels in New York are beyond expensive and I don't think travellers should settle for anything less than exceptional at these prices. And if people just keep giving 5 star reviews saying its acceptable because it is New York hotels will just keep charging more. With that out of they way....Overall the hotel is clean comfortable in a decent location to get around and the staff are pleasant. If your going now or soon then great you will benefit from the newness but I think once that wears off there wont be that much going for the hotel.You won't regret staying here or even have a bad time but I would probably only stay here if you get a great rate as there are too many other good hotels to choose from.Firstly as with all photos they are deceiving this hotel is tiny. The reception and the bar are opposite each other in the same open space and the rooms are very small (covered later). Don't let this put you off but just be aware its not a "grand" hotel.Location:It is within walking distance to most touristy must sees we only used the metro twice and walked everywhere else. It is within walking distance (10 minutes) of Penn station too if your getting the train from Newark so this was good.The street is behind the bus station so there are a few homeless people around but it is a busy street and you shouldn't feel unsafe they are just unfortunate people without homes they are not going to bother you. As for the probation office I didn't even notice it was there.The Room:The rooms are tiny, big enough for two people but just be prepared they are much smaller than the photos look and you might struggle with more than one big suitcase.I'm not sure I would pay for deluxe as the only difference is the higher room. The window is small and in the corner of the room so you don't really benefit from the view unless you go stand by the window. In my opinion its probably not worth the extra cost, especially once the rooftop opens.The beds are comfortable, the pillows are good and the towels are really soft. The wardrobe needs more hangers and the clothes steamer is pretty useless, they really should provide an iron at least on loan from reception.What I did find a little weird was the bedding. It consists of a very light duvet sandwiched between 2 sheets. It is not enclosed at all so inevitably it all comes apart and you end up with exposed duvet and sheets everywhere. Unless they are washing the duvet after each bed change its going to be pretty unhygienic .I would also say that the furniture in the room is pretty cheap and flimsy not a problem right now as it is new but I can't see how it will hold up over even a year. The blue indicator lights on the touch switches by the bed and TV are way too bright and they cant be shut off , I would imagine this will annoy a lot of people.Our room wasn't cleaned on one of the days even though we went out all day from 10:30 am.They had started providing water in the fridge on our last day and at $8 a bottle it must have some magical powers.Service:Firstly let me call out the guy who helped with luggage I think his name was Zakariy he was great.Check in and check out were fine just a little impersonal,it felt like checking in to a premier inn in the UK or travel lodge. The staff were nice but they didn't even ask if I had a nice stay. Surely they should be wanting feedback at a new hotel?Also I had mentioned it was my Wife's 30th (which they could see from passport too) and our anniversary and absolutely no notice was taken of it not even a well wish at check in. Again surely with a new hotel you want to impress guests?In summary None of the issues above ruined or even really affected our stay and hopefully the hotel will take them on board and not just reply saying sorry we cant please everyone.With a few tweaks here and there it does have potential but with the cost of a stay in New York I think the hotels should be exceptional not just ok.Would i stay again? Probably not simply because I would stay in a different part of Manhattan. Should you cancel if you have booked already ? No you will have a good time just make sure your expectations are set accordingly.

just wrapped 10 nights at the brand new aliz hotel. I actually got to be there during opening week. Yes, that means I was there to experience some of the typical bumps that come from opening week, but I also got to be there to witness the swift action taken by staff to make sure accommodations were made and needs were met.  Here’s why I’m loving this hotel: Great location - I like being close enough to theater so I can walk, but far enough way that I am not in the madness of Time Square. You’re also right near 9th which has some of the best restaurants!  Smart design - The rooms are so thoughtfully designed that you aren’t even aware of the size - I actually have no idea the square footage of my standard room, but it felt roomy, open, fresh, and modern. LOVE the bathroom design and the bed was super comfy - these are bonuses.  Details - I appreciate touches like a super comfy robe, a staff that gets to know your name, and toiletries from a top brand …. these are the things that make you want to come back.  Work/Play hotel - I spend a couple weeks a month in NYC so I’m always looking for my “home away from home”, but not a hotel that feels like a “work” hotel. Aliz has created the perfect blend of feeling like home, while inviting you to play and enjoy the city.  By the time I left the hotel I could feel like it was finding it’s groove and had worked out some of those kinks. Looking forward to seeing how things are when I’m back in November

review_body: You can't ask for anything else (except maybe bottled water in the room). In the lobby they did offer free cucumber lemonade which was refreshing. Breakfast buffet was great (lots of fruit) though a little expensive.The staff were great especially Melissa at the front desk and Zakariy who helped us with our luggage. The shower in the bathroom was really nice too. Our room had a great view! When the rooftop bar is open (in Decemeber) it should be a spectacular view.

We just got back from a 2-night stay.THE GOOD: I purposely try to stay at newly-opened hotels (less wear and tear, less chance of bedbugs and dirt and usually a lower opening rate) so this fit the bill. The location is good - everything you need is right there and its an easy walk to the subway and everything else. As previously mentioned, the walk in from 7th is somewhat seedy - as there are already 4 hotels on this street between 7 and 8th, I'm sure things will improve down the road. Either way, it didn't bother us and I felt very safe walking in alone at midnight after the theatre. Every single staff member we interacted with where polite and friendly, they were all great representatives of this hotel. Our standard double room was typical NY small - not a shock and more than enough room for the two of us. Standard of furnishings/finishings was high, bathroom very nicely fitted with the best towels I've ever used, toiletries were U.S.-made and very nice. Shower powerful with good hot water. The small fridge was a nice perk. We did not use the F&B services but the breakfast buffet spread did look very good, it was just too expensive for us ($30 pp). We had no problems with noise, the street was quiet and we heard nothing from adjoining rooms or the hall, it was a good night's sleep both nights. The thermostat worked better on the second night than the first - too hot the first night, perfect the second. All building work appears to be completed and we saw/heard no construction work at all.THE BAD: The lobby entry is somewhat dangerous because its all clear glass and you have to take a minute to figure out what is a door and what is a window. The elevators are horrible - surprising for a new-build hotel. There is no indicator light on each floor to let you know where each car is, they are way too slow and as usual in NYC there is not enough of them. The room was very dusty - I even dusted myself and the next day, it was just as bad!. The lighting in the room is wonky - we couldn't turn off the headboard lighting and had to sleep with it on. The light on the desk turned on/off when it felt like it. Both of us felt the mattress already had a "pit" in the middle. A close inspection of the bathroom shows the shoddy workmanship - mortar not smoothed over properly in the shower, etc. and poor grouting of the tiles. Cleanliness was an issue - there were way too many hairs on the bathroom floor and it looked like the sink was stained. The window does not open. There were only two coat hangers in the closet. There is no iron or ironing board, just a steamer which I find generally don't work.Overall, this was a good stay, no real serious complaints but as there are so many options in this city, I'm not sure I'd stay here again unless the rate was good.

Keep in mind this is a brand new hotel which comes with pros/cons. Pros being very clean newly designed rooms and common areas. Cons mainly being the pending contruction in the amenity areas and very small guest rooms. This was my husband and I first trip to NY and we are overall satisfied with our hotel choice. We were within walking distance of several eatieries and entertainment options. The customer service is top notch and everyone of the staff was nice. Warm and welcoming. If you don’t care much about square footage of your room this hotel is definitely a perfect choice. We lucked up and got our room on special for a great rate prior to the grand opening but I can see rates going up soon due to the luxuriousness of the hotel and the manhattan location. Whenever we visit again we will definitely book at the Aliz!

I know this is New York but the room was so small I could hardly open my suitcase. This is ridiculous.Service overall was not good with the execption of the bellboy who was great.Lighting at night is annoying, the blue lights cannot get way. I had to put my pillow to hide it

Walking into this hotel I felt very welcomed. The staff was friendly and very accommodating. The sleek design of the lobby felt very inviting and having the hotel bar right there added to the atmosphere. The rooms were wonderful. The beds were very soft and cozy. I slept great! I loved the bathrooms modern design and the beautiful marble showers were exquisite. I'd def stay here again!!

review_body: Stayed two nights on business day after the official opening.Let’s start with the location, it’s Hell’s Kitchen as opposed Times Sq. Seedy section of cross street adjacent to Port Authority Terminal. Arrived about 6.30pm, homeless people and vagrants sleeping on street near hotel entrance.Hotel is adjacent to a Department of Corrections parole office with early morning lines down the street of the DCC Parole office ‘customers’....say no more as say it’s all. Not very welcoming.On check in I was advised due opening day previously no room service available. They could order me in from a deli But I’d have to pay cash....don’t travel with cash to The US aside for change for tips.Got to my ‘complimentary’ upgraded deluxe room which was the size of a postage stamp. At 6’3 I just about fitted in. Room is of course new and all fixtures and fittings very good, just can’t swing a cat in the room. Nice little mini bar with nothing in it? Asked for iron and ironing board to press shirt for following mornings meeting to be told don’t have but do have a steamer in room.....oh I laughed at the hair dryer shaped and sized machine they call a steamer that did nothing....just as well I do iron my shirts before a trip so hung up to let creases drop overnight.Let’s talk the internet that didn’t work for two days I was there? Had to use my UK data plan and connect to iPad via WiFi iPhone hotspot. Complained 1st morning and told it would be sorted that day as engineers on site. Got back from meetings at 5, went to room, no internet. Went down to complain again but told by different duty manager no issues and no one else had complained?!? Really I said....was offered a $50 F&B credit for my inconveniences so far. I changed and went down to the restaurant to get something to eat....hey it’s not open in the evening! Decided to go to rooftop bar for drink....guess what? Not open.....Got up early last day to check out at about 5.30am to avoid crowds as had business breakfast across town at 8. Check out took forever as systems weren’t working! Finally got a copy of my bill and no credit applied. Advised would be done retrospectively. Signed and left.Ultimately, appalling the services that were not available - this was not a ‘pre opening’ hotel stay - opened officially day previously....if you stay in a pre opening phase you expect things not to work or be available etc...that’s the point of a pre opening....when you open you open and expect services as advertised. Trades description springs to mind....Inconsistent staff. Lack of service, non Times Square location, tiny rooms. Once was enough for me. Hopefully when they sort their act out on services will be an acceptable tourist hotel, for the business traveller move on.

Clean hotel, friendly staff and perfect central location for our two day stay. Some teething problems given that it's a new hotel around the lifts times, concierge and room keys being deactivated before end of our stay.

Although there are some growing pains as this hotel just opened, overall the stay was great. We stayed on the 2nd official day of its opening. Angelique must be commended as she was able to rally after a co-worker gave away our balcony room after waiting 3 hours to check-in. We were still able to check-in at the advertised time of 4pm. Zachary and Nelson the two doormen were very hospitable and pleasant. The room itself was in great condition. The bed was one of the most comfortable I have ever experienced in a hotel. Location to Time Square and Broadway is great add-on. I will say a few minor constructive criticism would be having water readily available in the hotel. We have stayed a few times in NYC and that seems to be customary more and more. Also because the hotel just opened there was still a lot of construction happening on the floors. Either the rooms are paper thin walls or there was just so much construction. Either way it was rather noisy 8am wake-up call. I'm sure everything will work itself out though and this will become an elite hotel to stay in.

Went this past weekend with my family and stayed two nights. My room was on the 36th floor and the view was breathtaking. Beautiful view of the city and Times Square. Staff was friendly and very helpful. Stayed in a single king bed room and it was fantastic. The modern look of the rooms and the bathroom truly made you feel like you were staying in a high end hotel. Definitely recommend to anyone looking for a gorgeous place in Times Square.

Loved staying at the brand new Hotel Aliz! The UNBELIEVABLE central location allowed us to explore town by walking to best Broadway shows, bars, restaurants and great shopping. This boutique hotel has a gorgeous lobby with beautiful details to everything. Worked on my computer while eating a delicious breakfast,(free wifi and tons of USB ports everywhere) in the restaurant. Hotel team is super friendly and professional, and they went above and beyond to make our stay wonderful. Really enjoyed the elegantly decorated and immaculate clean rooms with SUPER COMFORTABLE beds. Luxurious sheets, pillows and comforters (slept beautifully and was recharged for the next day). Very thankful for the Keurig machine in the room. The marble bathrooms were filled with, great soaps, shampoo, conditioners and lotions(felt like I was in a spa with the comfy robe hotel provided and the super fluffy towels). Super fast elevators got me to the quiet 30th floor in a flash. Had a beautiful view of Manhattan. Free Peloton bikes for exercising was wonderful.Our stay was delightful and filled with wonderful memories. A great hotel if you are looking to be in the heart of New York City.

Stayed here with my family. Loved that the gym has brand new Peloton bikes and I don't have to pay extra. The staff is professional. The restaurant is very spacious and a fun space to hang out or do work. Very new and chic! I would definitely recommend.

Wish I could've stayed more than one night. From entrance into the lobby to checkout, everything was top notch. The customer service and promptness of service was amazing. Staff were very pleasant and the rooms were spotless with all the needed amenities and the city view is awesome,could see the Statue of Liberty. Convenient location as well.

Stayed in this hotel soon after it opened. It’s absolutely gorgeous! Definitely my new favorite hotel in NYC. Great location right in the middle of everything. I had an amazing view of the Empire State Building from my room!! (See pic). The hotel itself is brand new and is loaded with cool features. There are USB ports all over the place so I could charge all of my devices at once. I am definitely going back to Aliz the next time I’m in NYC!!

Lovely brand new hotel. The views are outstanding and the staff was extremely nice. Any kinks that needed to be ironed were done promptly and with a smile. I especially loved all the technology in the room - USB ports everywhere, cove mood lighting around the bed, heat lamp in the bathroom, and automated temperature control. My favorite thing may have been the bathrobe though - the SOFTEST ever. I was really tempted to steal it!!

This is a brand new hotel, and you really can tell. Everything is pristine from the gorgeous entry lobby to the spotless rooms to the amenities. A leather-walled elevator brings you to one of the many high floors, which have rooms that offered unbelievable view of NYC. Once in the rooms, everything is first class. The beds and pillows are soo comfortable, and the little details, like dimming mood lighting throughout the room are really special. The bathroom was a beautiful white marble with heated floors and walk in glass shower. Everything from start to finish was outstanding. Would definitely stay again!!

Recently had a great stay at the Aliz Hotel in Times Square. Its conveniently located near many train lines and right in the area you want to be, just outside all of the craziness in Times Square. The views were amazing and the rooms were very modern with heated tiles in the bathroom and many other amenities in the room including a fridge! Looking forward to staying here again.

Great location, friendly staff, clean and comfortable room - I don't think you can ask for more! Bed was extremely comfortable and we had a phenomenal view of the city. I would 100% recommend this hotel and will most definitely be back!

review_body: The Aliz Hotel blew me away from the moment I entered until checkout. This new hotel has exactly what you need for your stay in Times Square. The lobby is inviting, the staff helpful and accommodating, and the views are top quality. The rooms are comfy and beautifully designed and the high tech functions are amazing. I would absolutely recommend the Aliz Hotel to anyone looking for a great hotel experience in the area. PS- The bath robes are to die for

Wonderful experience! My girlfriend and I spent a night being tourists in our own city and the Aliz Hotel was the perfect place to stay. Courteous and helpful staff, great accommodations, amazingly comfortable beds and a view was to die for! Right in the heart of it all - a great stop for visitors to NYC.

The Aliz hotel was amazing. From the beautiful decor when you walk in to the super friendly staff who were more than willing to answer any question you had. Check in was very fast. The room was beautiful from the sleeping area to the bathroom. The windows in the room were nice and big so you had a great view of Times Square but with the blackout curtain were able to have a great nights sleep. Already planning my next stay at the Aliz hotel!

review_body: My experience at the Aliz Hotel was nothing short of perfect. From check in to check out they made me feel like I was number one. The staff here are very friendly and accommodating. The room was amazing; from the extremely comfortable bed, to the beautiful bathroom, to the views of the city. The hotel itself is conveniently located in the heart of the city with everything you can do only a stones throw away. I definitely will be coming back here and will be recommending it to everyone I know.

Hotel Aliz was beautifully decorated from the lobby to my room! The staff was very welcoming and very willing to assist at any moment. I would definitely return for another stay and I highly recccomned everyone to try this hotel experience!

Walking into the Aliz Hotel I felt extremely welcome and taken care of. Anything I need was already offered to me without me having to ask for it. The staff is very friendly, informative, and hospitable. When I arrived in my room it was quiet and anything I needed was already in the room and easy to find. The robes are to DIE for. Super cozy. I have never used Beekman 1802 before but their amenities are gentle and made me smell like magic. If you are looking for a luxurious place to stay in the heart of the apple, this is definitely the place to go to. I felt that I was very well taken care of here.

I stayed here for a weekend, the location is perfect! Right in Times Square, you can easily get anywhere in the city. The staff was extremely helpful and friendly, from the time you step foot in the lobby. It is such a beautiful hotel, a very high end luxury feel. We stayed in a king room, extremely comfortable bed and lots of pillows! Great bathroom with shower and bath products. Our view of the city was spectacular. Although it is in the heart of NYC, it is quiet and you do not hear any outside noise. Will definitely be back to stay here and I would recommend this hotel to anyone traveling to NYC!

My husband and I spent Friday night at the Aliz hotel and it was beautiful!! It was the perfect area for us to go out for a nice dinner as there were so many restaurants to choose from near by and there were plenty of options for us to go out after dinner. We decided to have a drink at the lobby bar which the most comfortable seating I've ever sat in and plenty of choices for an after dinner drink or a snack to bring back to the room. Our room was spotless and it was very clear that everything was absolutely brand new. Our room also had a beautiful view of Times Square! The staff was extremely helpful and friendly, there was always someone available to answer our questions. We would absolutely stay here again, and I look forward to it!

We are native New Yorkers and sometimes a staycation is perfect for a change in scenery. This hotel is beautiful, convinient and close to everything in Timesquare! The hotel is chic with fantastic views and VERY comfortable. The staff is professional and friendly. Will definitely be going back.

The Staff was super friendly, welcoming and eager to please. The rooms were beautiful, super clean and had everything we could possibly need (from Keurig Coffee maker, Hair dryer, to top of the line TV and lighting with dimmers. The beds were unbelievably comfortable. The location, couldn't be better. We were just steps away from the center of it all- Time Square. We would definitely stay at the Aliz Hotel again. I would highly recommend it to everyone coming into NYC both on business and for personal trips.

An amazing stay at the Aliz hotel. Everything from the friendly staff, luxurious rooms, and breath taking city views made my stay a one of a kind experience! Hotel is an easy walk to the heart of NYC with restaurants and bars within a few feet. I would definitely come back again!
